Job_Title: Sr. Data Science Manager - SQL, Postgres
Description: If you are a Data Science Manager with 3+ years of R or Python experience, please read on!We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team. You will lead a team of Data Scientists, and play a pivotal role in building out and supporting our new API division through the development of data matching, customer profiles and business profiles. Our team is comprised of Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Business Intelligence Analysts that use our vast and growing data to support and enhance our data and ML models that power our products and decision making. You will use your understanding of modeling, architecture, scaling, and leading people to contribute to the future of data at our company.Our problems are open-ended and dont always have clear paths and solutions. We understand the workflow from a high level, and that context helps us build the right solutions. This is where your unique skills and interests come into play. We are looking for someone who is driven, with a strong intellectual curiosity of understanding challenges and problems, works well cross functionally, and can provide actionable insights and solutions. We look for people who take pride in their work, execute on it, and deliver phenomenal results.What You Will Be Doing Lead and grow a team (2-4) of Data Scientists Develop and implement algorithms for cleaning, integrating, and evaluating large datasets from multiple disparate sources Learn and understand a broad range of our data resources and know when, how, and which to use and which not to use Collaborate with cross-functional teams from Data Engineering, Engineering, and Product to understand current processes and improve our data Wrangling and modeling data from multiple data sources including Snowflake, AWS, and SaaS tools Identifying and understanding source data systems and become an expert of data architecture, sources and flows Provide mentorship and technical guidance to the Data Science TeamWhat You Need for this PositionMust Have Skills Masters Degree with an emphasis in Statistics, Data Science, or a related field 2+ years of people management 3+ years experience using R and/or Python (R preferred) 3+ years experience with Postgres, MySQL, or T-SQL (Postgres preferred) At least 3-5 years of experience working in an Analytics / Data Science environment Experience working with databases and SQL in a business environment Strong experience working with large and complex datasets Team-oriented, self-motivated, success-driven, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude Strong intellectual curiosity and demonstrated ability to understand and question the data Deep analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to turn data into insights and solutions Strong ability to interact, communicate, present and influence within multiple levels of the organization Exceptional written and verbal communication skills Ability to be adaptable and flexible in responding to deadlines and workflow fluctuationsNice To Have Skills Prior SaaS business experience Experience with Domo, Tableau, or other relevant data visualization tool Demonstrated ability to deploy ML models that yield measurable results Experience with Cloud Storage and Compute: AWS (S3, EC2, and EMR) and Snowflake Experience with modeling and manipulating data using Apache SparkWhat's In It for You Competitive compensation and bonus structure Flexible time off 9 paid holidays Generous medical, dental, and vision coverage Flexible spending accounts (FSA) Short term disability insurance/AD&D/voluntary life Pre-tax commuter/parking benefit Wellness program Tuition reimbursement Vanguard 401k plan with the best fund options and the Roth/after-tax optionSo, if you are a Data Science Manager with 3+ years of R or Python experience, please apply today!Email Your Resume In Word ToLooking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:Andrew.Kraig@CyberCoders.comPlease do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : AK8-1563723 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***Andrew Kraig - Recruiter - CyberCodersApplicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity EmployerAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Description: SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST, PRODUCT PLACEMENT  $140K-160K + BENEFITS + BONUS WHEN APPLICABLE  SALT LAKE CITY, UTAH    Being able to predict best product placement to achieve higher ROIs than traditional advertising? If you're looking for data science work with media data, then we have the right opportunity for you.    THE COMPANY:  Harnham is working with a company who’s using AI to predict best product placement within entertainment (ie TV shows, movies, influencers). Within the past year, they have grown their reputation to being one of the strongest AI teams  around– revolutionizing media and AI.  THE ROLE:  You will be working end to end on developing deep learning models and working with both structured and unstructured data. This means – you should be able to own your data, clean your data, and write your own code in Python and SQL.  In specific, you can expect to be involved in the following:   Productionizing deep      learning models  LEADING projects       Being involved      with mentoring and progressing the team   YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:  The ideal senior data scientist will have the following skills and experience:   BS, MS, or PhD      in Computer Science  Strong deep      learning experience in INDUSTRY setting  Has worked on entertainment      type data (video, audio, text)  Python, SQL,      full stack data science  Have a history      of owning projects, mentoring, and review code      THE BENEFITS:  The successful senior data scientist will receive a salary, dependent on experience up to $160K. On top of the salary add in some fantastic extra benefits the candidates can receive like equity, performance bonus, and unlimited vacation.     HOW TO APPLY:  Please register your interest by sending your CV to Hillary Tran via the Apply link on this page.

If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.About Labs WGU Labs (Labs) mission is to accelerate the pace of innovation in education to serve a changing global economy and population. Labs invents, builds, and enables innovative education products and offerings that multiply the effects of WGU’s mission to have a transformative impact on higher education: to expand access, improve quality, and optimize student outcomes. Leveraging advances in cognitive and behavioral sciences and emerging technology, Labs fosters innovation from idea through incubation, continuously improving student learning at WGU and beyond.WGU Labs contains two entities: The Center for Applied Learning Science (CALS) and Studios. CALS develops learning applications leading to educational attainment and life-long success. Studios helps innovative education companies, both external and internal (CALS products), grow their impact on education. The Studio is an accelerator that provides support services to its customers/companies, including research and product support as well as business development services. These services are provided by internal Studio staff, CALS staff, and external mentors/consultants.For more information about WGU LABS visit: https://wgulabs.org /Position SummaryThe Research Scientist plays a critical role in WGU Labs’ culture of data driven continuous improvement. The successful candidate is curious, skeptical, technical, and detail oriented. An ideal candidate is also a continuous learner, working to improve their scientific tool kit and increase productivity. This role is responsible for working with other team members and clients, and conducting studies to validate research questions. The Research Scientist is expected to execute the full life cycle of a study, including conceptualization of an idea, primary data collection, accessing our database to obtain the data, data wrangling , performing the most appropriate quantitative and qualitative analysis and reporting the resultsEssential Functions And ResponsibilitiesPlan and execute research projects through design, data collection, analysis, and dissemination.Determine appropriate research methods including: implementations studies, qualitative research, secondary data-analysis, quasi-experimental studies, and randomized controlled trials.Collect, combine and clean data from multiple sourcesAnalyze data, using statistical software and techniquesDesign and deploy surveys using software like Qualtrics or Survey Monkey.Produce high-quality, client facing reports and presentations.Represent WGU Labs by presenting at relevant conferences.Knowledge, Skill and Abilities  Expert ability to independently define and conduct original scientific research.  Data manipulation using programming languages like SQL and Python.  Data visualization skills using tools like Python and Tableau.  Deep experience with qualitative and quantitative primary research methods.  Proven ability to lead research projects, including cost, resource, and schedule management as well as compliance and reporting.  Excellent written, oral, presentation, and interpersonal skills.  Successful history communicating research results and key ideas to lay and scholarly audiences; performed thought leadership in the field.  Ability to work in a collaborative team and maintain effective relationships.  S trong attention to detail and a feeling of pride and ownership over the quality of work product  Working Conditions  This full-time position would work in-office at our Salt lake City (Utah) headquarters , with a traditional working schedule (Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm MDT) , and o ccasional tr ave l Qualifications Required: Master’s degree in Applied Math discipline (Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, etc.) or related field  Required: 3 years of professional/project experience in scientific research (qualitative and quantitative)  Required: Experience in data analytics, including using programming languages ( SQL,Python ), and data visualization tools (Python, Tableau)  Preferred: Doctorate degree in related field  Preferred: Experience in higher education, and/or educational technology research #D&IAs an equal opportunity employer, WGU recognizes that our strength lies in our people. We are committed to diversity.

Why Qualtrics?Qualtrics is the technology platform that organizations use to collect, manage, and act on experience data, also called X-data™. The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action, used by teams, departments, and entire organizations to manage the four core experiences of business—customer, product, employee and brand—on one platform. Over 10,000 enterprises worldwide, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100 and 99 of the top 100 U.S. business schools, rely on Qualtrics to consistently build products that people love, create more loyal customers, develop a phenomenal employee culture, and build iconic brands. Qualtrics was recently acquired by SAP, and together we will accelerate XM and power the experience economy. Join us on this adventure that can open many doors! Join a company that is dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment.The ChallengeThe Sales Operations team is looking for someone to join Qualtrics and become an All-Star data master! You’ll oversee the sales data warehouse and maintain its health and efficiency, including the standardization of environments and research, and development of new applications.Responsibilities  Using your technical skills to build the data platform that connects our sales employees to the data they need   Building data models to aggregate and centralize the data that is critical to the understanding of our business   Architecting the solutions to warehouse our ever-growing data sets   Be responsible for troubleshooting and improving processes that enable data integrations between sales systems (CRM to CRM, CRM to reporting tools, etc)   Partner with sales leadership on structuring data for performance tracking   Bridge the relationship between CRM developers and BI analysts to improve the reliability of sales data   Ability to be flexible and adapt to changing work environments and prioritize high impact issues  Qualifications  Technical degree such as Information Systems, Math, Statistics, or Computer Science   3-5 years of experience   Strong algorithms, data structures, and coding background   Strong written and verbal interpersonal skills   High proficiency in MySQL   Experience with Tableau, SFDC, and/or SnapLogic (or other ETL tools) are preferred   Passion for data   What differentiates us from other companies:   Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours    Qualtrics Experience Program - $1,500 for an experience of your choosing (eligible after a year)    We take pride in our offices design aiming at fostering creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.    30 paid days off - 15 PTO + 5 Personal Days + 10 Holiday Closures (additional after a year)    On top of standard benefits package (medical employees and their families, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office    We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees  To learn more about what we value read about it directly from our employees Qualtrics Life stories

Job_Title: Analytic Consultant 4 - Compliance Independent Risk Management
Description: Job DescriptionImportant Note  During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume prior to submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application.At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. The team focuses on several key risk types, including conduct, credit, financial crimes, information security, interest rate, liquidity, market, model, operational, regulatory compliance, reputation, strategic, and technology risk. The group provides leadership, enhances communications, assists with problem identification and solutions, and shares best practices. In addition, the group provides an enterprise-wide view of risk, assists management and our Board of Directors in identifying and monitoring risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and takes appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.This Analytic Consultant 4 is a key position within the Wells Fargo Compliance Independent Risk Management Home Lending analytics team. The Consultant will develop processes, analyses, and reporting to support compliance regulations implemented under the Dodd-Frank Act.Responsibilities Include Communicate project results and recommendations to senior leadership to support our strategic direction in the regulatory environment. Think outside the box to lead the development of new analytical techniques. Analyze transactional data, that is being captured in Regulatory Data Repository (RDR) compliance database, for project work Spearhead the development of analytical strategies for developing insights from time series data captured within this data repository. Utilize traditional statistical regression techniques.Project work may require the use of leading edge big data techniques for analyzing unstructured contextual data in Home Mortgage's loan application process.Please Note  Based on the volume of applications received, this job posting may be removed prior to the indicated close date. If you do not apply prior to the closing of this posting, we encourage you to apply for other opportunities with Wells Fargo.Required Qualifications6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modelingDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills5+ years of SAS programming experienceKnowledge and understanding of databases and data mining techniquesOutstanding problem solving and analytical skills with ability to turn findings into strategic imperativesAbility to work effectively, as well as independently, in a team environmentKnowledge and understanding of analytical methods used in statistical analysis, modeling, and reportingTeradata experience5+ years of SQL experienceSolid critical thinking skillsAbility to positively influence, motivate, and direct diverse teamsDemonstration and presentation facilitation skillsMetadata management and data integrity skillsAbility to develop partnerships and collaborate with other business and functional areasOther Desired Qualifications Able to analyze complex situations, and create and implement solutions to best protect the company from Legal, Regulatory, and Compliance risk Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to manage multiple responsibilities and tasks simultaneously Proven ability to collaborate with others, initiate action plans, manage change, make high impact decisions, and complete challenging assignments Demonstrated experience in data projects 3+ years of experience in an advanced analytics function such as statistical regressions, correlations, variance analysis, trending, anomalies, etc. 3+ years of knowledge of Real Estate Lending business processes and regulations like TRID, HMDA, QM-ATR, and Appraisal Delivery Knowledge in data warehouse and all aspects of project life cycleStreet AddressIA-West Des Moines 7001 Westown Pkwy - West Des Moines, IADisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.Reference Number 5517952-15

If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.Senior Product ManagerIf you are passionate about making a positive impact on the world and want to be part of a growing high-tech company, this job is for you! At Western Governors University (WGU) we are building the technology to redefine how individuals gain the knowledge and skills required to achieve their goals and dreams. We leverage technology to create an exemplary student experience for online, competency-based education that is independent of time and place. We make a difference in the lives of our students! We’d like to consider you to join our team!Why You’re Excited About UsYou’ve read our mission and are eager to work with us to change our students’ lives . You want to be part of a diverse team and culture in a fast growing, industry-changing technology company. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including healthcare, HSA/FSA, employee and family tuition discounts, and 403B with company matching options. Plus, we provide an employee development budget for relevant trainings, certifications and conferences, along with perks like monthly massages, game days and more. You’ll have access to several training and continuing education platforms, such as Lynda.com and Pluralsight. We believe in our people and work tirelessly to support them and ensure their success both within their product roles and through career development. Our product team is based in our Salt Lake City headquarters; however, we’ll consider highly qualified out-of-state candidates with a proven record of delivering results remotely – but you’ll miss out on the amazing culture, majestic mountains and year-round recreational opportunities across the Silicon Slopes!Things you’ll be doingInteracting with Stakeholders: Using our student-obsessed product approach, you will take ownership of ensuring we are delivering successful products that align with our future-state student experience. This is done in close collaboration with our stakeholders when building your product roadmap, defining business requirements, and developing a product strategy.Student Obsessed Product Approach: Our students are at the core of everything we do. As a product manager, you will be the voice of the customer. It is important to gather student/staff feedback about their expectations and experiences with our products. This may come in the form of conducting user groups, performing surveys, partnering with our UX research team, reviewing online communities, etc. You will focus on the needs, expectations, understandings and desires of the students to increase satisfaction and create products students rave about and our staff can’t live without.Executing Product Strategy: As the owner of your Product, you will work closely with the development team to execute product strategy. You will attend scrum ceremonies and fulfill the role of a product owner including writing epics, stories, and managing backlog refinement. You will represent the voice of the students to help engineers fall in love with the problem and envision the future outcome we will deliver. In our data-driven culture, as the Product Manager you will use data to make/defend prioritization decisions and measure the success of our outcome. You will be a domain expert on your products and work closely with other product managers to deliver cross-team dependencies.Evangelizing Products: You are the owner of your product! You will manage the metrics and ensure your product is getting the support it needs. From resolving technical debt, to asking for resources for innovation, you represent the best interest of your product. You will perform demos, help prepare training materials, make product announcements in conjunction with stakeholders, and represent yourself as a product expert. When you see how your products make a real difference in the lives of our students and staff, you will be able to passionately evangelize the benefits and value your products provide.Required QualificationsWhile we have high expectations for job candidates, we’ve intentionally kept our qualifications list short. A few preferences and must-haves merit specific callouts:Minimum 5 to 7 years of Software Product Management experiencePreferred QualificationsBachelor’s degree, Master’s preferred. Degree(s) in Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Business all a plus. Data Platform experienceWGU values and promotes diversity and inclusion and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. WGU recruits, hires, and promotes regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.# LI-JC1As an equal opportunity employer, WGU recognizes that our strength lies in our people. We are committed to diversity.

At Merrick Bank, we specialize in credit programs that assist people looking to build or rebuild their credit. We are FDIC insured and recognized as a top-20 issuer of Visa® cards. In total, we proudly serve over 2.4 million cardholders and have extended over $5.3 billion in credit.Our Mission is to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers, our employees, and our community. We work hard to create a work environment that empowers our associates to grow, learn, and reach their potential.As a member of the Merrick Bank Software Development Team, you will directly support our business-critical Risk & Credit Decision Platform used by Credit, Risk, and Lending teams. Work with end-users and stakeholders to understand & analyze problems, document requirements, and deliver technology solutions. You will be engaged in all aspects of Business Analysis and Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).Configure, support, and develop credit request application strategies by utilizing the credit decision engine and low-code platform. Create and maintain user-friendly business software interfaces for the decisioning processes and reports. Create and maintain business process workflows and business rules. Provide data and integration to third-party financial services.Required Skills, Abilities, Knowledge, And ExperienceBroad technical exposure with the ability to learn new technology tools and concepts quickly, with experience working on complex user applications2 years of experience using JavaScript, HTML/CSS, XML, JSON/REST, and web technologiesFundamental understanding Computer Programming concepts. Preference towards a formal understanding of Computer Science fields & disciplines (college degree, technical certifications, or demonstrable understanding)Experience with data manipulation, query language, and relational databasesAbility to understand and analyze complex problems and offer different solution approachesStrong verbal and written communication skills to present technical and non-technical information clearly and conciselyExperience with Business Process Modeling and Decision TreesUnderstanding of financial industry services such as bank cards, loans, and retail bankingAbility to work independently and in a collaborative team environmentAbility to meet and set appropriate deadlines set by manager and selfPrimary DutiesMAC (Merrick Application Control) is business-critical Risk & Financial Decisioning System built and serviced internally. This person must be qualified and competent to act as first contact and incident-responder for all user-related issues with Production MAC System and Third Party Data providersPerform initial programming and validation of rules, rule sets & process flowsAssist in the development and servicing for enterprise & application reportingWork with department stakeholders, end-users, QA, and engineering to understand opportunities and document requirements and specificationsPartner with the software engineering team to define, prioritize, track, and test user stories - preferably in an Agile software development life cycleCreate reports and deliver daily file output and data loads. Ensure data is generated, sent, and confirmed to respective clients and data providers/servicesProvide technical assistance and consulting in conjunction with others in Department for third party interactions with MACCoordinate internal/external ad-hoc data requests with planned workloadWhat’s In It For YouCompetitive salary (DOE)Benefits package -Medical, Dental and Vision (plus much more)401(k) Plan with Company MatchShort & Long Term DisabilityGroup Life and AD&D InsurancePaid Vacation, Holidays, and Personal DaysEmployee Events, including Employee Appreciation Day, Holiday Party, etc.Tuition Reimbursement ProgramRelocation expenses will not be sponsored for this position.Candidates must have unrestricted authority to work in theUnited States without sponsorship.Merrick Bank is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicantswithout regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability,veteran status, and other legally protected characteristic. The EEO is theLaw poster is available here: http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfmPlease go to our website www.merrickbank.com to apply and learn more about our companyMerrick Bank was founded in 1997 and is a top-20 issuer of Visa® cards. In addition, Merrick Bank is an authorized issuer of MasterCard® cards. Merrick Bank also provides finance options to Marine and RV Dealers throughout the country, helping to facilitate Boat and RV purchases for consumers. Merrick Bank proudly serves over 2.4 million cardholders and $5.3 billion in assets. Merrick Bank specializes in credit programs that assist consumers looking to establish or rebuild their credit rating. Merrick Bank is FDIC insured and offers Certificates of Deposit with a variety of rates and terms to fit your needs.Our Mission is to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers, our employees, and our community. We work hard to create a work environment that empowers our associates to grow, learn, and reach their potential.

Job_Title: Senior Director, Data Engineering and Infrastructure
Description: Who We AreSoFi is a digital personal finance company whose mission is to help its members achieve financial independence to realize their ambitions, whether that be to buy a house one day, start a family on their own terms or be debt free. We aim to be at the center of our members’ financial lives, and to help every member Get Their Money Right®. By joining SoFi, you’ll become part of a forward-thinking company that is transforming financial services by embracing technology to build innovative loan products, investment tools, and more. One of the fastest growing fintech companies, we’ve grown from 250 employees in 2015 to over 1,500 employees today, and are well on our way to reaching 1 million members. With offices across the US, we offer the excitement of a rapidly growing startup with the stability of a seasoned management team and some of the best talent around. As an employer, we strive to hire employees who are committed to both our company’s mission and our desire to build the best culture in the world. If you are driven, passionate about what you do, and excited about the SoFi mission, we would love to hear from you.The RoleWe are seeking a Senior Director of Data Engineering & Infrastructure to join the Data Team within the Engineering Department at SoFi. This is an exciting senior leadership role for someone to own, transform, and continuously improve SoFi’s Data Platform (consisting of production databases, data lake, and data warehouse) as well as Analytics & Machine Learning Platform. This is a great opportunity to make a huge impact on the course of the company that has data-based decisions a part of its DNA.Preferred location: Seattle, WA. Other locations: San Francisco, CA; Salt Lake City, UT; and Helena, MT.What You'll DoDefine an overarching end-to-end system architecture, vision and strategy to maximize the utility of enterprise data assets and enable & innovate a broad set of use cases.Define standards to support data governance. Maintain and scale infrastructure. Excel in telemetry to ensure operational excellence and resilience of the infrastructure.Lead enterprise-wide ETL & data engineering efforts.Take accountability of the company’s production databases to ensure their scalability, resilience, security and access control.Instill a plethora of industry best practices in the existing efforts.Lead growth of the team including recruitment and professional development activities.Train and mentor Product, Engineering, and Functional teams on topics related to data infrastructure and data engineering. Evangelize big data.What You'll NeedB.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.Management skills and 10+ years of experience with developing and leading data engineering and data infrastructure teams in a modern technology organization.Deep expertise in databases (Relational/PostgreSQL), ETL/data warehousing (Snowflake), data lake/big data infrastructure, and analytics/machine learning platforms with 7-10 years of relevant experience in the field.Expertise in AWS cloud technologies (S3, Glue, Athena, SageMaker, Redshift, DMS, RDS, CloudFormation, etc.)Expertise in Python/Scala, Kubernetes, containers (Docker, etc.), and configuration as code.Must understand scalability challenges; have hands-on experience in architecting scalable, resilient and performing-under-load systems;Ability to assess rapidly changing technologies and apply them to achieving business outcomes;Ability to interact and exert influence with all business and engineering/IT areas and leadership levels; especially Information Security, Compliance, Data Science, Application Development and Infrastructure teams; Excellent communication, collaboration, and leadership skills. Why You'll Love Working HereInspiring company missionAmazing work environment in San Francisco, CA or Helena, MontanaCompetitive compensation, including equityGenerous paid time offFree lunch and healthy snacksSubsidized gym membershipMedical, dental and vision insurance100% of health, vision, and dental premiums paid by SoFi for employees and dependents401K and commuter benefitsTuition reimbursement on approved programs, up to $5,250 / yearMonthly contribution to help you pay off your student loansPursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.SoFi provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, breastfeeding, and conditions related to breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age (40 or over), physical or medical disability, medical condition, marital status, registered domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military and/or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable state or federal law.

Job_Title: Data Analytics AVP - Healthcare Delivery Analytics
Description: Job ID: 242760Greater Salt Lake areaDetailsAbout UsBeing a part of Intermountain Healthcare means joining a world-class team of over 37,500 employees and caregivers while embarking on a career filled with opportunities, strength, innovation, and fulfillment. Our mission is: Helping people live the healthiest lives possible.Our patients deserve the best in healthcare, and we deliver.To find out more about us, head to our career site here.Job DescriptionThe Data Analytics Assistant Vice President defines and implements analytics strategy for Analytics function in alignment with system-wide strategies defined by the Executive Leadership Team for one or more of the major areas of focus for Intermountain Analytics (Clinical, Business, Healthcare Delivery, or Analytics Services). The Analytics executive has a broad portfolio and is responsible for leading analytics teams for a defined area of focus. This position oversees prioritization, budgeting, and execution of analytics initiatives. This leader defines the agenda for the area of focus and the Analytics Governance group. The AVP works collaboratively with senior leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups and expand to the organization. This leader is accountable for value creation of analytics within the portfolio. This key leader has a deep understanding of area of focus or related field. The AVP defines key analytics strategies in alignment with system priorities for each of the functional areas in their portfolio. As an analytics leader, this position is accountable for driving a culture of safety, accountability and engagement by ensuring work focuses on patient safety, creating a positive work environment, celebrating team's successes, developing new leaders and leading by example.Position PurposeThe AVP, Healthcare Delivery Analytics defines and implements analytics strategy for our Community Based Care, Specialty Based Care, Pediatrics, and Telehealth functions at Intermountain Healthcare. These are large areas with substantial operational analytics needs. This position will oversee prioritization, budgeting, and execution of analytics initiatives.Role will also lead operational analytics integration into caregiver workflows in order to drive efficiency and optimize our operations. This leader will define the agenda for the CBC, SBC, and Pediatrics Governance groups and work collaboratively with other senior analytic leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups. This leader will be accountable for value creation of analytics in their portfolio.ScopeThis key leader needs to have a deep understanding of analytics in a variety of Healthcare Delivery areas, including operational metrics that drive optimization and efficiency in our health system. The Healthcare Delivery Analytic leader will oversee Operational Analytics deployed at our 24 hospitals, our medical group, and 160 clinics. They will define key analytics strategies in alignment with system priorities for each of the functional areas in their portfolio. This position will report to Intermountain Healthcare’s Chief Analytics Officer. They will be responsible to drive adoption, define the product portfolio strategy in partnership with the Director of Product Management, and ensure data platform strategies are in place to support growth and needs for the future. They will manage relationships with key senior leaders at Intermountain, including COO’s for CBC, SBC, President of Pediatrics, and VP of Telehealth and several others. This role will have oversight of several data and information management leaders and technical professionals including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and BI Professionals, and more.Essential Job Duties 1. Works with Chief Analytics Officer (CAO) and other key leaders to define a vision and strategy establishing the major area of focus within analytics as a competitive advantage for Intermountain Healthcare. 2. Ensures that Analytics resources are being deployed to support Intermountain leaders and projects of greatest strategic value to the organization. 3. Deploys data and financial analysis to support our key strategic initiatives. 4. Develops financial models to assess the profitability of proposed business initiatives. 5. Maintains a thorough understanding of the competitive landscape, including industry trends, strengths, weaknesses, etc., to aid in identifying business opportunities. 6. Creates ad-hoc analyses to improve efficiency and drive organizational strategy. 7. Designs and creates management dashboards with key KPIs to measure and track success. 8. Monitors feedback and success metrics and provides recommendations on future courses of action. 9. Establishes a high-performance, high-engagement culture which celebrates and encourages diversity. 10. Reports the value and ROI of Business Analytics initiatives. 11. Identifies emerging practices and technologies such as machine learning, AI, NLP, to increase the value of analytic output. 12. Promotes data-driven decision making and a data savvy culture throughout the organization. 13. Leads key managers and directors in functional areas to deliver on service promise, key SLA?s, and ensures a high NPS for customers served. 14. Plans and manages the daily operations within the parameters of departmental operating and capital budgets. 15. Directs the work of employees for area of accountability, including staffing, goal setting, coaching and mentoring, employee recognition and training, and performance management to include addressing performance concerns through corrective action. 16. Manages customer, stakeholder, and vendor relationships and expectations. Focuses on solutions and strategies that create win / win situations both inside and outside of the organization. 17. Regularly communicates with staff through huddles, team meetings, individual one on one meetings, rounding and skip level interviews as appropriate, and manages resource allocation to projects to ensure timely delivery within budget and according to requirements. Posting Specifics Wage: commensurate with experience Benefits Eligible: Yes Shift Details: Full Time Department: Enterprise Analytics Minimum Requirements Master's degree in business administration, computer science, information management or Data-related field. Education must be obtained through an accredited institution. Degree will be verified.or Advanced Clinical degree (e.g., MD, DO, PharmD, MSN) with advanced training in analytics principles and processes, such as medical informatics. Clinical incumbents whose specialty require licensure (e.g. Pharmacists, Registered Nurses, Respiratory Therapists) must hold current state licensure. Ten years of related experience, such as analytics business management, legal, financial or information or IT management, recently at or near the executive level and related to one of the Analytics areas of focus listed above. Five years of progressive leadership experience in leading cross-functional teams and enterprise-wide programs, operating and influencing effectively across the organization and within complex contexts. Five years of experience in information-intensive industries or digitally advanced enterprises requiring a strong business enterprise knowledge. Experience in integrating complex cross-corporate processes and data models or designing strategic metrics and scorecards. Experience using word processing, spreadsheet, database, internet, and e-mail and scheduling applications. Experience in a role requiring effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.  Physical Requirements Interact with others requiring the employee to communicate information. Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands. See and read computer monitors and documents. Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment.  Preferred Qualifications Experience directly managing analytics teams in one of these areas: Clinical, Business, Healthcare Delivery, or Analytics Services. Operational or Clinical Experience in one of the areas of focus listed above. Experience with Product Development and Agile Development methodologies. Experience with Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence methodologies. Experience with applied advanced analytics to drive workflow enhancement. Master's degree in information management or Data-related field or equivalent Clinical Education.  Please NoteAll positions subject to close without notice. Intermountain Healthcare prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, veteran status, disability and/or genetic information.

Job_Title: Analytic Consultant 4 - Compliance Independent Risk Management
Description: Job DescriptionImportant Note  During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume prior to submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application.At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. The team focuses on several key risk types, including conduct, credit, financial crimes, information security, interest rate, liquidity, market, model, operational, regulatory compliance, reputation, strategic, and technology risk. The group provides leadership, enhances communications, assists with problem identification and solutions, and shares best practices. In addition, the group provides an enterprise-wide view of risk, assists management and our Board of Directors in identifying and monitoring risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and takes appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.This Analytic Consultant 4 is a key position within the Wells Fargo Compliance Independent Risk Management Home Lending analytics team. The Consultant will develop processes, analyses, and reporting to support compliance regulations implemented under the Dodd-Frank Act.Responsibilities Include Communicate project results and recommendations to senior leadership to support our strategic direction in the regulatory environment. Think outside the box to lead the development of new analytical techniques. Analyze transactional data, that is being captured in Regulatory Data Repository (RDR) compliance database, for project work Spearhead the development of analytical strategies for developing insights from time series data captured within this data repository. Utilize traditional statistical regression techniques.Project work may require the use of leading edge big data techniques for analyzing unstructured contextual data in Home Mortgage's loan application process.Please Note  Based on the volume of applications received, this job posting may be removed prior to the indicated close date. If you do not apply prior to the closing of this posting, we encourage you to apply for other opportunities with Wells Fargo.Required Qualifications6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modelingDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills5+ years of SAS programming experienceKnowledge and understanding of databases and data mining techniquesOutstanding problem solving and analytical skills with ability to turn findings into strategic imperativesAbility to work effectively, as well as independently, in a team environmentKnowledge and understanding of analytical methods used in statistical analysis, modeling, and reportingTeradata experience5+ years of SQL experienceSolid critical thinking skillsAbility to positively influence, motivate, and direct diverse teamsDemonstration and presentation facilitation skillsMetadata management and data integrity skillsAbility to develop partnerships and collaborate with other business and functional areasOther Desired Qualifications Able to analyze complex situations, and create and implement solutions to best protect the company from Legal, Regulatory, and Compliance risk Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to manage multiple responsibilities and tasks simultaneously Proven ability to collaborate with others, initiate action plans, manage change, make high impact decisions, and complete challenging assignments Demonstrated experience in data projects 3+ years of experience in an advanced analytics function such as statistical regressions, correlations, variance analysis, trending, anomalies, etc. 3+ years of knowledge of Real Estate Lending business processes and regulations like TRID, HMDA, QM-ATR, and Appraisal Delivery Knowledge in data warehouse and all aspects of project life cycleStreet AddressIA-West Des Moines 7001 Westown Pkwy - West Des Moines, IADisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a The Advanced Data Analytics team is currently seeking a passionate Senior Data Scientist to join their team. The Senior Data Scientist is responsible for data exploration, data preparation, delivering and operationalizing machine learning models. Additionally, the Senior Data Scientist will be a key interface between IT and other analytic teams and business units.  Role and ResponsibilitiesDesign and deliver analytics projectsApply statistical analysis and visualization techniques to explore data setsBuild, test and productionalize machine learning modelsMonitor and act on the execution and health of production ML modelsAcquire data from various data sources and perform adhoc data analysisImplement champion/challenger test (A/B tests) on production systemsPromote collaboration with other data science teams within the organizationQualifications and Education RequirementsBachelors in Computer Science or Mathematics or related field of study2+ years of Data Science experience in a professional settingExcellent understanding of various machine learning approaches and algorithms such as Clustering, Recommendation and Classification.Expertise with Python or RExperience with SQLDemonstrated ability to fail fast, regroup and improveExperience delivering solutions in a scrum/two week iteration settingEager to learn and apply feedback constructivelyAble to work independently with minimal oversight.Excellent time management and organizational skills.Preferred SkillsExperience with Natural Language Processing tools and algorithms.Experience with Deep Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow.

About UsSlingshot is a Utah based start-up recently recognized by Inc Magazine as one of America's fastest growing companies (#146!!!). Our headquarters is located in Orem, Utah, with At Home Slingers located across Utah as well as select surrounding states. We believe in a world where conversations matter, where technology enhances human interaction instead of replacing it, and where people can effortlessly connect with service providers that help home feel like home.Learn More At The gig: Slingshot is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to support finance, operations, sales, marketing & company leadership teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with leaders to improve business outcomes.Requirements What you'll do:   Work with leaders throughout the organization to identify requirements and opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions and ensuring the validation and verification of data used.   Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, financial models and business strategies.   Provide support to end users on standardized and ad hoc reports.   Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.   Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.   Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.   Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.  What You Need To Have  Bachelors degree in a business related discipline or mathematics  2+ years of experience in an analytical role and experience with large data sets   At least one year of experience in architecting, building, and maintaining BI environments   Expert SQL query writing, especially across multiple databases and servers   Experience with setting up and maintaining BI analytics tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, Domo, Klipfolio, Qlik, etc   Strong analytical and problem-solving skills   Significant work experience with SQL and report building   Advanced Excel skills   Strong communication skills  Benefits What you’ll gain  :  Experience in a fun, fast-paced startup environment.   A generous PTO allotment gives you the freedom to build the underground crime empire you’ve always dreamed of.   Health Care: Hang-gliding accident? Flesh-eating bacteria? We got you covered.   Data-Driven Workplace: Dashboards. Pie graphs. Acronyms. We’ve got it all.   Growth Opportunities: We’re growing. Like a fungus. You can be a fungus too.  401(k) Match: We’ll help you prepare for your future with the manic energy of a squirrel caching acorns.   Gym Membership & On-site Gym: Let Slingshot subsidize your quest to get fit/swole/jacked/yolked.   Fast-Paced Environment: Set up shop at the corner of amazing growth and exquisite chaos.   Stocked Breakroom, Cafeteria on-site: Never an excuse to be hangry here.

Lucid’s Strategy & Analytics Rotational Program Internship provides students with an immersive summer experience during which you will learn and apply skills across all aspects of strategic problem solving - from identifying opportunities to analyzing data, presenting results, and driving change.As part of your internship, you will split your summer across two different functions, allowing you to see multiple sides of the business and expand your knowledge and experience. The teams supported by analysts from the Strategy & Analytics team include Marketing, Demand Generation, Sales Operations, Product, Growth, Data Science, and Strategy. The tool set you develop and use will be similar across these functions, but each presents domain-specific challenges that will provide unique opportunities for learning.Although your day-to-day work will be with the function to which you are assigned, you will be well-supported by the rest of the Strategy & Analytics team. As an intern, you will receive special coaching and guidance working alongside full-time analysts who are also embedded within your assigned function. While the team is physically distributed throughout the office, we maintain close ties by holding weekly team trainings, daily working sessions, and regular team activities. We help each other whenever possible, and with the collective efforts of the full team, there’s rarely a question we can’t answer.Our mission is to make working visually easy and essential for everyone. And we hold true to our core values of: (1) innovation in everything we do; (2) passion & excellence in every area; (3) providing individual empowerment, initiative and ownership; and (4) teamwork over ego.ResponsibilitiesCreate a health score to identify at-risk accountsIdentify opportunities to accelerate product adoption at enterprise companiesFormulate a strategy for web and mobile usersFind ways to increase collaboration and virality of the productDevise and implement a “North Star” metric that represents users getting core value from our productBuild a dashboard to allow sales reps to target high-potential accountsCalculate the lifetime value of users to inform AB test and advertising ROIRequirementsCurrently pursuing a Bachelor's degree, ideally in a technical or quantitative fieldAbility and desire to develop the technical skills needed to work with large data sets (SQL, Python, R)Basic understanding of statistics and hypothesis testingStrong leadership and communication skillsAble to think strategically and tackle open-ended problemsDetail-oriented, organized, and a good team playerPreferred QualificationsPassion for problem-solving - If you’ve ever been so absorbed in a problem that your mind couldn’t rest until you figured it out, you’ll be in good company. Willing to be help and be helped - Our impact comes only through helping others make better decisions using data. We recognize that we’re stronger together - there’s no shame in asking for help, we’re not afraid to say “I don’t know”, and we actively seek feedback.Desire to learn - You’ll often be answering questions that have never been answered before, which requires a high level of intellectual curiosity and an eagerness to dive into new problems, domains, tools, and techniques.This position is intended for current undergraduate or graduate students who will graduate in December 2020 or later.At Lucid Software our core values aren't just a pretty inspirational wall hanging. These principles work hard, just like we do. Lucidites use them, every day, whether they're discussing ideas for new projects, deciding on the best solution for a customer's problem, or interviewing candidates. It's just one of the many things that makes Lucid Software the best company to work for. Check out our Life at Lucid page and see how our core values align with yours.We celebrate a diverse and an inclusive work environment, where we honor and support varying backgrounds, beliefs, and perspectives for the benefit of our business, including our employees and products. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace that has signed the Parity Pledge and strives to be a place where every Lucidite feels they belong. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Want to be part of a tech company that is changing the world for the better? Most companies have a mission statement. With Banjo you will know more, so you can do more. Imagine how our world will change when decision-makers know exactly what is happening, where it is happening, the moment it happens.The Data Analyst will be responsible for ingesting and validating various types of data to ensure accuracy and improve customer outcomes. improved changesUtilize Excel to manipulate data  and create an analysis of quantitative and qualitative data that synthesizes the key learnings from our customersExercise discretion in handling confidential, non-routine information and facilitate communication between appropriate team membersApply analytical and critical thinking skills quickly and accurately in a high-pressure situationProvide advisory services in innovative ways that demonstrate the power of the Banjo platform across highly-complex and ever-changing situations EDUCATION/EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree in of a teamOwner mentalityEffective time management, organization and prioritizing skills. Ability to manage and prioritize multiple deliverables and to meet deadlinesHigh attention to detail, able to complete tasks quicklyProven success delivering results individually and as part of a team in a fast-paced, demanding, high-growth environmentContinuous improvement mentality with an ability to evaluate processes, seek out and implement internal or external best practicesCreative problem solver with a demonstrated ability to ‘think outside the box’ when confronting challengesWORK ENVIRONMENTThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Job_Title: Senior Manager, Data Science - NLP Solutions Team
Description: About AncestryWhen you join Ancestry, you join our family tree. Backed by history, science, and technology, were creating a new world of connection, innovation, and understanding. Whether its reuniting long-lost relatives through DNA or unearthing new family stories from historical records, Ancestry empowers life-changing experiences. With over 20 billion digitized historical records, 100 million family trees, and 15+ million DNA kits sold, Ancestry is bringing the power of personal discovery to people around the world.We are growing our Data Science team globally. Were looking for a Sr. Manager of Data Science to join our San Francisco or Lehi (Utah) office. In this role, you will be responsible for managing a group of talented data scientists in both San Francisco and Lehi locations. Reporting directly to the VP of Data Science, you will be a member of the global Data Science & Machine Learning team, tackling our toughest and most exciting data science challenges.The ideal candidate will partner with product and platform stakeholders to identify/prioritize top customer opportunities, create business/technical requirements, and transform large volumes of data into statistical and AI-driven solutions using creative, cutting edge technologies.What You Will DoLead the team in using general data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence to drive product innovation, customer success, content creation, and more across our family history businessWork alongside multiple departments including product, platform and marketing to streamline AI efforts driving transformation across the companyHelp create and maintain a long term AI visionHelp champion a data-driven culture and push long-term business value creation through development of best-in-class data science capabilitiesManage, mentor, and aid direct reports in career progressionWho You AreMasters or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, or any data related field5+ years of hands-on experience in using ML and AI technologies in NLP and other applications3+ years of managerial experience in leading data science teamsExperience with NLP methods such as entity extraction, document classification, and topic modelingFamiliarity with deep learning especially in the domain of NLP: LSTM, CNN, sequence to sequence models, etc.Experience building deep learning models using tools like TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.Experience with a wide range of machine learning techniques Experience with cloud computing, particularly AWSProven track record of translating complex business problems into actionable research problems with high business impactExperience working on or managing projects involving large-scale multi-dimensional databases, complex business infrastructure, and cross-functional teamsProven track record of strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teamsDemonstrated success leading a team with a proven track record of delivering resultsExperience influencing internal and external decision-makersExcellent people leadership skills and a proven track record of developing high potential talentSelf-starter, highly motivated and strong ability to work well independentlyAbility to innovate and create new opportunities for Data Science to drive impact#GDSponsored#IND1Additional InformationAncestry is an Equal Opportunity Employer that makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, military or veteran status, citizenship, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. In addition, Ancestry will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.All job offers are contingent on a background check screen that complies with applicable law. For San Francisco office candidates, pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Ancestry will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Ancestry is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ancestry via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ancestry. Job DescriptionAre you looking for a challenging career in a fast-paced environment? If so, we have an immediate need of an experienced Data Analyst who will be responsible for the design, development, and support of data processes for MX clients. A successful candidate will continuously work to solve critical business problems and act as a SME to implement change management and drive alignment, efficiencies and optimization internally and with our clients.What You Will Do Profile internal and client data to identify relationships, business rules, transformation logic, and data quality criteria  Analyze internal and client data to identify insights and opportunities from the data that MX clients can use to solve critical problems in marketing, product management, risk management, and operations.  Develop and maintain ETL and database processes to support internal and client-facing reporting needs.  Design and maintain internal and client-facing data visualizations and dashboards using tools like Domo, Tableau, and ExcelHow You Will Do It Develop a solid understanding of MX’s internal data flows, databases, and tools used to manage large volumes of client data  Partner with MX teammates to design and develop data solutions that improve our ability to serve our clients and sell additional MX products  Partner with client teams to understand their data and most critical challenges to using MX data.  Integrate internal MX data with local client data to develop solutions for marketing, risk management, and operations  Partner with MX product and engineering teams to develop automated data/analytic solutions that MX clients can use to improve the customer experience, increase market share and profitability, reduce risk, and improve operational performance.  Develop training and orientation materials to educate end-users on reporting and data visualizationsWhat You Will Need To Be Successful Excellent communication skills and documentation skills  Deep experience using SQL, Python, and other tools to profile large sets of disparate data  Expertise to develop business rules, transformation logic, and data mappings to load client data into internal MX databases and processes  Expertise designing database structures and automated jobs to load and manage large volumes of data on a daily/weekly/monthly basis  Expert knowledge and experience with data warehousing and data marts in a banking environment.  Experience with a variety of data visualization and analysis tools such as Domo, Qlik, or TableauWhy You Will Thrive At MX You will think like an owner (having a “founder’s mindset”)  You will collaborate well with members of the Sales/Partnerships, Marketing and Operations team  You will bring your passion every day  You will be resourceful and creative  You will communicate with honesty, candor, and respectWhy You Will Love It You will have the opportunity to work in a successful, fast moving, mission-driven company  This is an incredibly impactful role in the organization  You will have autonomy and growth opportunities  You will collaborate with other creative and enthusiastic team members  You will be rewarded and recognized for your high-caliber work  MX has also offers competitive benefits and many perks including free meals and unlimited PTO

Company: Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco
Description: Summary Of PositionJob DescriptionThe Financial Institution Supervision and Credit (FISC) Division is looking for a highly motivated data analyst to work within the Technology (Tech) unit. The data analyst will work to improve and mature FISC data management practices towards the goal of ensuring data used for decision-making are trusted, protected, and available. S/he will work directly with FISC staff and management to obtain data from a variety of different sources - structured, semi-structured, and unstructured - ensure that they are in usable formats, and assure that they meet to data quality expectations. This is a technically-focused position and the successful candidate will translate business requirements into conceptual, logical, and physical data models and build data pipelines that extract, transform, and aggregate unorganized data into useful datasets.Summary Of FISC And FISC TechFISC is responsible for the supervision and regulation of state member banks (SMBs), bank holding companies (BHCs), savings and loan holding companies (SLHCs), financial holding companies (FHCs), data service providers, trust companies and foreign banking organizations (FBOs) that operate in the 12th District. Supervised institutions are located in all states of the District and range in size and complexity from small community organizations to some of the largest banking organizations in the country. The Large Institution Supervision Group (LISG) is responsible for the largest organizations under 12th District supervision.FISC Tech is a team of technology and security specialists embedded within the FISC division. They are responsible for lightweight technology development, including communication and collaboration sites, data visualizations, and proof of concept experiments; technology support operations, including on/off-boarding and access management; and information security.Job Responsibilities Develops and maintains technical documentation regarding FISC dataSupports the development of automated solutions that enhance the quality of FISC dataKeeps data sources catalogs, understand and document authoritative data sources, and access requirementsResearches internal and external data sources for new data and improved sources of data feeds, as well as data analysis tools/softwareMakes recommendations for process improvements in order to support data management effortsUtilizes strong communication and collaboration skills to work directly with FISC staff and managementResearches and applies Data Governance (internal polices and guidelines)Uses technology to extract, transform, and load raw dataHelps with Data preparationPromotes FISC Virtual Data layer useResearches System Data Management/Governance effortsResearches System Data related environments such as Big Data, Cloud storage and/or High Computing Cluster optionsDesigns, develops and deploys query parameters, layout, filters, and analytics for program information solutions Position Requirements And QualificationsBe a U.S. Citizen, U.S. National, or hold a permanent resident/green card with intent to become a U.S. Citizen.Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology or any technical related field, or equivalent workTypically requires 3+ years of relevant technical or business work experienceRequires knowledge of Data Management and/or Data Stewardship Knowledge of S&R data and proficiency in commonly used tools such as SQL, SAS, R, MicrosoftPowerQuery/PowerBI, Tableau, Tibco DVS, etc. or similar tools is a plusKnowledge of National IT/IMLT data management frameworks is a plusThe Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco believes in the diversity of our people, ideas, and experiences and are committed to building an inclusive culture that is representative of the communities we serve.The Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Job QualificationsFederal Reserve Bank of San FranciscoPrimary LocationCA-San FranciscoOther LocationsCA-Los Angeles, UT-Salt Lake CityFull-time / Part-timeFull-timeEmployee StatusRegularOvertime StatusExemptJob TypeExperiencedTravelYes, 5 % of the TimeShiftDay JobJob SensitivityTier II -
