If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.Senior Product ManagerIf you are passionate about making a positive impact on the world and want to be part of a growing high-tech company, this job is for you! At Western Governors University (WGU) we are building the technology to redefine how individuals gain the knowledge and skills required to achieve their goals and dreams. We leverage technology to create an exemplary student experience for online, competency-based education that is independent of time and place. We make a difference in the lives of our students! We’d like to consider you to join our team!Why You’re Excited About UsYou’ve read our mission and are eager to work with us to change our students’ lives . You want to be part of a diverse team and culture in a fast growing, industry-changing technology company. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including healthcare, HSA/FSA, employee and family tuition discounts, and 403B with company matching options. Plus, we provide an employee development budget for relevant trainings, certifications and conferences, along with perks like monthly massages, game days and more. You’ll have access to several training and continuing education platforms, such as Lynda.com and Pluralsight. We believe in our people and work tirelessly to support them and ensure their success both within their product roles and through career development. Our product team is based in our Salt Lake City headquarters; however, we’ll consider highly qualified out-of-state candidates with a proven record of delivering results remotely – but you’ll miss out on the amazing culture, majestic mountains and year-round recreational opportunities across the Silicon Slopes!Things you’ll be doingInteracting with Stakeholders: Using our student-obsessed product approach, you will take ownership of ensuring we are delivering successful products that align with our future-state student experience. This is done in close collaboration with our stakeholders when building your product roadmap, defining business requirements, and developing a product strategy.Student Obsessed Product Approach: Our students are at the core of everything we do. As a product manager, you will be the voice of the customer. It is important to gather student/staff feedback about their expectations and experiences with our products. This may come in the form of conducting user groups, performing surveys, partnering with our UX research team, reviewing online communities, etc. You will focus on the needs, expectations, understandings and desires of the students to increase satisfaction and create products students rave about and our staff can’t live without.Executing Product Strategy: As the owner of your Product, you will work closely with the development team to execute product strategy. You will attend scrum ceremonies and fulfill the role of a product owner including writing epics, stories, and managing backlog refinement. You will represent the voice of the students to help engineers fall in love with the problem and envision the future outcome we will deliver. In our data-driven culture, as the Product Manager you will use data to make/defend prioritization decisions and measure the success of our outcome. You will be a domain expert on your products and work closely with other product managers to deliver cross-team dependencies.Evangelizing Products: You are the owner of your product! You will manage the metrics and ensure your product is getting the support it needs. From resolving technical debt, to asking for resources for innovation, you represent the best interest of your product. You will perform demos, help prepare training materials, make product announcements in conjunction with stakeholders, and represent yourself as a product expert. When you see how your products make a real difference in the lives of our students and staff, you will be able to passionately evangelize the benefits and value your products provide.Required QualificationsWhile we have high expectations for job candidates, we’ve intentionally kept our qualifications list short. A few preferences and must-haves merit specific callouts:Minimum 5 to 7 years of Software Product Management experiencePreferred QualificationsBachelor’s degree, Master’s preferred. Degree(s) in Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Business all a plus. Data Platform experienceWGU values and promotes diversity and inclusion and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. WGU recruits, hires, and promotes regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.# LI-JC1As an equal opportunity employer, WGU recognizes that our strength lies in our people. We are committed to diversity.

About UsSlingshot is a Utah based start-up recently recognized by Inc Magazine as one of America's fastest growing companies (#146!!!). Our headquarters is located in Orem, Utah, with At Home Slingers located across Utah as well as select surrounding states. We believe in a world where conversations matter, where technology enhances human interaction instead of replacing it, and where people can effortlessly connect with service providers that help home feel like home.Learn more athttps //getslingshot.comThe gig Slingshot is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to support finance, operations, sales, marketing & company leadership teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with leaders to improve business outcomes.RequirementsWhat you'll do  Work with leaders throughout the organization to identify requirements and opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions and ensuring the validation and verification of data used. Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, financial models and business strategies. Provide support to end users on standardized and ad hoc reports. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes. Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy. What You Need To Have Bachelors degree in a business related discipline or mathematics 2+ years of experience in an analytical role and experience with large data sets At least one year of experience in architecting, building, and maintaining BI environments Expert SQL query writing, especially across multiple databases and servers Experience with setting up and maintaining BI analytics tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, Domo, Klipfolio, Qlik, etc Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Significant work experience with SQL and report building Advanced Excel skills Strong communication skills BenefitsWhat you’ll gain Experience in a fun, fast-paced startup environment. A generous PTO allotment gives you the freedom to build the underground crime empire you’ve always dreamed of. Health Care Hang-gliding accident? Flesh-eating bacteria? We got you covered. Data-Driven Workplace Dashboards. Pie graphs. Acronyms. We’ve got it all. Growth Opportunities We’re growing. Like a fungus. You can be a fungus too. 401(k) Match We’ll help you prepare for your future with the manic energy of a squirrel caching acorns. Gym Membership & On-site Gym Let Slingshot subsidize your quest to get fit/swole/jacked/yolked. Fast-Paced Environment Set up shop at the corner of amazing growth and exquisite chaos. Stocked Breakroom, Cafeteria on-site Never an excuse to be hangry here.

Data reconciliation of Enterprise Data Warehouse and source systems.  Monitoring change data capture tool for uptimes and record count validation.  Mentor junior members of the team. Ensure standardized coding practices.  Work with junior members on new AWS technologies.  Encourage AWS Certification training. Continuous interest in updating skill sets and knowledge of trends in the Big Data Technology space.Qualifications:What We Look For Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline; Advanced degree preferred  5-8 years relevant professional development experience.  Working knowledge of cloud architecture. AWS experience preferred.  Deep understanding of traditional OOP principles. Must have working experience in C#.  Strong SQL skills with deep understanding of complex SQL scripts.  Knowledge of Big Data technologies: AWS Redshift, AWS EMR, AWS Kinesis, AWS Lambda, Hadoop file system, Apache Spark, Apache Flink, Apache NiFi.  Experience working in an Agile environment. Pluralsight proudly creates the creators of tomorrow: the people who develop the technology that lifts the human condition. We do this through the tech industry's leading learning platform for serious Developer, IT and Creative professionals. Our team of 700+ innovators and disruptors are serving over 1M users in 150+ countries to conquer the tech skills gap.The OpportunityIris is Pluralsight's learning intelligence platform, an innovative and unique user experience, whose aim is to use data to create a smarter, personalized learning journey. It is cutting edge and a key component of Pluralsight's strategy. We are growing a team of people from multiple disciplines who love solving complex problems with data and are excited by the prospect of creating the brains behind Iris.As a data science intern on one of our cross-functional teams, you will help us solve novel statistical, machine learning, and data science problems by building and improving on the intelligence of Iris. We are looking for someone who loves tackling ambiguous problems, finding creative and practical solutions, and producing concrete prototypes that will become a key part of Pluralsight's user experience.Who You Are You are intellectually curious, collaborative, and highly driven with an entrepreneurial mindset. You have excellent critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills. You have a strong foundation in Machine Learning, Computer Science, and Statistics. You are proficient in either Python or R. Regardless of your favorite scientific computing environment, ideally you can flex between the two languages. You know your way around SQL-like databases (e.g. PostGres, Impala, Hive) and even better if have experience with Spark and other big data platforms. You can build data visualizations (Shiny apps, D3, and/or Tableau) that appropriately represent data and are effective in their purpose. You have a solid data science toolkit that you can leverage, with knowledge of and understanding of how and when to apply different algorithms and technical approaches. You can describe and speak in an approachable way about complex analyses and concepts within a cross-functional team. You are a great "analytic translator". You are currently pursuing a graduate degree.What You'll Do You will work closely with one of our Iris product teams to research, envision, and create quality reliable data science solutions needed to drive our user experience outcomes. You will conduct complex analysis to help us solve a variety of broadly defined questions. You will go end-to-end, from framing the problem, to building the analytical solution, to delivering results. You will build prototypes and/or re-usable tools to answer research or business questionsWorking at PluralsightFounded in 2004 and trusted by Fortune 500 companies, Pluralsight is the technology skills platform organizations and individuals in 150+ countries count on to create progress for the world.Our platform helps technologists master their craft and take control of their careers. We empower businesses everywhere to build adaptable teams, speed up release cycles and become scalable, reliable and secure. We come to work everyday knowing we're helping our customers build the skills that power innovation.And we don't let fear, egos or drama distract us from our mission. Our mission to democratize technology skills is what drives us and our values are at the helm of how we work together. It's our commitment to practicing them day in, day out that enables our performance. We're adults, and we treat each other that way. We have the autonomy to do our jobs, transparency to eliminate office politics and trust each other to do the right thing. We thrive in an environment with creativity around every corner, challenges that keep us on our toes, and peers who inspire us to be the best we can be. We bring different viewpoints, backgrounds and experiences, and united by our mission, we are one.Bring yourself. Pluralsight is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job_Title: Sr Data Architect - Data Warehouse and - UT5305337
Description: At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we're hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as Machine Learning, IoT, HPC, Batch-Real-time Data processing, MPP systems, Data Analytics and Business Intelligence.This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and database migration capabilities. The role is to help our customers and partners to eliminate technical and economic constraints from their legacy systems and help them to leverage their data to develop business insights. AWS Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about customer success. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.Responsibilities include:* ExpertiseCollaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, EMR, Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), S3, Relational Database Service (RDS)-aurora, and Amazon Kinesis.* SolutionDeliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, generating consulting proposals, contributing to internal Area of Depth (AoD) programs, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs-whitepaper and creating packaged data service offerings.* DeliveryEngagements include short on-site projects to assess and optimize customer's Amazon Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.Basic Qualifications* Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field* 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a highly technical and analytical role.* 8+ years of development and-or DBA experience in Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) including 5+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning MPP databases (Teradata, Vertica, Netezza, Greenplum).* Ability to drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation.* Current hands-on implementation experience required.* Analyze on-premise OLTP database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL and-or Postgres, as well as MPP analytic databases (Teradata, Netezza, Vertica and Greenplum).* Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance.* Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems.Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer .and.ndash; MinorityWomenDisabilityVeteranGender IdentitySexual OrientationAge

Have you ever tried to hire a plumber? How about a house cleaner? If you have, chances are it took you way longer than it should. In the era of instant-everything, it’s crazy that you still have to waste an entire afternoon researching, calling and vetting local service professionals whenever you need one. The market for hiring them is huge — $1 trillion in the US alone — but the process is inefficient and largely offline.Thumbtack is transforming this experience end-to-end, building a marketplace that matches millions of people with local pros for almost any project. In making these connections, not only do our customers get more done every day, our pros are able to grow their businesses and make a living doing what they’re great at.These customers and pros come from all walks of life and every zip code in the country. We want our team to reflect that. If you come from an underrepresented background in tech, we strongly encourage you to apply. We challenge ourselves every day to make this a place where you can thrive just the way you are, so we can build a product that does the same for our customers and pros.About The Operations Analytics TeamThumbtack’s Ops Analytics team is a tight-knit group charged with providing actionable insights for Thumbtack’s Go-to-Market and Operations teams. We collaborate with various groups across the company on a wide variety of projects; everything from click-level data from our online HelpCenter, to call-level data from our inbound support and outbound sales/success teams, to search- and conversation-level data between pros and customers from our product database.About The RoleAs a Senior Data Analyst, you’ll empower the various operations teams in Thumbtack’s Salt Lake City office to use data to guide business decisions. Sr. Data Analysts also collaborate with the Analytics, Engineering and Product teams in San Francisco on broader efforts where product and operations overlap, such as launching a new feature, determining customer/pro segments, crafting marketing outreach campaigns, and providing data-driven feedback to streamline existing features. You’ll be expected to quickly build technical and content expertise about our platform, as well as the touch-points through which the operations teams interact with our pros and customers.Responsibilities  Partner with leaders of Thumbtack’s Go-to-Market and Operations teams (i.e., Sales, Pro Success, Pro Engagement, Inbound Support and Trust & Safety) to conduct in-depth quantitative analyses that guide strategic decisions   Make recommendations based on detailed analysis and a deep understanding of our business   Build and maintain reports, models, and visualizations which provide insight into users’ experiences and business performance   Maintain SQL queries and scripts that underpin Thumbtack’s ETL data pipeline   Identify key drivers of core business outcomes through regression analyses and other statistical techniques   Contribute to our team and company data culture through peer collaboration, training, coaching and more   Must-Have QualificationsIf you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.  BA/BS degree, preferably in Economics, Statistics, Math, or Computer Science   Proficiency using SQL to query large datasets   Sharp business judgment and the ability to see past the noise   Strong communicator with the ability to explain technical results to a non-technical (and data savvy) audience   Experience with building dashboards in Tableau and Tableau Server   Passion for solving problems and driving business impact   Ability to detect and debug anomalies in complex data processes   4+ years experience working in quantitative or analytical role, preferably in technology, consulting, or operations   Curiosity to learn new skills and apply them in novel ways to solve challenging problems   Nice-to-Have Qualifications  Advanced degree (MA, Phd, MBA, etc) with an emphasis in data analytics   Proficiency with statistics/programming languages (e.g., R, Python)   Experience building predictive/machine learning models on large datasets -- from ideation to implementation   Familiarity working with product managers to vet new features and bring them to production  Thumbtack is a local services marketplace – one of the largest in the U.S. – that helps millions of people hire local professionals. With hundreds of unique service categories, customers can find a Thumbtack pro for almost anything: landscapers, DJs, personal trainers, even piano teachers. And in making these connections, we empower local pros too. Helping them get new customers and make a living doing what they’re great at.Founded in 2008 and headquartered in San Francisco, Thumbtack is backed by over $420 million in investment from Sequoia Capital, CapitalG, Tiger Global Management, Javelin Investment Partners and Baillie G ifford.  See what it’s like to work here   Meet the pros who inspire us   Follow us on LinkedIn    Thumbtack embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Job_Title: Statistical Researcher / Data Scientist I (Science, Math, Engineering)
Description: Position TitleStatistical Researcher / Data Scientist I (Science, Math, Engineering)Open Internally or ExternallyExternalIf faculty, tenure track statusNot ApplicableReports to (title)Manager of Data Science and ResearchDepartmentInstitutional ResearchRequisition Number19072Position TypeReplacementJob CategoryStaffFT/PTFull-timeStarting SalaryUp to $55,000 based on qualif.Job Open Date09/25/2019Open Until FilledYesPriority Review Date12/03/2019Job SummaryWe are seeking an innovative researcher with a knowledge base in data analytics and a desire to continuously grow and learn within a professional realm in order to create data-driven solutions that impact community college students. This full-time research position in the Data Science & Analytics department at Salt Lake Community College ( SLCC ) is for an applied statistician/data scientist with strong statistical programming skills and exceptional communication abilities, centered on visualization. The applicant should be skilled at explaining potentially complicated statistical results to non-technical audiences. The position requires a creative and detail-oriented approach to answering research questions using a wide range of statistical techniques from areas such as data mining, business intelligence, predictive analytics, machine learning, computational statistics, and the social sciences. Our researchers work very collaboratively, meeting weekly to discuss methodology and share. The applicant should have an interest in student success, some knowledge of higher education and a desire to learn and try new methods.The position is grant funded for 2 years, with the possibility of becoming an ongoing position thereafter. The funding is from the National Science Foundation to improve STEM education in the college of Science, Math and Engineering at SLCC . The position will focus on educational research to support that objective.SLCC is nationally recognized as a premiere community college in the western United States. The College is making an increased investment in its data and analytics resources as it transitions more completely to a culture of data-informed decision-making at all levels. The researcher will help with this transition and will have an important role in improving college student success in Utah.Essential Responsibilities And DutiesInitiate, plan, and complete research and analytical projects from requirements gathering, design & modeling, implementation, peer review and presentation. This includes developing and improving data collection systems, designing experiments by performing analysis of data, producing written summaries of clear, accurate, and trustworthy results for our college community, and possibly presenting findings in person. Perform slightly complex analyses, potentially requiring new techniques which you learn on your own or via others on the team. Execute these projects semi-independently with guidance and check-ins with manager. Produce approximately 1-3 projects per month. Engage in professional communication with project stakeholders and/or manager to ensure project goals are met and deliverables meet expectations. Seek to improve the quality of research the team produces by collaborating with other researchers to discuss projects and results, and engage in a high-quality, thoughtful peer review process. Handle grant reporting, as needed, by developing and maintaining complex reports using SQL or Cognos. Develop clear reports to help stakeholders monitor the progress of grant-related projects. Other duties as assigned.Preferred QualificationsMaster’s degree in a relevant quantitative field.Experience in community college or educational research.Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree in a relevant field and zero (0) to three (3) years of relevant, paid, full-time work experience.Knowledge, Skills & AbilitiesDemonstrated ability to conduct quantitative and /or qualitative research.Demonstrates commitment to and engagement in continuous learning to provide accurate results and approaches to analytical questions.Ability to perform advanced statistical analysis on complex multi-dimensional and hierarchically structured data, including using techniques from areas such as data mining, business intelligence, predictive analytics, machine learning, computational statistics, and the social sciences.Ability to access, clean and structure institutional datasets for analytics and research.Knowledge of a statistical computing language, such as R.Skill with data access and reporting tools: SQL and/or Cognos (or other business intelligence tools such as Tableau).Strong organizational skills. Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet project deadlines.Ability to focus the level of research commensurate with the stated need for the project.Ability to work with clients within the institution to refine analytical and research questions and, as necessary, serve as a data consultant.Ability to write clear, concise papers/summaries of statistical findings, analytics and data for a non-technical audience that emphasize visualization of results.Ability to present statistical findings clearly and convincingly to internal audiences, and, where necessary, to explain statistical concepts to non-statisticians.Effective communication skills and comfort working with different teams within the organization.Must be a creative and collaborative team player with the ability to interact with a diverse team and a proven history of accepting and giving constructive feedback.Ability to communicate effectively with a broad range of diverse people, ability, culture, ethnic background, to maintain good working relationships across the College.Ability to work with all groups in a diverse academic, socioeconomic, cultural and ethnic background of community college students, faculty and staff, including those with disabilities.Special InstructionsFull consideration will be given to applicants who apply on or before the priority review date indicated above.Salary Based On Qualifications.More information about Salt Lake Community College benefits: http://i.slcc.edu/hr/docs/benefits-summary-current.pdfCover letter requiredFLSAExemptSLCC InformationSalt Lake Community College ( SLCC ) is fully committed to policies of equal employment and nondiscrimination. The College does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability, religion, protected veteran status, expression of political or personal beliefs outside of the workplace, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.SLCC is a participating employer with Utah Retirement Systems (“URS”).This position may require the successful completion of a criminal background check.

Location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Description: The Biorepository Data Services Specialist supports research studies and research coordinators by locating, aggregating, and providing data associated with biological samples contained in the Biorepository. The incumbent works closely with Biorepository research coordinators to understand needs and requirements regarding research requests, then applies their understanding to deliver the requested data adhering to HIPAA and healthcare regulations. The incumbent provides consultation and support in the development, analysis, interpretation, and management of a variety of highly complex data sources to support operations, strategy, and increased throughput of Biorepository research project requests. Other areas of responsibility include the ability to learn and apply new techniques and patterns, minor programming, and hardware support.Essential Job Duties1. Provides research study data for researchers across all specialties.2. Prepares research data for analysis and performs the analysis.3. Understands and writes advanced SQL queries to perform:Feasibility queries for research project requests.Associate clinical data (historic and active) with biological samples.Data insertions, deletions, and updates reliably.4. Provides expertise in data visualization (charting, Tableau, Qlik, etc.).5. Executes data logic by associating distributed, disjointed databases into a single comprehensive record.6. Uses PL/SQL to execute functional/procedural details inside database.7. Demonstrates knowledge of how data moves through the healthcare system as it is gathered and then later retrieved.8. Demonstrates a professional attitude at all times.Core Essentials:1. Writes advanced queries using SQL or PL/SQL to provide feasibility of research project requests.2. Practices sound database (schema) upgrade practices by defining SQL scripts and coordinating and working with DBA's to execute scripts as needed.3. Understands logic provided by different applications supporting the Biorepository.4. Assists in database analysis for the modernization of the Biorepository.Additional Essentials:1. Learns new tools and techniques for extracting and linking data points.2. Demonstrates advanced level SQL, data extraction, and data association skills.3. Possesses an in-depth understanding of Intermountain data to be used in the Biorepository and associated data models and produces high quality results.4. Documents results/findings and gives reports accordingly.5. Understands the appropriate use of indexes, partitions, and Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERD's).6. Shares important and relevant information with the team. Proactively offers suggestions, provides resources, volunteers for assignments, and removes barriers to help the team accomplish its goals.Minimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in a related field and 2 years of experience in database design, data association, and analysis. Education must be obtained through an accredited institution. Degree will be verified.Advanced working knowledge and proficiency in SQL, database design, and statistical modeling.Experience developing, analyzing, interpreting, and managing a variety of complex data sets.Knowledge of database data collection, data quality control, querying, and reporting using database applications.Experience troubleshooting and repairing minor hardware issues.Preferred RequirementsDegree in an analytics-related field such as statistics, mathematics, information systems, computer science, finance, economics, or an MBA with an emphasis in analytics.If degree is not in an analytics related field, 2 years of analytics experience demonstrating proficiency performing the job essentials at this job level.Proficiency using statistical methods and tools.Proficiency using programming languages and tools.Experience presenting to a variety of audiences and coaching leaders, customers, and peers on data analysis best practices, trends, tools, and technology.Strong experience with SQL query tuning.Experience Programming/scripting (APEX, R, Python).

Our team builds platforms and technology solutions to model, source, and distribute the data including clients, accounts, financial products and prices to all of firm systems. About UsOur mission is simple: we want to set people free to do meaningful work. People love our software--and it turns out that people love working here too. We've been recognized as a "Best Company to Work For,” and we're proud of our team for receiving awards for workplace effectiveness and flexibility.What You'll DoWe’re looking for a Data Architect who can be the driving influencer on all things data at BambooHR. There are some architects whose main responsibility is to come into an organization and map exactly how everything should be built. If you’re that type of architect, this isn’t the right role for you. In this role, you might not be the one executing every idea, or deciding where every piece falls, but instead, you’ll act as the data champion, guiding and thinking through our biggest data challenges. As a Data Architect at BambooHR, you will work closely with multiple stakeholders throughout the organization as you collaborate with various development and business intelligence teams to support the structure of their data needs. Our ideal candidate will thrive in an environment where they’re able to recommend and deliver solutions to improve new and existing data systems.As a Data Architect At BambooHR, You Will Influence the design and architecture of data structures and systems to support application development and business intelligence/analytics Oversee data migrations from legacy systems to new data structures and solutions Work with the development team to design, test, and troubleshoot new structures and integrate new features Deploy large data sets to address business needs, utilizing relational databases and warehouses Collaborate with decision-makers, system owners and end-users to determine business objectives and goals to meet physical database design needs Produce required conceptual, logical, and physical database design documentation Be responsible for basic documentation (e.g. data flows, physical database design) Work with the Architecture team to define, and propose for approval, a modern data platform design strategy What You Need To Get The Job Done You are no stranger to data architecture and you have at least 10 years of previous experience in data architecting and/or engineering within the SaaS industry You have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field You are well versed in MySQL, SQL, Redshift, and/or other relational databases and data warehousing technologies. You have strong written and verbal communication skills Problem-solving is second nature to you You’re a natural when it comes to organization and analytical abilities Your knowledge of database structure systems and data mining is second to none What Will Make Us REALLY Love You You’re an expert in multiple data storage technologies, including all of the following: MySQL, SQLServer, and Redshift You have experience with CI/CD You clearly understand and have experience working with Agile Development and SCRUM You have a knowledge of AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Puppet, Salt stack, Chef, or Terraform Data warehouse technologies like AirFlow, Spark, Sage Maker are nothing new to you Experience programming in Python, R, and SQL stored procedures is in your wheelhouse  You have experience with Linux, including bash scripting  What You'll Love About Us Great Company Culture. We’ve been recognized by multiple organizations like, Salt Lake Tribune, Fortune, & Entrepreneur for our great workplace culture. Work that Stays at Work. Genuine work/life balance served here! Rest and Relaxation. 4 weeks paid time off, 11 paid holidays, and we pay you to go on vacation (ask us about this)! Health Benefits. Medical with HSA and FSA options, dental, and vision. Prepare for the Future. 401(k) with a generous company match. Financial Peace University. Bamboo pays for you to take the class, and you walk away with financial savvy and a bonus. An Equal Opportunity Employer--M/F/D/VBecause our team members are trusted to handle sensitive information, we require all candidates that receive and accept employment offers to complete a background check before being hired.

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We unite Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting!), 18 timezones, and 30 different languages into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.The Elastic Security Data Engineering team designs, builds, and runs data processing pipelines that synthesize security data from a broad set of sources and deliver innovative detection capabilities that power our security products. We are looking for a Data Engineer to craft stream data processing and machine learning systems powering security products that dynamically adapt to changing threats. You will collaborate with the broader Elastic Security team, a diverse set of security researchers, data scientists, and engineers who lend domain expertise to work with you to solve creative security problems and deliver fantastic user experiences.What You Will Be Doing Work as part of the Security Protections team at Elastic with other data engineers, data scientists, and security researchers Improve and expand our security data pipeline across all aspects of software telemetry, data ingest, storage, real-time and batch analytics, machine learning, and data-powered web services Write code in a collaborative environment for new data pipelines and web services Operate and improve cloud-hosted big data systems that manage and analyze malware samples and security activity events Collaborate with security research engineers and data scientists to measure and improve security protections and ML models Collaborate with Elastic Stack software engineers to build multifaceted cloud-based services that deliver a continuously improving user experience Advocate for data-powered services and experiences across the Elastic product portfolio What You Bring Along 7+ years experience programming in Python, OCaml, Go, or equivalent experience in a similar language and ability to learn these languages quickly 5+ years experience building, deploying and operating production-quality distributed data storage and processing systems in an environment of continuous integration and delivery Demonstrated experience designing and building public-cloud hosted infrastructure with AWS, GCP, Docker, and/or Terraform Proficient peer leader with experience partnering with other senior technical and business leaders to lead and mentor junior engineers Collaborative attitude with a strong disposition to learn new skills and emerging technologies Self-motivated and able to thrive in a distributed, fast-paced, and autonomous environment Passionate about protecting the world’s data from attack Desired Experience Or Interests Data streaming / database tech, e.g. SQL, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Spark Distributed systems / messaging tech, e.g. Kafka, NATS, AWS Lambda Functional programming, e.g. OCaml, Haskell Training, measuring, and improving ML models Endpoint and/or network information security Additional InformationWe're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Remote work-from-home option Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Equity Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads) Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Job DescriptionTitle- BSA Sr. (Data Scientist - Automation)Location- Salt Lake city UTJob ID- 19-17142Duration -12monthsContract -W2 onlyJob DescriptionTitle- Data Scientist - AutomationPosition SummaryThe Data Scientist for Automation is an expert in managing and leveraging operational data and utilizing data science to improve the performance of client company's Customer Service and Risk departments. This senior position requires a strong background in statistics, machine learning, analytics, and data engineering.Essential Duties And Responsibilities Use computational tools including R, Weka, and SQL to produce predictive analytics packages for operational deployment. Design and develop analysis techniques that uncover patterns, trends and anomalies in large-scale data using a broad range of machine learning techniques. Test solutions for functionality and integrity; troubleshoot and resolve errors. Utilize data mining techniques and develop data models to assist in the visualization and interpretation of data. Interpret data to identify trends, conduct root cause analysis of problems, and suggest areas for process improvement. Hold reviews with business owners to validate quality, completeness, and accuracy of analysis and reports. Collaborate with development teams to design business intelligence solutions to facilitate data gathering, storage and retrieval. Collaborate with software engineering to integrate Client services into production applications. Integrate data from multiple data sources or functional areas, ensure data accuracy and integrity, and update data as need. Stay current and informed on the latest machine learning research. Perform research, analysis and modeling on organizational data. Aggregate and perform statistical analysis on business data based on requests from senior leadership or project teams. Develop and apply algorithms or models to key business metrics with the goal of improving operations or answering business questions. Provide findings and analysis for use in decision making. Provide business strategy recommendations and measures toward improving business results.  Knowledge/Skills/Abilities Required Expert knowledge in machine learning, data analytics, and, more broadly, in math, statistics, and database structures and data governance. Ability to read, interpret, apply and computationally implement topics in advanced mathematics (such as probability and statistics, machine learning, signal processing, queueing theory, time series analysis, etc.). Advanced understanding of packages such R, SQL, Tableau or similar programming languages and data analysis tools. Attention to detail and the ability to manage own schedule and time. Ability to meet strict deadlines and work with little supervision.  Communication/Language Skills Excellent communications skills including the ability to communicate complex findings to executives in various departments. Strong interpersonal skills, non-verbal skills, and listening skills. Comfort with giving and receiving honest feedback. Ability communicate effectively in various team settings using clear and concise language and proper tone. Flexibility in implementation and open to the ideas and opinions of others.  Experience/Education/Certifications Four-year degree in a quantitative discipline. Masters or PhD in a quantitative discipline with research experience would be considered a plus. History of providing leadership on new methods for using data science to deliver insights and innovation. Track record of delivering tangible business benefits through automated solutions  Regards, Karthick SubramaniSunrise Systems, Inc.105 Fieldcrest Ave Suite# 504, Edison, NJ 08837 USADirect : 732-272-0271 Fax: (732) 603 2208. Karthick.s@sunrisesys.comLinkedIn : https://www.linkedin.com/in/karthicksubramani

About AncestryWhen you join Ancestry, you join our family tree. Backed by history, science, and technology, were creating a new world of connection, innovation, and understanding. Whether its reuniting long-lost relatives through DNA or unearthing new family stories from historical records, Ancestry empowers life-changing experiences. With over 20 billion digitized historical records, 100 million family trees, and 15+ million DNA kits sold, Ancestry is bringing the power of personal discovery to people around the world.Ancestry is looking for a highly motivated Data Scientist Computer Vision, Intern to join our Data Science and Governance Computer Vision team. The Computer Vision team designs, develops, configures and optimizes deep neural networks and computer vision algorithms for various tasks such as image manipulation and classification, object/handwritten text detection and recognition, and content understanding such as virtual question answer system. As a Data Scientist Intern, on the Computer Vision team you will have opportunity to propose and develop novel models to solve the unique historical content analysis problems and a wide range of photo understanding challenges at Ancestry, for example, understand the background story of the photos or read informational content from historical documents.What You'll DoDevelop state-of-the-art computer vision algorithms for extracting the content from historical records and/or family photosDevelop state-of-the-art natural language processing algorithms for understanding and accurately summarizing the contents of records and photosContribute research applicable to ancestry product development, intelligence patent, and/or paperLearn from/work with engineers, product managers, and UX designers to develop solutions for real world, large scale problems Who You AreMust be currently enrolled in a university and graduating after Summer 2020 Proficiency in C/C++, SQL, Python, and multi-threaded programmingExperience with deep learning tools (e.g., tensorflow, pytorch). Nice to have, but not required - Experience with top-tier publications in computer vision or machine learning domains (e.g., CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, PAMI, ICML, JMLR etc ) It takes customer obsession to pioneer and focus on what matters most, to tackle challenges, break through boundaries to create change, to stay on the cutting edge, and pioneer relentlessly. We are looking for the next generation of talent to drive the business, grow our people, and put the customer before all else.Our culture empowers journeys of personal discovery, giving you the freedom to participate in impactful projects and explore the intersections of our businesses: technology, data science, DNA science, product, design, marketing, legal, and more. Were looking for innovative minds, diverse ideas, and for students interested in connecting personal discoveries and technology. Our interns enjoy mentorship and experience challenging work while receiving fantastic pay, fully-paid temporary housing, and having a fun captivating experiencewe have it all. Oh, and did we mention the possibility of full-time employment once you graduate?IND2Additional InformationAncestry is an Equal Opportunity Employer that makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, military or veteran status, citizenship, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. In addition, Ancestry will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.All job offers are contingent on a background check screen that complies with applicable law. For San Francisco office candidates, pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Ancestry will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Ancestry is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ancestry via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ancestry. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Ancestry as a result of the referral or through other means

About UsSlingshot is a Utah based start-up recently recognized by Inc Magazine as one of America's fastest growing companies (#146!!!). Our headquarters is located in Orem, Utah, with At Home Slingers located across Utah as well as select surrounding states. We believe in a world where conversations matter, where technology enhances human interaction instead of replacing it, and where people can effortlessly connect with service providers that help home feel like home.Learn More At The gig: Slingshot is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to support finance, operations, sales, marketing & company leadership teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with leaders to improve business outcomes.Requirements What you'll do:   Work with leaders throughout the organization to identify requirements and opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions and ensuring the validation and verification of data used.   Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, financial models and business strategies.   Provide support to end users on standardized and ad hoc reports.   Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.   Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.   Use predictive modelling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.   Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.  What You Need To Have  Bachelors degree in a business related discipline or mathematics  2+ years of experience in an analytical role and experience with large data sets   At least one year of experience in architecting, building, and maintaining BI environments   Expert SQL query writing, especially across multiple databases and servers   Experience with setting up and maintaining BI analytics tools, such as Tableau, Power BI, Domo, Klipfolio, Qlik, etc   Strong analytical and problem-solving skills   Significant work experience with SQL and report building   Advanced Excel skills   Strong communication skills  Benefits What you’ll gain  :  Experience in a fun, fast-paced startup environment.   A generous PTO allotment gives you the freedom to build the underground crime empire you’ve always dreamed of.   Health Care: Hang-gliding accident? Flesh-eating bacteria? We got you covered.   Data-Driven Workplace: Dashboards. Pie graphs. Acronyms. We’ve got it all.   Growth Opportunities: We’re growing. Like a fungus. You can be a fungus too.  401(k) Match: We’ll help you prepare for your future with the manic energy of a squirrel caching acorns.   Gym Membership & On-site Gym: Let Slingshot subsidize your quest to get fit/swole/jacked/yolked.   Fast-Paced Environment: Set up shop at the corner of amazing growth and exquisite chaos.   Stocked Breakroom, Cafeteria on-site: Never an excuse to be hangry here.

Job_Title: Data Architect - Data Warehouse & MPP - Nationwide Opportunities
Description: DescriptionAt Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical cloud computing architects to collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as Machine Learning, IoT, HPC, Batch/Real-time Data processing, MPP systems, Data Analytics and Business Intelligence.This role will specifically focus on large scale data warehousing and database migration capabilities. The role is to help our customers and partners to eliminate technical and economic constraints from their legacy systems and help them to leverage their data to develop business insights. AWS Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about customer success. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.Responsibilities Include Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services such as Redshift, Database Migration Service, Glue, EMR, Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), S3, Relational Database Service (RDS)/aurora, and Amazon Kinesis. Solution - Deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, generating consulting proposals, contributing to internal Area of Depth (AoD) programs, authoring AWS Data Analytics best practice blogs/whitepaper and creating packaged data service offerings. Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects to assess and optimize customer’s Amazon Redshift implementations and helping customers to migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses using other databases to Amazon Redshift.This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field 5+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a highly technical and analytical role. 5+ years of development and/or DBA experience in Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) including 5+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning MPP databases (Teradata, Vertica, Netezza, Greenplum). Ability to drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation. Current hands-on implementation experience required. Analyze on-premise OLTP database environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL and/or Postgres, as well as MPP analytic databases (Teradata, Netezza, Vertica and Greenplum). Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance. Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems.Preferred Qualifications Ability to evaluate and plan migrations to Amazon Redshift. One of the AWS Associate level certifications or AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner. Extensive hands on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle MPP enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects. Industry leadership in the fields of database, data warehousing or data sciences. Extensive hands on experience in data warehousing design, tuning and ETL/ELT process development. Excellent SQL and strong hands-on scripting (bash, perl or python) ability. Experience implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments. Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP databases, NoSQL storage, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting and Dashboard development. Knowledge of Cloud Computing, AWS services such as EC2, S3, VPC and Redshift. Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment.Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / AgeCompany - Amazon Web Services, Inc.Job ID: A788916

We are seeking a talented Senior Data Architect that is highly skilled in data pipelines and data modeling with an exceptional commitment to service excellence. This individual will collaborate with our business teams and partners on key engagements. These engagements involve emerging technologies like AI, IoT, and Data Analytics. As a Senior Data Architect, you will be an integral member of the Enterprise Data and Analytics team, collaborating with diverse and talented team members to help solve multi-dimensional technology problems, improve customer experience, and generate value for our stakeholders and partners.  Key Job Duties:Develop logical and physical data models to handle complex reporting relationships between various relational entities Work with development teams to translate business requirements into a logical model that will accurately support and represent the project flow of data Enable business to be more data driven by building enterprise class API data connectors. Improve overall robustness and efficiency of existing data pipelines and operations Automate monitoring of data pipelines into target systems. Design and build integration solutions to meet business analytics needs. Integrate database solution with other AWS services as per the broader architecture Make recommendations to maximize operating efficiency, ensure data quality; enforce data governance; ensure recovery is maintained Move data from source systems into a data lake and enable timely and actionable analytics around the organization.  Necessary Skills and Experience:7+ years experience in leading large-scale full-cycle MPP enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects. 7+ years experience in data warehousing design, tuning and ETL/ELT process development. 7+ years working with AWS solutions like EC2, S3, Athena, etc. 7+ years building data connectors to REST and SOAP APIs Strong understanding of JSON and XML 7+ years experience background developing data pipelines using ETL tools like Informatica and Talend. Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP databases, NoSQL storage, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting and Dashboard development. Experience with message queuing systems like Kafka, RabitMQ, AWS Kinesis Familiarity with common enterprise APIs like Salesforce, Oracle Cloud (ERP), etc. Experience with big data technologies like Presto, Spark, Hadoop, etc. Knowledge of data warehouse methodologies Experience automating data science models and data pipelines Bachelors in computer science or related degree Employees of Vivint Solar must submit to a criminal history check, motor vehicles check, drug screening, and obtain clearance from the state based upon the state requirements. Vivint Solar is a proud promoter of employment opportunities to our Military and Veterans. About AncestryWhen you join Ancestry, you join our family tree. Backed by history, science, and technology, were creating a new world of connection, innovation, and understanding. Whether its reuniting long-lost relatives through DNA or unearthing new family stories from historical records, Ancestry empowers life-changing experiences. With over 20 billion digitized historical records, 100 million family trees, and 15+ million DNA kits sold, Ancestry is bringing the power of personal discovery to people around the world.Ancestry is looking for a highly motivated Data Engineer, Intern to join our Data Platform team. The Data Platform team is building and support the platform that Ancestrys data is communicated on. We provide the infrastructure necessary to accomplish a truly event driven ecosystem. As a Data Engineer, on the Data Platform team you will be assisting in this work through designing, implementing and supporting this platform through automation, monitoring, and augmenting the platform.What You'll DoAWS infrastructure deploymentsPipeline Engineering using Kafka, Spark, and other AWS technologiesBuild data models that support thousands of different types of queries Work with a development team as if you are a full-time employee with the user stories being assigned to you each sprint Who You AreMust be currently enrolled in a university and graduating after Summer 2020 Have competency in Java, Python, or ScalaSQL proficiency Interested in BIG data processes and pipelinesEager to learn open source technologies and be happy with the frustrations that using them can causeExperience with EMR, Redshift, Kafka, or other data offerings in AWS is a plusIt takes customer obsession to pioneer and focus on what matters most, to tackle challenges, break through boundaries to create change, to stay on the cutting edge, and pioneer relentlessly. We are looking for the next generation of talent to drive the business, grow our people, and put the customer before all else.Our culture empowers journeys of personal discovery, giving you the freedom to participate in impactful projects and explore the intersections of our businesses: technology, data science, DNA science, product, design, marketing, legal, and more. Were looking for innovative minds, diverse ideas, and for students interested in connecting personal discoveries and technology. Our interns enjoy mentorship and experience challenging work while receiving fantastic pay, fully-paid temporary housing, and having a fun captivating experiencewe have it all. Oh, and did we mention the possibility of full-time employment once you graduate?Additional InformationAncestry is an Equal Opportunity Employer that makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, military or veteran status, citizenship, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. For San Francisco office candidates, pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Ancestry will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Ancestry is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ancestry via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ancestry. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Ancestry as a result of the referral or through other means

About RouteRoute is a one-click premium shopping experience for online ordering, and the only way to view all of your online orders, from any merchant, in one place. Online shoppers can insure and visually track everything they order online in one centralized app. E-commerce merchants from boutique brands to household names can add Route to their website empowering one-click solutions for their customers for shipping insurance, visual package tracking, and one-click claim handling. With offices in both Silicon Slopes, Utah (HQ) and Santa Monica, California, Route embodies a creative lifestyle partnered with innovative tech to build a one of a kind global brand.About The RoleRoute's software engineers are developing next-generation technologies that change how millions of users see, share, and discover the world's products. We are looking for versatile engineers that bring a background in distributed systems design and development, large-scale data storage and processing systems, UI design, mobile, and much more.Route is an engineering company. We need our engineers to bring fresh ideas, be excited to take on new problems across the stack, and embrace the startup culture where we must be comfortable being uncomfortable at times. We aspire to hire the best people with a broad set of technical skills, representing a globally diverse audience, and bringing a diversity of ideas, perspectives, and cultures.Your Participation Design, develop, test, deploy, and improve software Manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables Embody a culture of innovation, transparency, and radical candor Minimum Qualifications BS/BA degree in Computer Science Solid understanding of Computer Science fundamentals Internship or relevant work experience Experience with one or more general purpose languages, e.g. Go, Java, Python, Javascript Interest and ability to learn other languages as needed Preferred Qualifications MS degree in Computer Science or similar technical field Experience with one or more of the following: Mobile Application Development, Front End Development, Big Data Processing Systems, AWS, Machine Learning,  BenefitsRoute offers an array of benefits including generous salaries, stock options, 100% healthcare coverage, and an unlimited PTO policy.Route is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We embrace diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Our data scientists have the opportunity to build cutting-edge e-commerce technologies and apply their ideas in different products across our platform. Who We AreClip is changing the way payments work in Mexico! We are empowering people to exchange value directly from a mobile device. Clip enables anyone to accept card payments, at any time, and anywhere by turning your smartphone or tablet into a card terminal. We're a well funded quickly growing FinTech startup. We are the leaders in our market and are accelerating to extend our lead and move into new markets. Our mission: we allow people and businesses to exchange value and develop enduring relationships in a simple, fast, safe, socially relevant and more beautiful way. We are accomplishing our goals with our teams located in Mexico City, Mexico and Draper, Utah.DescriptionThe Data Engineer will be part of the team responsible for all of the data in the company used to support and implement Clip's mission. This Data Engineers's work will be focused closely with product managers within the Product & Technology department as well as other leaders throughout the company to turn data into critical information and knowledge. It will be expected that his/her engineering can be used to make sound organizational decisions by using clear communication and understandable approaches. He/she needs to be a creative thinker with a strong desire to learn and improve. A successful Data Engineer at Clip would propose innovative ways to look at problems by using data manipulation and engineering techniques, while proving that their projects bring value to the company. They will directly impact business and product decisions for the future of Clip.Key Activities Work as part of a team developing in Python using Agile development methods. Contribute to team and organizational improvements in process and infrastructure. Work in the Data team and with the Architecture and DevOps teams to design and build efficient and fault tolerant data pipelines. Create and populate data lakes and a data warehouse to facilitate data analysis and data science projects.  Effectively use tools and ingenuity to identify and fix defects before they become a problem. Invent new things and create world-changing software!Requirements B.S. Computer Science or a related degree or equivalent experience. Minimum of 3-5 years of working with data in various environments. Strong skills and experience in using SQL. Proficient in Python and/or Java. Proficient in OO methodologies, Agile development, design patterns, unit testing, and other software engineering principles and processes. Desire and ability to learn new data technologies. Self-motivated and be able to work with little supervision while still finishing assigned work. Strong organization and project prioritization skills.A Good Fit If You Have Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Skills at translating complex business problems into solutions using technology. Experience with AWS tools such as Redshift, Athena, Lambda, and Kinesis a plus. Experience with developing data pipelines, data lakes, and data warehousing solutions. Experience with or desire to learn Apache Spark. Desires to work with a global company and multinational workforce.

Job ID: 242762Greater Salt Lake areaDetailsAbout UsBeing a part of Intermountain Healthcare means joining a world-class team of over 37,500 employees and caregivers while embarking on a career filled with opportunities, strength, innovation, and fulfillment. Our mission is: Helping people live the healthiest lives possible.Our patients deserve the best in healthcare, and we deliver.To find out more about us, head to our career site here.Job DescriptionThe Data Analytics Assistant Vice President defines and implements analytics strategy for Analytics function in alignment with system-wide strategies defined by the Executive Leadership Team for one or more of the major areas of focus for Intermountain Analytics (Clinical, Business, Healthcare Delivery, or Analytics Services). The Analytics executive has a broad portfolio and is responsible for leading analytics teams for a defined area of focus. This position oversees prioritization, budgeting, and execution of analytics initiatives. This leader defines the agenda for the area of focus and the Analytics Governance group. The AVP works collaboratively with senior leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups and expand to the organization. This leader is accountable for value creation of analytics within the portfolio. This key leader has a deep understanding of area of focus or related field. The AVP defines key analytics strategies in alignment with system priorities for each of the functional areas in their portfolio. As an analytics leader, this position is accountable for driving a culture of safety, accountability and engagement by ensuring work focuses on patient safety, creating a positive work environment, celebrating team's successes, developing new leaders and leading by example.Position PurposeThe AVP Clinical Analytics defines and implements analytics strategy for Clinical Analytics function for Intermountain Healthcare in alignment with system-wide strategies defined by the Executive Leadership Team. The Clinical Analytics executive will have a broad portfolio and be responsible for leading analytics teams for the following areas: Research, Patient Experience, Clinical Programs, Clinical Services, Research, and Care Management. These areas range from Pharmacy to Precision Health, Cardiovascular to Muscular Skeletal areas and much more. This position will oversee prioritization, budgeting, and execution of analytics initiatives. Role will also lead Clinical analytics integration into caregiver workflows in order to drive higher quality outcomes, care better for our patients, and fulfill our mission of Helping People Live the Healthiest Lives possible. Assures practices are evidenced based and consistent with regulatory guidelines. This leader will define the agenda for the Clinical Continuum Analytics Governance group and work collaboratively with senior leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups and expand to the organization. This leader will be accountable for value creation of analytics in their portfolio.ScopeThis key leader needs to have a deep understanding of analytics in a variety of Clinical areas, including publicly reported measures, systems such as Vizient, and a depth of understanding of key clinical problems and how to use analytics to solve for them. They will define key analytics strategies in alignment with system priorities for each of the functional areas in their portfolio. This position will report to Intermountain Healthcare’s Chief Analytics Officer. They will be responsible to drive adoption, define the product portfolio strategy in partnership with the Director of Product Management, and ensure data platform strategies are in place to support growth and needs for the future. They will manage relationships with key senior leaders at Intermountain, including our Chief Physician executive, VP of Office of Patient Experience, SVP of Clinical Programs and Services, VP of Clinical Services, and several more. This role will have oversight of several data and information management leaders and technical professionals including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and BI Professionals, research informaticists, and more.Essential Job Duties 1. Works with Chief Analytics Officer (CAO) and other key leaders to define a vision and strategy establishing the major area of focus within analytics as a competitive advantage for Intermountain Healthcare. 2. Ensures that Analytics resources are being deployed to support Intermountain leaders and projects of greatest strategic value to the organization. 3. Deploys data and financial analysis to support our key strategic initiatives. 4. Develops financial models to assess the profitability of proposed business initiatives. 5. Maintains a thorough understanding of the competitive landscape, including industry trends, strengths, weaknesses, etc., to aid in identifying business opportunities. 6. Creates ad-hoc analyses to improve efficiency and drive organizational strategy. 7. Designs and creates management dashboards with key KPIs to measure and track success. 8. Monitors feedback and success metrics and provides recommendations on future courses of action. 9. Establishes a high-performance, high-engagement culture which celebrates and encourages diversity. 10. Reports the value and ROI of Business Analytics initiatives. 11. Identifies emerging practices and technologies such as machine learning, AI, NLP, to increase the value of analytic output. 12. Promotes data-driven decision making and a data savvy culture throughout the organization. 13. Leads key managers and directors in functional areas to deliver on service promise, key SLA?s, and ensures a high NPS for customers served. 14. Plans and manages the daily operations within the parameters of departmental operating and capital budgets. 15. Directs the work of employees for area of accountability, including staffing, goal setting, coaching and mentoring, employee recognition and training, and performance management to include addressing performance concerns through corrective action. 16. Manages customer, stakeholder, and vendor relationships and expectations. Focuses on solutions and strategies that create win / win situations both inside and outside of the organization. 17.
