Principal Data ScientistSummaryData analysis, modeling, and forecasting is at the heart of our business operations. The principal data scientist is an expert in managing and leveraging operational data and utilizing data science to improve the performance of our company. This senior position requires a strong background in statistics, machine learning, analytics, and data engineering. The principal data scientist leads a small team of data scientists and works with senior management to identify opportunities, set strategy, execute on quarterly and annual objectives, and drive business growth.Essential Duties And Responsibilities Lead data science staff in strategy, discovery, innovation, and development of machine learning models, forecasting, and operational improvements. Teach and promote good data and software engineering principles and practices within the team. Collaborate with department executives to formulate, plan, and implement changes that result in strategic business improvements. Use computational tools including R and SQL to produce predictive analytics packages for operational deployment. Design, develop and maintain business intelligence solutions using Tableau, Power BI, or similar data analysis tools. Design and develop analysis techniques that uncover patterns, trends and anomalies in large-scale data using a broad range of machine learning techniques. Test solutions for functionality and integrity; troubleshoot and resolve errors. Utilize data mining techniques and develop data models to assist in the visualization and interpretation of data. Interpret data to identify trends, conduct root cause analysis of problems, and suggest areas for process improvement. Hold reviews with business owners to validate quality, completeness, and accuracy of analysis and reports. Collaborate with development teams to design business intelligence solutions to facilitate data gathering, storage and retrieval. Collaborate with software engineering to integrate ML services into production applications. Integrate data from multiple data sources or functional areas, ensure data accuracy and integrity, and update data as need. Stay current and informed on the latest machine learning research. Perform research, analysis and modeling on organizational data. Aggregate and perform statistical analysis on business data based on requests from senior leadership or project teams. Develop and apply algorithms or models to key business metrics with the goal of improving operations or answering business questions. Provide findings and analysis for use in decision making. Evaluate personal and team progress by analyzing strengths and weaknesses in performance. Set quarterly and annual objectives that result in company, team, and individual growth. Provide business strategy recommendations and measures toward improving business results.Knowledge/Skills/Abilities Required Leadership skills with experience managing teams and projects. Expert knowledge in machine learning, data analytics, and, more broadly, in math, statistics, and database structures and data governance. Ability to read, interpret, apply and computationally implement topics in advanced mathematics (such as probability and statistics, machine learning, signal processing, queueing theory, Bayesian data analysis, time series analysis, etc.). Advanced understanding of packages such R, SQL, Tableau or similar programming languages and data analysis tools. Experience with parallel (CPU & GPU), cluster, and cloud computing processing a strong plus. Attention to detail and the ability to manage own schedule and time. Ability to meet strict deadlines and work with little supervision. Working knowledge of business financial and operational metrics and their application to company value.Communication/Language Skills Excellent communications skills including the ability to communicate complex findings to executives in various departments. Strong interpersonal skills, non-verbal skills, and listening skills. Comfort with giving and receiving honest feedback. Ability communicate effectively in various team settings using clear and concise language and proper tone. Flexibility in implementation and open to the ideas and opinions of others.Experience/Education/Certifications Four-year degree in a quantitative discipline. Masters or PhD in a quantitative discipline with research experience would be considered a plus. 10 or more years of educational or commercial experience with large-scale data analysis. History of providing leadership on new methods for using data science to deliver insights and innovation.Other General Requirements/Additional Notes Ability to travel up to 5% of time. Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, tools, and to handle other computer components. Ability to sit at workstation for long periods of time completing analysis, testing, documentation, or other assignments. Lifting and transporting of moderately heavy objects, such as computers and peripherals. Our data scientists have access to highly confidential, sensitive information relating to the employees and customers of Sorenson Communicati

Job_Title: Senior DevOps Engineer - Data Science Team
Description: As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will build and manage a continuous integration/continuous deployment pipeline to allow our Data Science team to deploy new software, predictive models, etc. quickly, easily, and seamlessly into a production environment. You will be responsible for the process whereby Data Science models and rules move from the analytical stage to live in production. You will ensure that the process includes robust and thorough testing, and that as much of that testing is automated as possible. You will work to simplify and speed up the testing process while also making it more resistant to human error. Most importantly, you’ll be part of a team that forms the backbone of a fast-growing company at the forefront of an exciting, growing industry.What You'll DoWork with Data Science and Engineering teams to build a deployment pipeline for Data Science models and rulesDevelop tools to automatically test the models in a production-like environment, making it so that the Data Scientists can easily find and fix bugs before the model is actually in productionImprove the testing process and tools to reduce time to deployment as well as error ratesBe part of a fast-growing team of like-minded data scientists who work and play together, and who love what they do and where they do it!Minimum Experience & QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field, MS or PhD preferred5+ years of software development experience2+ years of experience in continuous integration/continuous deployment tools and technologiesExperience developing software collaboratively using GitExperience with Python including pandas, sklearn, and API development and deploymentCompensation, Perks & BenefitsCompetitive Compensation Full Health Benefits - Medical/Dental/Vision401k, Paid Time Off and Tuition ReimbursementFull Service Gym, Game and Lounge Area, Basketball CourtFree Healthy Snacks and RefreshmentsSubsidized Public TransitFun and Relaxed Work EnvironmentWHO IS PROGRESSIVE LEASING?Prog Leasing, LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Aaron’s, Inc (NYSE: AAN), is the largest and longest-tenured virtual lease-to-own provider in the United States. The company’s mission is to provide simple and affordable purchase options for credit-challenged consumers. Over the last 19+ years, Progressive Leasing’s fair and transparent NO CREDIT NEEDED lease-to-own option has helped millions of customers and their families, even if they have less-than-perfect credit or an inability to pay for their purchase upfront. Progressive has also helped more than 27,000 retail stores drive increased revenue and improve customer satisfaction. Learn more at http://www.progleasing.com.Progressive Leasing does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Progressive Leasing does business.

Want to be part of a tech company that is changing the world for the better? Most companies have a mission statement. Banjo has a mission—to save lives and reduce human suffering by ethically using A.I. to get everyone live, validated information, so they can make better decisions, faster. Banjo is the world’s first Live-Time Intelligence platform that gives decision-makers the ability to KNOW INFORMATION NOW, to understand what is happening live, anywhere. With Banjo you will know more, so you can do more. Imagine how our world will change when decision-makers know exactly what is happening, where it is happening, the moment it happens.The Data Analyst will be responsible for ingesting and validating various types of data to ensure accuracy and improve customer outcomes. The Data Analyst will test and evaluate existing and potential data sources to measure their strengths and weaknesses. This individual will work alongside the public sector and product team to bridge information from customer requests to the Live Time product.RESPONSIBILITIESIngest and validate various types of data within Banjo’s Live Time PlatformInvestigate customers’ use of dataEnsure product updates and releases are data soundEnsure the timely flow of information in order to meet specific time deadlinesProduce reports, create and manage complex spreadsheets of highly-sensitive informationImproves results by participating in and completing audits, identifying weaknesses and implementing improved changesUtilize Excel to manipulate data  and create an analysis of quantitative and qualitative data that synthesizes the key learnings from our customersExercise discretion in handling confidential, non-routine information and facilitate communication between appropriate team membersApply analytical and critical thinking skills quickly and accurately in a high-pressure situationProvide advisory services in innovative ways that demonstrate the power of the Banjo platform across highly-complex and ever-changing situations EDUCATION/EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field1 year of professional or educational experience in software developmentCandidates will be subject to a security investigation and will need to meet eligibility requirements to obtain a top-secret security clearanceAbility to accurately document and record customer informationQA knowledgeAdvanced experience with Microsoft ExcelWorking knowledge of data analysis and performance/operation metricsGeospatial knowledge (GIS platforms a plus)Adept at handling multiple tasks and projects at a time, prioritizing workload effectively, and thriving in a dynamic and complex environment.PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES OF THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATEPossesses an innate sense of urgency to deliver for the business while also effectively working collaboratively as part of a teamOwner mentalityEffective time management, organization and prioritizing skills. Ability to manage and prioritize multiple deliverables and to meet deadlinesHigh attention to detail, able to complete tasks quicklyProven success delivering results individually and as part of a team in a fast-paced, demanding, high-growth environmentContinuous improvement mentality with an ability to evaluate processes, seek out and implement internal or external best practicesCreative problem solver with a demonstrated ability to ‘think outside the box’ when confronting challengesWORK ENVIRONMENTThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The term "qualified individual with a disability" means an individual with a disability who, with or without reasonable accommodation, can perform the essential functions of the position. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate professionally in person, over the telephone, through email and other electronic means, move about the office, handle various types of media and equipment, and visually or otherwise identify, observe and assess. The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 10 pounds and is required to travel unless otherwise specified in the job description.NOTICEAt Banjo, we value inclusion and embrace diversity. Banjo is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. Banjo prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual identity, gender identity, marital status, veteran status, nationality, citizenship, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or any other unlawful consideration. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.The intent of this job description is to provide a representative and level of the types of duties and responsibilities that will be required of positions given this title and shall not be construed as a declaration of the total of the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Employees may be directed to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description. Candidates must pass a background check and drug test to be considered for this position.

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We unite Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting!), 18 timezones, and 30 different languages into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.The Elastic Security Data Engineering team designs, builds, and runs data processing pipelines that synthesize security data from a broad set of sources and deliver innovative detection capabilities that power our security products. We are looking for a Data Engineer to craft stream data processing and machine learning systems powering security products that dynamically adapt to changing threats. You will collaborate with the broader Elastic Security team, a diverse set of security researchers, data scientists, and engineers who lend domain expertise to work with you to solve creative security problems and deliver fantastic user experiences.What You Will Be Doing Work as part of the Security Protections team at Elastic with other data engineers, data scientists, and security researchers Improve and expand our security data pipeline across all aspects of software telemetry, data ingest, storage, real-time and batch analytics, machine learning, and data-powered web services Write code in a collaborative environment for new data pipelines and web services Operate and improve cloud-hosted big data systems that manage and analyze malware samples and security activity events Collaborate with security research engineers and data scientists to measure and improve security protections and ML models Collaborate with Elastic Stack software engineers to build multifaceted cloud-based services that deliver a continuously improving user experience Advocate for data-powered services and experiences across the Elastic product portfolio What You Bring Along 7+ years experience programming in Python, OCaml, Go, or equivalent experience in a similar language and ability to learn these languages quickly 5+ years experience building, deploying and operating production-quality distributed data storage and processing systems in an environment of continuous integration and delivery Demonstrated experience designing and building public-cloud hosted infrastructure with AWS, GCP, Docker, and/or Terraform Proficient peer leader with experience partnering with other senior technical and business leaders to lead and mentor junior engineers Collaborative attitude with a strong disposition to learn new skills and emerging technologies Self-motivated and able to thrive in a distributed, fast-paced, and autonomous environment Passionate about protecting the world’s data from attack Desired Experience Or Interests Data streaming / database tech, e.g. SQL, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Spark Distributed systems / messaging tech, e.g. Kafka, NATS, AWS Lambda Functional programming, e.g. OCaml, Haskell Training, measuring, and improving ML models Endpoint and/or network information security Additional InformationWe're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Remote work-from-home option Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Equity Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads) Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Job_Title: Machine Learning Engineer/Specialist - Tensorflow, Python, MySQL
Description: Are you a Machine Learning Engineer with TensorFlow & python experience? Do you enjoy working with challenging high data consumption environments? If so, read on&We are a rapidly growing and thriving ecommerce startup company. You have heard of us as we are the top 2-3 platforms in our industry!Our CTO is working to create a new sub-division capitalizing on Machine Learning and Computer Vision to improve on our ecommerce platform and is looking to bring on a Machine Learning Engineer to help build this out from the ground up.What You Will Be Doing Work directly with CTO and other cross-functional development teams on building machine learning algorithms Create new machine learning solutions to enhance customer experience Expand our data environment working with relational database technologies and making improvements as neededWhat You Need for this PositionThe Machine Learning Engineer/Specialist must have at least 3 years of experience and be familiar with: Hands on development with open source languages (Python, Java/Scala, Node.JS_ Experience working with Machine Learning tools (TensorFlow, Pandas, Scikit, etc.) Strong understanding of relational database technologies (SQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.) Knowledge of AWS Cloud environments (EC2, S3, Lambda, etc.)Nice to Have Knowledge of big data tools and technologies (Hive, Hadoop, Spark, etc.) Experience with Computer Vision and Deep Learning principles Master's DegreeWhat's In It for You Vacation/PTO Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance Relocation assistance Bonus opportunities! 401k with matching!So, if you are a Machine Learning Engineer with Python & Tensorflow experience, we want to see your resume right away!Email Your Resume In Word ToLooking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. The (quality) doctor is in.Modio has streamlined the convoluted and messy process that is healthcare credentialing and saved countless years of manual and error-prone work in the process. As part of CHG Healthcare we are working to drastically improve the speed (and quality) of credentialing to ensure that our doctors can spend more time treating (millions) of patients each year and less time dealing with credentialing headaches.Our industry is growing and demand is high. This means you’ll have plenty of opportunities to grow and develop in your career. Keeping healthcare healthy can be as fun as it is rewarding.We are open to this role being in our offices in Salt Lake City, Utah or San Francisco, California.Three database admins walked into a nosql bar. A little while later they walked out because they couldn’t find a table.RoleThis role spans many different technical disciplines, but the overarching goals are straightforwardOn a more serious note, we are looking for a data engineer.Automate the ingress/egress of data from the OneView platform.Ensure that all the data in the OneView platform is high quality (and automate the process of identifying/fixing low quality/missing data).In this role you’ll be doing a little bit of everything to accomplish these goals. Whether that means writing new API functionality to import data, setting up/maintaining automated data pipelines, or working on advanced reporting systems is up to you. Consider yourself the glue that makes all of our data accessible and “up to snuff.” This is a highly collaborative and highly visible role; complex systems are not developed in isolation!A Little About Our Tech StackAWSCloudFormation/TerraformKubernetes/Istiojs/TypeScriptPentaho Data IntegrationMySQL/AuroraIf you’re an ambitious product-minded engineer who plays well with others AND can say yes to all of these statements, we are looking for you!You are a doer. Whether you are coming up with projects that align with our vision or helping others do the same, you are doing it proactively.You understand how to design software and systems that are maintainable, robust, easy to understand, and capable of scaling. You also know that not every solution needs to be over-engineered.You should be able to debug technical issues, even if the issue isn’t from “your code” or “your system”.5+ years’ experience working with production data. Must understand things like data normalization, relational databases, data cleansing, data sandboxing, data pipelines, BI/ETL tools, and a bunch of other stuff.Strong proficiency writing SQL. Reading SQL is a plus.Experience working with data integration like Pentaho (or similar).Experience setting up and maintaining data pipelines.Professional experience working on backend API code (Node.js/TypeScript preferred but not a hard requirement). Familiarity with defensive coding practices preferred.Experience working on a scrum team in an agile environment.Experience mentoring junior engineers and performing code reviews.(Preferred) BA/BS degree in computer science/software engineering.(Preferred) Experience with Metabase (or similar BI tool)(Plus) Experience working with Grafana (or similar tool)(Plus) Experience with container technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes.(Plus) Experience designing and building APIs.(Plus) Experience with AWS.Competitive payHealthcare coverage with corporate wellness programFree on-site health center and health coaching for employees and dependents401(k) company matchTuition reimbursement 14 days of PTO your first year and paid holidaysHall of fame development programs as recognized by Training MagazineOn-site cafeteria and game roomClick here to learn more about our company and culture.To have your resume reviewed by Talent Acquisition, click “Apply” at the top of the screen.We are an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity EmployerVeterans/DisabledWe are an at-will employer

Job_Title: Institutional Research Analyst (Academic, Community of Care, Enrollment/Evaluation and Student Services Research)
Description: If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.About WGU Institutional ResearchThe Institutional Research (IR) department at WGU serves as the heart of research, data analytics, and data-driven decision making at Western Governors University. Our motto is Free the Data. The IR department at WGU is a group of talented data scientists, data engineers, analysts, and researchers who are passionate about helping students reach their highest potential through education. At WGU, the IR team has deep expertise in analytical methods, machine learning, learning analytics, and big data. We are fun loving technical folks with a passion for data science and education.The IR department prides itself in being a collaborative, non-competitive group that is encouraged to innovate and use the data science technologies that are best for each project. Current tool sets of the group include Databricks, Oracle SQL Server, Cognos, Tableau, Python, R, and SAS. The internal career path for this role leads towards roles such as a Senior Data Scientist or IT Manager. About the Academic, Community of Care, Enrollment/Evaluation and Student Services Research Team The Academic, Community of Care, Enrollment/Evaluation and Student Services Research Team (ACES) in WGU’s Institutional Research department provides actionable, useful, and enlightening analysis supporting many business stakeholder groups across WGU, including Colleges, Business Process Improvement, Program Development, Faculty, Student Success, Enrollment, etc. We perform a wide variety of tasks, ranging from pulling data to complex analyses and interactive visualizations. We are a dynamic team of curious, open minded, data driven people who are excited about WGU’s mission to provide affordable, competency based post-secondary education that improve students’ lives. About the Academic, Community of Care, Enrollment/Evaluation and Student Services Research – Research Analyst Position Are you passionate about data, the scientific method and business education? Does the idea of writing fun and complex SQL code bring a smile to your face? Do numbers speak to you and tell their stories? Does creating stunning data visualizations come to you naturally? Do you enjoy statistics and analytics? Are you on Team Cats or Team Dogs? Do you enjoy working with co-workers who have diverse hobbies, interests, and backgrounds? Does a “good” dad joke make you want to simultaneously laugh and cringe?The WGU Department of Institutional Research (IR) is looking for a research analyst to provide analytic support in the form of translating business questions into technical reporting requirements, writing code to create database objects to support reporting requirements, creating accurate, useful, and timely visualizations, analysis, and reporting for university KPIs and external reporting. This could include day to day activities such as using Tableau or Power BI to create data visualizations that provide insights into college performance, writing code to use APIs to pull information into a data warehouse, creating machine learning models to identify at risk students, automating reporting data pulls and collaborating in process improvement sessions.Working Conditions This full-time position would work in-office at our Salt lake City (Utah) headquarters , with a traditional working schedule (Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm MDT) Basic QualificationsBachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, applied mathematics discipline, business, or other related degrees 1+ years of experience in data analytics or business intelligenceProfessional or project experience in SQL programming ( Oracle PSQL, Postgres, MSQL )Professional or project experience in data visualization (Tableau, PowerBI, Cognos)Preferred QualificationsExperience with time series forecasting and predictive modelingExperience collecting and/or using qualitative data (ex. surveys, focus groups, interviews)Experience in data validation and testing to analyze, debug and fix issuesExperience understanding, manipulating and querying large data sets with complex file structuresExperience using a data warehouseExperience explaining complex data and research issues in a professional manner with technical and non-technical colleaguesExperience using DatabricksExperience in R, Python,.Scala#D&IAs an equal opportunity employer, WGU recognizes that our strength lies in our people. We are committed to diversity.

Company: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
Description: PurposesThis is a contract, remote position that is part of the Business Intelligence team, this individual works with multiple departments throughout the organization to take their data and transform it into information that will allow them to make better decisions. The data engineer is responsible for gathering requirements, design, creation and support of the data warehouse.This individual works with divine guidance to provide or support technology that furthers the mission of the Church and reflects the eternal impact of the gospel.Responsibilities  Possess and utilize vast knowledge, specific to the data field, to complete significant assignments   Maintain a strong understanding of the supported business processes   Gather and document requirements for the data warehouse   Contribute to the design of Star Schema data models   Create and support ETL jobs, pulling data from various source systems and loading data into the data warehouse   Contribute to the design of semantic layer to support end-user self-service   Build complex reports using SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)   Create complex dashboards using Microsoft Power BI or Tableau   Forecast, analyze data and trends, and create reports that highlight areas in need of performance improvement   Interact with customers as a technical resource to troubleshoot problems with the delivered BI solutions   Maintain production documentation EducationQualifications  Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent professional experience. Master’s degree preferred Work Experience  6+ years of data warehouse experience   1+ years of industrial grade experience in data science, including machine learning and NLP   Some experience evaluating industrial grade experience in data science, including machine learning and NLP   Successfully contributed to the completion of multiple impactful experiences contributing to the successful completion of multiple data science projects end to end, from idea generation to implementation in production systems (warehouse, or applications)   Considerable professional experience in data analysis and report design/development Demonstrated Skills And Abilities  Highly effective communicator; both written and verbal   Strong troubleshooter   Demonstrated ability to work under pressure and resolve complex problems   Proven experience in presentation/interface creation   Extensive knowledge of engineering best practices   Strong operational understanding and discipline   Ability to resolve security issues and requests and implement improvements   Advanced dimensional data modeling skills   Ability to quickly learn new tools and technology   Strong problem solving, analytical, and diagnostic skills   Advanced documentation, presentation, and communication skills   Great in developing ETL code, can manage the ingestion and cleansing of large sets of structured and unstructured data   Knows the algorithms used for regressions, clustering, classification, forecasting, and constructing graphs   This job operates in a professional office environment   To successfully perform the essential functions of the job there may be physical requirements which need to be met such as sitting for long periods of time and using computer monitors/equipment Worthiness QualificationMust be a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and currently temple worthy.Posting Notice/More Info.Please Note: All positions are subject to close without notice.Find out more about the many benefits of Church Employment at http://careers.churchofjesuschrist.org .

Job_Title: Sr. Data Science Manager - SQL, Postgres
Description: If you are a Data Science Manager with 3+ years of R or Python experience, please read on!We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team. You will lead a team of Data Scientists, and play a pivotal role in building out and supporting our new API division through the development of data matching, customer profiles and business profiles. Our team is comprised of Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Business Intelligence Analysts that use our vast and growing data to support and enhance our data and ML models that power our products and decision making. You will use your understanding of modeling, architecture, scaling, and leading people to contribute to the future of data at our company.Our problems are open-ended and dont always have clear paths and solutions. We understand the workflow from a high level, and that context helps us build the right solutions. This is where your unique skills and interests come into play. We are looking for someone who is driven, with a strong intellectual curiosity of understanding challenges and problems, works well cross functionally, and can provide actionable insights and solutions. We look for people who take pride in their work, execute on it, and deliver phenomenal results.What You Will Be Doing Lead and grow a team (2-4) of Data Scientists Develop and implement algorithms for cleaning, integrating, and evaluating large datasets from multiple disparate sources Learn and understand a broad range of our data resources and know when, how, and which to use and which not to use Collaborate with cross-functional teams from Data Engineering, Engineering, and Product to understand current processes and improve our data Wrangling and modeling data from multiple data sources including Snowflake, AWS, and SaaS tools Identifying and understanding source data systems and become an expert of data architecture, sources and flows Provide mentorship and technical guidance to the Data Science TeamWhat You Need for this PositionMust Have Skills Masters Degree with an emphasis in Statistics, Data Science, or a related field 2+ years of people management 3+ years experience using R and/or Python (R preferred) 3+ years experience with Postgres, MySQL, or T-SQL (Postgres preferred) At least 3-5 years of experience working in an Analytics / Data Science environment Experience working with databases and SQL in a business environment Strong experience working with large and complex datasets Team-oriented, self-motivated, success-driven, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude Strong intellectual curiosity and demonstrated ability to understand and question the data Deep analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to turn data into insights and solutions Strong ability to interact, communicate, present and influence within multiple levels of the organization Exceptional written and verbal communication skills Ability to be adaptable and flexible in responding to deadlines and workflow fluctuationsNice To Have Skills Prior SaaS business experience Experience with Domo, Tableau, or other relevant data visualization tool Demonstrated ability to deploy ML models that yield measurable results Experience with Cloud Storage and Compute: AWS (S3, EC2, and EMR) and Snowflake Experience with modeling and manipulating data using Apache SparkWhat's In It for You Competitive compensation and bonus structure Flexible time off 9 paid holidays Generous medical, dental, and vision coverage Flexible spending accounts (FSA) Short term disability insurance/AD&D/voluntary life Pre-tax commuter/parking benefit Wellness program Tuition reimbursement Vanguard 401k plan with the best fund options and the Roth/after-tax optionSo, if you are a Data At Progressive Leasing, we pride ourselves in building Data Science and Machine Learning solutions that transform the way retailers and consumers do business. We’re looking for a Data Analyst to continue strengthening that transformation.As a Data Analyst, you will draw business insights from data through complex analysis, mining, and visualization. You will learn to understand the nuances of Progressive’s business and ensure that we capture, mine, and act on data related to our customers, our stores, and our operational and financial performance to drive business impact. You will leverage strong technical skills and creative thinking to solve problems and make quantitative decisions. You’ll work with cutting edge tools and products at the intersection of technology and business, and Big Data will become a way of life for you. Most importantly, you’ll allow us to get unique and valuable insights that go beyond the obvious and help us achieve extraordinary results.What You'll DoCreate interactive data visualizations that allow the business leaders to react quickly to performance and market trends and make data-driven decisionsBuild and run models to determine optimal resource allocationAnalyze transaction patterns to prevent fraudExtract usable information from unstructured data using advanced data mining techniquesMinimum Experience & QualificationsBachelor’s degree in a technical field (Math, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.) Experience with data mining and visualization tools such R, Python, Tableau, and Power BI as well as querying languages (SQL, etc.)Advanced knowledge and experience with querying languages (SQL, etc.)Strong quantitative analytical abilitiesTrack record of achieving business results through creative problem solving and careful implementationCompensation, Perks & BenefitsCompetitive Compensation Full Health Benefits - Medical/Dental/Vision401k, Paid Time Off and Tuition ReimbursementFull Service Gym, Game and Lounge Area, Basketball CourtFree Healthy Snacks and RefreshmentsSubsidized Public TransitFun and Relaxed Work EnvironmentWHO IS PROGRESSIVE LEASING?Prog Leasing, LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Aaron’s, Inc (NYSE: AAN), is the largest and longest-tenured virtual lease-to-own provider in the United States. The company’s mission is to provide simple and affordable purchase options for credit-challenged consumers. Job ID: 242754Greater Salt Lake areaDetailsAbout UsBeing a part of Intermountain Healthcare means joining a world-class team of over 37,500 employees and caregivers while embarking on a career filled with opportunities, strength, innovation, and fulfillment. Our mission is: Helping people live the healthiest lives possible.Our patients deserve the best in healthcare, and we deliver.To find out more about us, head to our career site here.Job DescriptionThe Data Analytics Assistant Vice President defines and implements analytics strategy for Analytics function in alignment with system-wide strategies defined by the Executive Leadership Team for one or more of the major areas of focus for Intermountain Analytics (Clinical, Business, Healthcare Delivery, or Analytics Services). The Analytics executive has a broad portfolio and is responsible for leading analytics teams for a defined area of focus. This position oversees prioritization, budgeting, and execution of analytics initiatives. This leader defines the agenda for the area of focus and the Analytics Governance group. The AVP works collaboratively with senior leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups and expand to the organization. This leader is accountable for value creation of analytics within the portfolio. This key leader has a deep understanding of area of focus or related field. The AVP defines key analytics strategies in alignment with system priorities for each of the functional areas in their portfolio. As an analytics leader, this position is accountable for driving a culture of safety, accountability and engagement by ensuring work focuses on patient safety, creating a positive work environment, celebrating team's successes, developing new leaders and leading by example.Position PurposeThe AVP, Analytics Services defines and implements analytics strategy for the Analytics Engineering, Product & Program Management, and Data Science functions for Intermountain Healthcare in alignment with system-wide strategies defined by the Executive Leadership Team. This leader will be responsible for ensuring consistent standards, and workflows for the entire reporting and analytics infrastructure for the organization. They will be responsible for setting a product and program management strategy for the organization’s data and analytic assets. Ensuring consistent and high quality data output for all analytic resources in the organization. Additionally, they will lead the Advanced data science function for the organization and will seek to implement advanced analytics methods to the entire organization including, Business, Clinical, and Healthcare Delivery Analytics teams.This leader will define the agenda for the Analytics Services governance group and work collaboratively with senior leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups and expand to the organization. This leader will be accountable for value creation of analytics in their portfolio.ScopeThis key leader needs to have a deep understanding of technical and business data and analytics functions including: Data Warehouse methodologies, advanced data science approaches, and product management. This position will report to Intermountain Healthcare’s Chief Analytics Officer. They will be responsible to drive adoption, define the product portfolio strategy, the program management portfolio strategy which includes capturing and communicating value across analytics teams, defining the development life cycle, adopting agile methodologies for development, driving standardization across teams, and supporting the backend infrastructure to support our analytics governance and portfolio management. This role will have oversight of several data and information management leaders and technical professionals including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and BI Professionals, and more.Essential Job Duties 1. Works with Chief Analytics Officer (CAO) and other key leaders to define a vision and strategy establishing the major area of focus within analytics as a competitive advantage for Intermountain Healthcare. 2. Ensures that Analytics resources are being deployed to support Intermountain leaders and projects of greatest strategic value to the organization. 3. Deploys data and financial analysis to support our key strategic initiatives. 4. Develops financial models to assess the profitability of proposed business initiatives. 5. Maintains a thorough understanding of the competitive landscape, including industry trends, strengths, weaknesses, etc., to aid in identifying business opportunities. 6. Creates ad-hoc analyses to improve efficiency and drive organizational strategy. 7. Designs and creates management dashboards with key KPIs to measure and track success. 8. Monitors feedback and success metrics and provides recommendations on future courses of action. 9. Establishes a high-performance, high-engagement culture which celebrates and encourages diversity. 10. Reports the value and ROI of Business Analytics initiatives. 11. Identifies emerging practices and technologies such as machine learning, AI, NLP, to increase the value of analytic output. 12. Promotes data-driven decision making and a data savvy culture throughout the organization. 13. Leads key managers and directors in functional areas to deliver on service promise, key SLA?s, and ensures a high NPS for customers served. 14. Plans and manages the daily operations within the parameters of departmental operating and capital budgets. 15. Directs the work of employees for area of accountability, including staffing, goal setting, coaching and mentoring, employee recognition and training, and performance management to include addressing performance concerns through corrective action. 16. Manages customer, stakeholder, and vendor relationships and expectations. Focuses on solutions and strategies that create win / win situations both inside and outside of the organization. 17. Regularly communicates with staff through huddles, team meetings, individual one on one meetings, rounding and skip level interviews as appropriate, and manages resource allocation to projects to ensure timely delivery within budget and according to requirements. Clinical incumbents whose specialty require licensure (e.g. Pharmacists, Registered Nurses, Respiratory Therapists) must hold current state licensure. Ten years of related experience, such as analytics business management, legal, financial or information or IT management, recently at or near the executive level and related to one of the Analytics areas of focus listed above. Five years of progressive leadership experience in leading cross-functional teams and enterprise-wide programs, operating and influencing effectively across the organization and within complex contexts. Five years of experience in information-intensive industries or digitally advanced enterprises requiring a strong business enterprise knowledge. Experience in integrating complex cross-corporate processes and data models or designing strategic metrics and scorecards. Experience using word processing, spreadsheet, database, internet, and e-mail and scheduling applications. Experience in a role requiring effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.  Physical Requirements Interact with others requiring the employee to communicate information. Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands. See and read computer monitors and documents. Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment.  Preferred Qualifications Experience directly managing analytics teams in one of these areas: Clinical, Business, Healthcare Delivery, or Analytics Services. Operational or Clinical Experience in one of the areas of focus listed above. Experience with Product Development and Agile Development methodologies. Experience with Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence methodologies. Experience with applied advanced analytics to drive workflow enhancement. Job ID: 240329Greater Salt Lake areaDetailsAbout UsBeing a part of Intermountain Healthcare means joining a world-class team of over 37,500 employees and caregivers while embarking on a career filled with opportunities, strength, innovation, and fulfillment. Our mission is: Helping people live the healthiest lives possible.Our patients deserve the best in healthcare, and we deliver.To find out more about us, head to our career site here.Job DescriptionThis position focuses the majority of their time producing analytical solutions (insights, statistical analysis, and models, etc.) for leadership and stakeholders across the organization that supports business or clinical initiatives. This position provides consultation and support in the development, analysis, interpretation, and management of a variety of routine to minimally complex data sources to support process improvement, operations, strategy, cost reduction, and increased patient safety and satisfaction.Essential Job DutiesThis position is responsible for providing analytical support - typically at a system-wide level. May work as part of a system-wide team or interact with stakeholders across the system. Typically this position performs analysis on routine or minimally complex projects under general supervision. This position works with data sources serving the needs of customers in one or more business areas: Population Health Management / Decision Support: Population health management analytics (PHMA) supports the development, implementation, and measurement of systems of care that assess the health needs of a target population and proactively provides and coordinates services to improve the health of that population. PHMA provides support for the following functions: integration of population health data, value improvement, standard quality service and cost metrics and measurement, risk scoring and severity adjustment, attribution methods, contract analysis, and new data source insight. PHMA utilizes data from across the healthcare system and across the continuum, including hospital, physician, and claims data. Core Essentials 1. Uses appropriate analytic methods to summarize/present known information and display trends to provide basic statistical analysis support. 2. Runs macros/code that others have written and reads documentation to understand key processes and implement standard best practices. 3. Uses basic to routine level statistical or analytical software skills in programs such as R, SAS, SPSS, STATA to understand data. 4. Creates reports that answer a specific question or a limited number of questions. Reports include basic graphs, output lists of data, and basic use of parameters. Reports used to promote evidence-based decision making. 5. Compares data output with expected output to ensure data accuracy. Creates basic QA test plans and validate data for accuracy. Reviews data for discrepancies, interacts with data stewards, and creates analysis datasets. 6. Demonstrates basic or routine level SQL and data extraction skills (i.e., Uses pre-defined scripts, changes parameters, GUI query like MS Access, tools with drag-drop query creation capability, and Excel cubes). 7. Collaborates with corporate and region resources to design, create, test and implement analytic tools (reports, dashboards, etc.) that support enterprise / region needs and to improve data collection and reporting strategies (minimize duplication, redundancy, etc.). 8. Responsible to document work / projects per enterprise-wide standards (reports, project tracking, databases, etc.). Conforms to statistical programming and analysis standards. 9. Prepares and communicates statistical results in written and oral summary. Shares important and relevant information with the team. Proactively offers suggestions, provides resources, volunteers for assignments, and removes barriers to help the team accomplish its goals. 10. May demonstrate a basic level of proficiency in using / analyzing Intermountain data sources to meet local and enterprise needs. 11. Provides consultation, data analysis and project management for clinical and business stakeholders across the organization. Communicates technical / analytical concepts to others. May operate with a mentor, reporting progress and collaboratively applying and developing statistical methods 12. Demonstrates an understanding of relational database concepts and how tables relate to each other. 13. Participates in Intermountain's analyst community by attending and taking part in monthly analyst community events such as ASK (Analysts Seeking Knowledge). Posting Specifics Benefits Eligible:Yes Shift Details: M-F Department: Population Health/Castell We will hire either an associate, staff, or senior level analyst for this role.  At this time, we are unable to sponsor candidates that require a visa for this role.  Minimum Requirements Bachelor's Degree. Degree must be obtained through an accredited institution. Education is verified.or Six years of analytics experience. Demonstrated experience in the developing, analyzing, interpreting, and managing various data sets. Demonstrated experience using word processing, spreadsheet, database, internet and e-mail, and scheduling applications, as well as statistical and analytical software systems such as SAS, SPSS, Statit, R, or Python, etc. Demonstrated experience in a role requiring effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. Physical Requirements Interact with others requiring the employee to verbally communicate information. Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands. See and read computer monitors and documents Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment. Preferred Requirements Degree in an analytics related field such as statistics, mathematics, information systems, computer science, finance, business management, or economics. If degree is not in an analytics related field, two years of experience demonstrating proficiency performing the job essentials at this job level. Demonstrated working knowledge of SQL (structured query language), quality improvement principles, and a fundamental knowledge of database design principles. Applied understanding of data visualization design best practices. Familiarity with SQL query tuning. General experience in healthcare or subject matter expertise in the job area (such as Actuarial, Clinical Programs, Clinical Services, Compliance, Finance/Accounting, Human Resources, Management Engineering, Quality, Revenue Cycle, Select Health / Insurance, Strategic Planning, Costing, Chargemaster, Budgeting, etc.). All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

We are seeking an innovative researcher with a knowledge base in data analytics and a desire to continuously grow and learn within a professional realm in order to create data-driven solutions that impact community college students. This full-time research position in the Data Science .and.amp; Analytics department at Salt Lake Community College (SLCC) is for an applied statistician-data scientist with strong statistical programming skills and exceptional communication abilities, centered on visualization. The applicant should be skilled at explaining potentially complicated statistical results to non-technical audiences. The position requires a creative and detail-oriented approach to answering research questions using a wide range of statistical techniques from areas such as data mining, business intelligence, predictive analytics, machine learning, computational statistics, and the social sciences. Our researchers work very collaboratively, meeting weekly to discuss methodology and share. The applicant should have an interest in student success, some knowledge of higher education and a desire to learn and try new methods.The position is grant funded for 2 years, with the possibility of becoming an ongoing position thereafter. The funding is from the Department of Education to improve.and. STEM.and. education in the college of Science, Math and Engineering at.and. SLCC. The position will focus on educational research to support that objective.SLCC.and. is nationally recognized as a premiere community college in the western United States. The College is making an increased investment in its data and analytics resources as it transitions more completely to a culture of data-informed decision-making at all levels. The researcher will help with this transition and will have an important role in improving college student success in Utah.

Job_Title: Data Analyst- Staff/Sr at Primary Children's Hospital
Description: Job ID: 241186Greater Salt Lake areaDetailsAbout UsBeing a part of Intermountain Healthcare means joining a world-class team of over 37,500 employees and caregivers while embarking on a career filled with opportunities, strength, innovation, and fulfillment. Our mission is: Helping people live the healthiest lives possible.Our patients deserve the best in healthcare, and we deliver.To find out more about us, head to our career site here.Job DescriptionThis position is part of a team of data analysts at Primary Children’s Hospital. The Data Analyst collaborates with nurses, physicians and administrators to produce analytical solutions that support process improvement, operations, strategy, and increased patient safety.This role centers around the ability to use data from a myriad of vended and internally developed data platforms to help caregivers garner insights. This role will require the ability to understand how clinical and business work processes generate data and its contextual meaning. This role will work in collaboration with business partners to rapidly translate and present data that can be consumed by caregivers to help make clinical and business decisions. This role is enhanced by the ability to develop and leverage logical models, statistical knowledge, communication skills, and willingness to drive opportunities to improve data quality and structures in source systems.Essential Job DutiesThis position is responsible for providing analytical support at a system-wide level for pediatrics. May interact with stakeholders across the system. Typically, this position performs analysis on routine or moderately complex projects under general supervision.Core Essentials 1. Creates reports that answer multiple related questions as well as reports with linked content, drilldown and nested parameters. The report is formatted in such a way that leads the user through the report in a well-organized, easy to understand fashion. 2. Writes ad hoc SQL, including basic selects, joins, use of Where clause and simple functions (e.g., Trunc, Sum, Min, Max, Avg, Concat, etc.). 3. Understanding of Primary / Foreign Keys, Table / Field Aliases, and Partitions / Indexes. 4. Assists in the identification of data quality (accuracy, completeness, etc.) issues. Assists with the process of database design for assigned projects. As appropriate, trains other individuals and teams in the routine use of data collection, analysis, and reporting and interpretation tools for measuring performance. About TauliaTaulia delivers working capital solutions that make it easy for businesses to free up cash, accelerate payments and improve supply chain health.Since founding in 2009, we’ve envisioned a world where every business thrives by liberating cash. Today, our team of financial gamechangers have built a network connecting 1.5 million businesses across 168 countries and accelerated more than $80 billion in early payments.Using our state-of-the-art platform, businesses now have the option to choose when and how to pay and get paid. It sounds simple. But our painless process provides both buyers and suppliers the chance to skyrocket their cash - cash to fuel economic growth all over the world. It’s win-win for everybody.About The JobTaulia is looking for an experienced Manager for our Data Engineering team who has a passion for building data products and systems. Taulia has a culture of data-driven decision making and demands business intelligence that is accurate, timely and actionable.As Manager of our Data Engineering team, you are bright, responsible, self-motivated, confident, and get stuff done. You are a problem solver who has the skill and experience to take large datasets and build the tools, processes, and systems to translate that data into actionable business decisions. You must be willing to do whatever it takes to get the job done while ensuring that we’re building a scalable system for the future of Taulia and our customers. We’re looking for someone who prides themselves on anticipating problems, looking beyond immediate issues and taking the initiative to improve both our software and our development infrastructure.In return, you’ll get the reward of working inside a passionate, hungry, and FUN team. You’ll get the joy of bringing a new product to life from concept to delivery, and the technical and business learnings of working with data and users at scale.Essential Duties Own the design, development, and maintenance of a high performance streaming infrastructure (AWS Kinesis & Lambda and/or similar tools on other cloud providers of GCP or Azure) translating over 1M data events per hour from our transactional product systems into a scalable Datamart architecture for efficient reporting use cases (Redshift and Aurora).  Help build and maintain processes to automatically supplement each data stream with third party data from numerous APIs and sources (Salesforce, CapIQ, Social123/Synthio, etc).  Automate processes to transform datasets into efficient structures for reporting and embedded analytics, and ensure that data remains up to date on all interfaces (Salesforce, Analytics tools, etc). Own and maintain all components of our data pipeline: from coding and deployments to monitoring, troubleshooting and recovery. Design, build and support pipelines of data transformation, conversion, and validation. Design and support effective storage and retrieval of large datasets. Design and implement best practices for cloud based cluster deployments. Lead/ expand/ coach a team of data engineers and collaborate with Product Managers and Data Science team. Deliver fresh insights to power improvements in our Cash Forecasting, Working Capital and Financial Supply Chain products. Optimize ML deployment for efficiency, scalability, prediction speed, and version control. Design and execute solution for dynamic, responsive visualization layer. Requirements 3+ years experience in managing a team of Data Engineers.  3+ years of experience being the technical lead across a broad range of data systems, architecture, and application components & processes across the entire data value chain - including data warehouses, data lakes, big data, ETL, data modeling, database administration, security, user interface, reporting & analysis etc.  Experience delivering customer embedded analytics solutions directly to SAAS customers. Experience in implementing a data management strategy across large organizations globally. 5+ years experience in a Data Engineering oriented role. Experience with a data streaming architecture on AWS (Kinesis, Lambda, RDS, Redshift, EC2, VPCs, S3, EBS Volumes) or similar cloud computing platforms. Experience with Python. Experience with MySQL, PostGres. Nice To Have Experience with Kinesis/Lambda (or similar streaming technologies) - Streaming messages, building lambda functions. Experience with Redshift/Aurora (or similar database/ data lake) - maintaining clusters, designing table structures, interacting with S3 and moving data. Experience integrating with APIs, particularly Salesforce, Box, AWS, etc. Experience with containerized/serverless model deployments. Experience managing global teams. Experience with Data Visualization Tools like Sisense / Tableau or similar. Advanced SQL Knowledge. Bachelor’s or Master's Degree in Computer Science / Mathematics / Statistics / Engineering. Taulia is an Equal Opportunity Employer -- Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age. If you don't think you meet all of the criteria above but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.

Location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Description: The Biorepository Data Services Specialist supports research studies and research coordinators by locating, aggregating, and providing data associated with biological samples contained in the Biorepository. The incumbent works closely with Biorepository research coordinators to understand needs and requirements regarding research requests, then applies their understanding to deliver the requested data adhering to HIPAA and healthcare regulations. The incumbent provides consultation and support in the development, analysis, interpretation, and management of a variety of highly complex data sources to support operations, strategy, and increased throughput of Biorepository research project requests. Other areas of responsibility include the ability to learn and apply new techniques and patterns, minor programming, and hardware support.Essential Job Duties1. Provides research study data for researchers across all specialties.2. Prepares research data for analysis and performs the analysis.3. Understands and writes advanced SQL queries to perform:Feasibility queries for research project requests.Associate clinical data (historic and active) with biological samples.Data insertions, deletions, and updates reliably.4. Provides expertise in data visualization (charting, Tableau, Qlik, etc.).5. Executes data logic by associating distributed, disjointed databases into a single comprehensive record.6. Uses PL/SQL to execute functional/procedural details inside database.7. Demonstrates knowledge of how data moves through the healthcare system as it is gathered and then later retrieved.8. Demonstrates a professional attitude at all times.Core Essentials:1. Writes advanced queries using SQL or PL/SQL to provide feasibility of research project requests.2. Practices sound database (schema) upgrade practices by defining SQL scripts and coordinating and working with DBA's to execute scripts as needed.3. Understands logic provided by different applications supporting the Biorepository.4. Assists in database analysis for the modernization of the Biorepository.Additional Essentials:1. Learns new tools and techniques for extracting and linking data points.2. Demonstrates advanced level SQL, data extraction, and data association skills.3. Possesses an in-depth understanding of Intermountain data to be used in the Biorepository and associated data models and produces high quality results.4. Documents results/findings and gives reports accordingly.5. Understands the appropriate use of indexes, partitions, and Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERD's).6. Shares important and relevant information with the team. Proactively offers suggestions, provides resources, volunteers for assignments, and removes barriers to help the team accomplish its goals.Minimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in a related field and 2 years of experience in database design, data association, and analysis. Education must be obtained through an accredited institution. Degree will be verified.Advanced working knowledge and proficiency in SQL, database design, and statistical modeling.Experience developing, analyzing, interpreting, and managing a variety of complex data sets.Knowledge of database data collection, data quality control, querying, and reporting using database applications.Experience troubleshooting and repairing minor hardware issues.Preferred RequirementsDegree in an analytics-related field such as statistics, mathematics, information systems, computer science, finance, economics, or an MBA with an emphasis in analytics.If degree is not in an analytics related field, 2 years of analytics experience demonstrating proficiency performing the job essentials at this job level.Proficiency using statistical methods and tools.Proficiency using programming languages and tools.Experience presenting to a variety of audiences and coaching leaders, customers, and peers on data analysis best practices, trends, tools, and technology.Strong experience with SQL query tuning.Experience Programming/scripting (APEX, R, Python).

Qualtrics is the technology platform that organizations use to collect, manage, and act on experience data, also called X-data™. The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action, used by teams, departments, and entire organizations to manage the four core experiences of business—customer, product, employee and brand—on one platform. Over 10,000 enterprises worldwide, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100 and 99 of the top 100 U.S. business schools, rely on Qualtrics to consistently build products that people love, create more loyal customers, develop a phenomenal employee culture, and build iconic brands. Qualtrics was recently acquired by SAP, and together we will accelerate XM and power the experience economy. Join us on this adventure that can open many doors! If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment.The Opportunity and PositionThe Sales Strategy & Operations Analyst acts as a business advisor to both sales and company leadership. You are responsible for providing a wide range of strategic, analytical, and operational support. You will generate insights into all aspects of the sales process and enable the sales organization to increase efficiency and make better decisions, faster. You will work cross-departmentally to drive high-impact strategic projects and help drive Qualtrics to the next level. Your job is to ensure that data and reporting are available to all parts of the business. You lead efforts to craft scalable solutions for automation, dashboards and business insights.You are an individual with superb communication and analytical skills who can successfully pivot between multiple projects and operational functions. You can use data to tell a compelling story and enable the decision-making process.You work with and mentor analysts in building custom data sets and analytical reports.A Day in the Life Consult with sales leadership analyzing data from multiple systems and helping to improve overall sales processes Manage large cross-functional efforts to craft corporate/sales strategy Transform complex data sets into an easy to use metrics in a data visualization platform (Tableau, Excel) Infuse more science into understanding our sales and become the expert for all data questions regarding sales and sales operations Craft evidence to support a point of view and draw definitive conclusions and present findings in written and verbal formats to be reviewed by executives Make practical recommendations that drive increased sales Produce and automate reports to track key performance indicators Coordinate with data engineering and provide them with requirements to ensure internal systems capture necessary data and enable the Global Operations team Bachelors degree required Qualifications  Bachelor’s of Science degree in Statistics, Economics, Finance, Math, or other quantitative major.   1-3 years of experience in some combination of data science, statistical modeling and business analytics.   Strongly preferred to have a strong knowledge of some combination of pricing data, data visualization, and statistics. Expertise in R or Python as well as SQL.   Experience delivering against multiple priorities simultaneously along with strong attention to detail, planning and organizational skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.   Proven track record at learning and adapting quickly.  What Differentiates Us From Other Companies Work life integration is deeply meaningful to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours. We take pride in our offices design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space. On top of standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office.

Who We AreClip is changing the way payments work in Mexico! We are empowering people to exchange value directly from a mobile device. Clip enables anyone to accept card payments, at any time, and anywhere by turning your smartphone or tablet into a card terminal. We're a well funded quickly growing FinTech startup. We are the leaders in our market and are accelerating to extend our lead and move into new markets. Our mission: we allow people and businesses to exchange value and develop enduring relationships in a simple, fast, safe, socially relevant and more beautiful way. We are accomplishing our goals with our teams located in Mexico City, Mexico and Draper, Utah.DescriptionThe Data Engineer will be part of the team responsible for all of the data in the company used to support and implement Clip's mission. This Data Engineers's work will be focused closely with product managers within the Product & Technology department as well as other leaders throughout the company to turn data into critical information and knowledge. It will be expected that his/her engineering can be used to make sound organizational decisions by using clear communication and understandable approaches. He/she needs to be a creative thinker with a strong desire to learn and improve. A successful Data Engineer at Clip would propose innovative ways to look at problems by using data manipulation and engineering techniques, while proving that their projects bring value to the company. They will directly impact business and product decisions for the future of Clip.Key Activities Work as part of a team developing in Python using Agile development methods. Contribute to team and organizational improvements in process and infrastructure. Work in the Data team and with the Architecture and DevOps teams to design and build efficient and fault tolerant data pipelines. Create and populate data lakes and a data warehouse to facilitate data analysis and data science projects.  Effectively use tools and ingenuity to identify and fix defects before they become a problem. Invent new things and create world-changing software!Requirements B.S. Computer Science or a related degree or equivalent experience. Minimum of 3-5 years of working with data in various environments. Strong skills and experience in using SQL. Proficient in Python and/or Java. Proficient in OO methodologies, Agile development, design patterns, unit testing, and other software engineering principles and processes. Desire and ability to learn new data technologies. Self-motivated and be able to work with little supervision while still finishing assigned work. Strong organization and project prioritization skills.A Good Fit If You Have Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Skills at translating complex business problems into solutions using technology. Experience with AWS tools such as Redshift, Athena, Lambda, and Kinesis a plus. Experience with developing data pipelines, data lakes, and data warehousing solutions. Experience with or desire to learn Apache Spark. Desires to work with a global company and multinational workforce.
