Job ID: 242762Greater Salt Lake areaDetailsAbout UsBeing a part of Intermountain Healthcare means joining a world-class team of over 37,500 employees and caregivers while embarking on a career filled with opportunities, strength, innovation, and fulfillment. Our mission is: Helping people live the healthiest lives possible.Our patients deserve the best in healthcare, and we deliver.To find out more about us, head to our career site here.Job DescriptionThe Data Analytics Assistant Vice President defines and implements analytics strategy for Analytics function in alignment with system-wide strategies defined by the Executive Leadership Team for one or more of the major areas of focus for Intermountain Analytics (Clinical, Business, Healthcare Delivery, or Analytics Services). The Analytics executive has a broad portfolio and is responsible for leading analytics teams for a defined area of focus. This position oversees prioritization, budgeting, and execution of analytics initiatives. This leader defines the agenda for the area of focus and the Analytics Governance group. The AVP works collaboratively with senior leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups and expand to the organization. This leader is accountable for value creation of analytics within the portfolio. This key leader has a deep understanding of area of focus or related field. The AVP defines key analytics strategies in alignment with system priorities for each of the functional areas in their portfolio. As an analytics leader, this position is accountable for driving a culture of safety, accountability and engagement by ensuring work focuses on patient safety, creating a positive work environment, celebrating team's successes, developing new leaders and leading by example.Position PurposeThe AVP Clinical Analytics defines and implements analytics strategy for Clinical Analytics function for Intermountain Healthcare in alignment with system-wide strategies defined by the Executive Leadership Team. The Clinical Analytics executive will have a broad portfolio and be responsible for leading analytics teams for the following areas: Research, Patient Experience, Clinical Programs, Clinical Services, Research, and Care Management. These areas range from Pharmacy to Precision Health, Cardiovascular to Muscular Skeletal areas and much more. This position will oversee prioritization, budgeting, and execution of analytics initiatives. Role will also lead Clinical analytics integration into caregiver workflows in order to drive higher quality outcomes, care better for our patients, and fulfill our mission of Helping People Live the Healthiest Lives possible. Assures practices are evidenced based and consistent with regulatory guidelines. This leader will define the agenda for the Clinical Continuum Analytics Governance group and work collaboratively with senior leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups and expand to the organization. This leader will be accountable for value creation of analytics in their portfolio.ScopeThis key leader needs to have a deep understanding of analytics in a variety of Clinical areas, including publicly reported measures, systems such as Vizient, and a depth of understanding of key clinical problems and how to use analytics to solve for them. They will define key analytics strategies in alignment with system priorities for each of the functional areas in their portfolio. This position will report to Intermountain Healthcare’s Chief Analytics Officer. They will be responsible to drive adoption, define the product portfolio strategy in partnership with the Director of Product Management, and ensure data platform strategies are in place to support growth and needs for the future. They will manage relationships with key senior leaders at Intermountain, including our Chief Physician executive, VP of Office of Patient Experience, SVP of Clinical Programs and Services, VP of Clinical Services, and several more. This role will have oversight of several data and information management leaders and technical professionals including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and BI Professionals, research informaticists, and more.Essential Job Duties 1. Works with Chief Analytics Officer (CAO) and other key leaders to define a vision and strategy establishing the major area of focus within analytics as a competitive advantage for Intermountain Healthcare. 2. Ensures that Analytics resources are being deployed to support Intermountain leaders and projects of greatest strategic value to the organization. 3. Deploys data and financial analysis to support our key strategic initiatives. 4. Develops financial models to assess the profitability of proposed business initiatives. 5. Maintains a thorough understanding of the competitive landscape, including industry trends, strengths, weaknesses, etc., to aid in identifying business opportunities. 6. Creates ad-hoc analyses to improve efficiency and drive organizational strategy. 7. Designs and creates management dashboards with key KPIs to measure and track success. 8. Monitors feedback and success metrics and provides recommendations on future courses of action. 9. Establishes a high-performance, high-engagement culture which celebrates and encourages diversity. 10. Reports the value and ROI of Business Analytics initiatives. 11. Identifies emerging practices and technologies such as machine learning, AI, NLP, to increase the value of analytic output. 12. Promotes data-driven decision making and a data savvy culture throughout the organization. 13. Leads key managers and directors in functional areas to deliver on service promise, key SLA?s, and ensures a high NPS for customers served. 14. Plans and manages the daily operations within the parameters of departmental operating and capital budgets. 15. Directs the work of employees for area of accountability, including staffing, goal setting, coaching and mentoring, employee recognition and training, and performance management to include addressing performance concerns through corrective action. 16. Manages customer, stakeholder, and vendor relationships and expectations. Focuses on solutions and strategies that create win / win situations both inside and outside of the organization. 17. Regularly communicates with staff through huddles, team meetings, individual one on one meetings, rounding and skip level interviews as appropriate, and manages resource allocation to projects to ensure timely delivery within budget and according to requirements. Posting Specifics Wage: commensurate with experience Benefits Eligible: Yes Shift Details: Full Time Department: Enterprise Analytics Minimum Requirements Master's degree in business administration, computer science, information management or Data-related field. Education must be obtained through an accredited institution. Degree will be verified.or Advanced Clinical degree (e.g., MD, DO, PharmD, MSN) with advanced training in analytics principles and processes, such as medical informatics. Clinical incumbents whose specialty require licensure (e.g. Pharmacists, Registered Nurses, Respiratory Therapists) must hold current state licensure. Ten years of related experience, such as analytics business management, legal, financial or information or IT management, recently at or near the executive level and related to one of the Analytics areas of focus listed above. Five years of progressive leadership experience in leading cross-functional teams and enterprise-wide programs, operating and influencing effectively across the organization and within complex contexts. Five years of experience in information-intensive industries or digitally advanced enterprises requiring a strong business enterprise knowledge. Experience in integrating complex cross-corporate processes and data models or designing strategic metrics and scorecards. Experience using word processing, spreadsheet, database, internet, and e-mail and scheduling applications. Experience in a role requiring effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.  Physical Requirements Interact with others requiring the employee to communicate information. Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands. See and read computer monitors and documents. Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment.  Preferred Qualifications Experience directly managing analytics teams in one of these areas: Clinical, Business, Healthcare Delivery, or Analytics Services. Operational or Clinical Experience in one of the areas of focus listed above. Experience with Product Development and Agile Development methodologies. Experience with Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence methodologies. Experience with applied advanced analytics to drive workflow enhancement. Master's degree in information management or Data-related field or equivalent Clinical Education.  Please NoteAll positions subject to close without notice. Intermountain Healthcare prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, veteran status, disability and/or genetic information.

If you are a Sr. Data Scientist with 3+ years of R or Python experience, please read on!As a member of the Data Science team, you will play a pivotal role in building out and supporting our new API division through the development of data matching, customer profiles and business profiles. Our team is comprised of Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Business Intelligence Analysts that use our vast and growing data to support and enhance our data and ML models that power our products and decision making. You will use your understanding of data and modeling to make a difference.Our problems are open-ended and don't always have clear paths and solutions. We understand the workflow from a high level, and that context helps us build the right solutions. This is where your unique skills and interests come into play. We are looking for someone who is driven, with a strong intellectual curiosity of understanding challenges and problems, works well cross functionally, and can provide actionable insights and solutions. We look for people who take pride in their work, execute on it, and deliver phenomenal results.What's In It for You- Competitive compensation and bonus structure- Flexible time off- 9 paid holidays- Generous medical, dental, and vision coverage- Flexible spending accounts (FSA)- Short term disability insurance/AD&D/voluntary life- Pre-tax commuter/parking benefit- Wellness program- Tuition reimbursement- Vanguard 401k plan with the best fund options and the Roth/after-tax optionWhat You Will Be Doing- Develop and implement algorithms for cleaning, integrating, and evaluating large datasets from multiple disparate sources- Learn and understand a broad range of our data resources and know when, how, and which to use and which not to use- Collaborate with cross-functional teams from Data Engineering, Engineering, and Product to understand current processes and improve our data- Wrangling and modeling data from multiple data sources including Snowflake, AWS, and SaaS tools- Identifying and understanding source data systems and become an expert of data architecture, sources and flows- Provide mentorship and technical guidance to the Data Science TeamWhat You Need for this PositionMust have skills: - Masters Degree with an emphasis in Statistics, Data Science, or a related field- 2+ years of people management- 3+ years experience using R and/or Python (R preferred)- 3+ years experience with Postgres, MySQL, or T-SQL (Postgres preferred)- At least 3-5 years of experience working in an Analytics / Data Science environment- Experience working with databases and SQL in a business environment- Strong experience working with large and complex datasets- Team-oriented, self-motivated, success-driven, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude- Strong intellectual curiosity and demonstrated ability to understand and question the data- Deep analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to turn data into insights and solutions- Strong ability to interact, communicate, present and influence within multiple levels of the organization- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills- Ability to be adaptable and flexible in responding to deadlines and workflow fluctuationsNice to have skills: - Prior SaaS business experience- Experience with Domo, Tableau, or other relevant data visualization tool- Demonstrated ability to deploy ML models that yield measurable results- Experience with Cloud Storage and Compute: AWS (S3, EC2, and EMR) and Snowflake- Experience with modeling and manipulating data using Apache SparkSo, if you are a Sr. Data Scientist with 3+ years of R or Python experience, please apply today!

Shape Security is seeking a driven, analytical and highly professional individual who is looking to take on new challenges as an analyst in our Threat Intelligence team.This role has an engaging mix of data analytics and customer/business engagement. It involves big data analysis and presentations to executive audiences, as well as production of marketing collateral, hosting webinars, co-authoring industry papers and assisting the Sales team by presenting to prospective and POC customers.If you have a passion for deriving actionable insights from complex big data sets, love to work with intricate statistical analysis, and want to be a subject matter expert (SME) in web and mobile security, then we’d love to talk with you.Analyze large volumes of web and mobile traffic of Global 2000 organizations both on a regular and ad-hoc basis, and produce intelligence reports/presentations for their senior management. Develop recommendations on improving the web and mobile security of clients and their customers, and work cross-functionally within Shape to implement these recommendations. Work cross-functionally to guide the future of our analytics product. Become a subject matter expert through exposure to Shape’s proprietary data and internal teams. Assist marketing with the production of blog articles, hosting of webinars and provision of data for marketing campaigns and research papers. Speak at industry and internal conferences to share results of analysis and research. 5+ years analytical experience working with large-scale datasets. Experience with cybersecurity/web security highly preferred but not required. Strong analytical skills including the ability to manipulate, model and interpret large quantities of structured data. Excellent communication and presentation skills, including experience presenting analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. Proficiency in SQL and in at least one major programming language (e.g. Python). Proficiency in packages/tools/frameworks for data analytics and visualization (e.g. Jupyter notebooks, Pandas, Kibana, d3.js) highly preferred but not required. Strong interpersonal skills, personable, and persistent. Self-motivated, able to work well both independently and as part of an agile team. Demonstrated enthusiasm and capacity to learn new technologies quickly. Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, or Operations Research required.Pandologic. Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. We are recruiting highly motivated individuals for software development roles on the Enterprise Reference Data Engineering Team, based in New York/SLC/London/Warsaw/Bengaluru/Tokyo.Effectively leveraging financial market data to drive business is the key for successful financial services firm provide to its customers and working with massive volumes of data quickly is a differentiator. It gives firm the opportunity to respond more quickly to changes, gain deeper insights and forecast capabilities. The challenges related to use the data to drive innovation and customer experience are even greater.Our team builds platforms and technology solutions to model, source, and distribute the data including clients, accounts, financial products and prices to all of firm systems. We are an accelerator and enabler for business, making them more effective at managing and optimizing consumption of reference data, abstracting client, market and regulatory changes through innovative solutions.Our team is made of software developers and technical product owners with deep technical skills and an affinity for creating solutions with the potential for enterprise-wide impact.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  You will be part of the technology function for Enterprise Reference Data, focusing on building data sourcing, controls and distribution architecture that enables the business to operate efficiently with the data You should be able to quickly build visualizations on top of MongoDB / Sybase / DB2 / Elastic Search data to meet business needs, as well as be the thought leader to influence functional heads on new and innovate ways to visualize data that will help drive business value You will help design data architecture to enhance existing pipelines as well as build feeds for new data sources You will participate in data architecture decisions and partner with technology teams to implement data products in production systems. You will work closely with business partners and technology leaders to evaluate new BI tools that can further enhance the business’ ability to analyze data You should be able to commercialize data products and influence leadership on the value of these products This is a wide open opportunity for a motivated individual to use their skills to drive change in a high-visibility, challenging environmentSkills And Experience We Are Looking For Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines 7+ years of software industry experience with strong analytical and problem solving skills Hands on experience in one of the mainstream programming language (Java, C++, etc.) using object-oriented design techniques and best practices Basic understanding of distributed and scalable system design Experience in working with SQL/NoSQL data stores (e.g. Sybase/MongoDB) Experience of test-driven development, hands on experience with testing frameworks such as JUnit. Proficiency in using advance data structures and algorithms Experience working with business or Clients to transform requirements into software solutions Demonstrable history of successful project delivery Good communication and interpersonal skills.Preferred Qualifications Hands-on experience with the MongoDB or any big data platform and one or more mainstream programming languages (Python, Java, C, Scala, C++, etc.) Experience of working with cloud platform APIs and vendors 2 years’ experience dealing with data (structured or unstructured) 1 years’ experience in fintech industry Experience in designing, building and maintaining distributed and large-scale applications Experience working in a start-up business or a new business line within a larger organization is preferred Experience in building data products from inception to implementation Web services development: RESTful APIs; Swagger; Jersey; Glassfish Hands-on experience working with Linux and basic scripting (Bash)About Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. Womply’s mission is to help small businesses thrive in a digital world. Our AI-powered data platform enhances our comprehensive small business management software, which includes the world’s only pre-populated CRM plus small business intelligence, reputation management, marketing automation, and integrated payments. Every day, we serve more than 150,000 small businesses across 400+ verticals, in every corner of America.As the VP of Sales, you will be a key team member of our leadership team, responsible for building and scaling the sales team, defining the sales strategy as we evolve our business model to be a large scale B2B SaaS business. The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of B2B sales with proven results in driving rapid growth at a SaaS business.What You Get To Do Build and lead a sales organization assuming responsibility for yearly, quarterly and monthly sales projections and revenue goals within the sales organization  Leadership: Coach, develop and attract world class sales talent. Building a culture where sales representatives / leaders thrive and are connected to the company mission.  Measuring and evaluating performance of sales team against clearly defined benchmarks. You love numbers and understands the important of efficiency, cohort analysis to turn insights into action.  Develop new channels to market and shape the company go to market strategy  Take a “hands-on” approach and assist the sales team in closing deals  Motivate and maintain a high morale performance-driven cultureAbout You A minimum of 10 years sales leadership experience with success in B2B SaaS environments  Experience leading high growth sales teams   Extensive knowledge of consultative selling to SMB buyers.   Demonstrate a customer-centric sales approach focused on customer needs  Demonstrate an ability to take complex problems, decompose them into simple processes and quickly implement them  Ability to create scalable processes and optimize them  Strategic thinker that leads by example and has the ability to dive into the details and execute  Results oriented individual, able to drive priorities and own outcomes  Excellent listening, negotiation, presentation, written and verbal communication skill Make an impact at Womply!We’re a fanatically values-based company with $50 million raised to accelerate our growth. If you want to make a big impact, let’s talk. We’re hiring in the Bay Area and Lehi, Utah for engineering, DevOps, design, data science, sales, marketing, business development, account management, and more.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join The HELPcard family! As a Senior Data Analyst, you will make business recommendations with data through complex analysis, mining, and visualization. You will learn to understand the nuances of our business and ensure that we capture and act on data to drive business impact.This position is more than data reporting. It will require a strong analytical and business mindset. You will leverage technical skills and creative thinking to design simple and effective dashboards to answer business questions. You will regularly work with executives and must be able to function under high stress situations. Most importantly, you’ll allow us to get unique and valuable insights that go beyond the obvious and help us achieve extraordinary results.What You'll DoIdentify opportunities for business improvement through analysis of underlying dataPresent and deliver valuable insights to operations stakeholdersCreate interactive data visualizations that allow the business leaders to react quickly to performance and market trends and make data-driven decisionsBuild and run models to determine optimal resource allocationAnalyze transaction patterns to prevent fraudExtract usable information from unstructured data using advanced data mining techniquesExtract usable information from structured data warehouse using Microsoft SQL ServerMinimum Experience & QualificationsBachelor’s degree in a technical field required (Math, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.); Master’s degree in a related field preferred5+ years’ experience in an analytics/data science roleExperience with data mining tools such as those found in R, SAS, or PythonAdvanced knowledge and experience with querying languages (SQL, etc.)Experience with Business Intelligence tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) Knowledge of report and dashboard design best practices Strong quantitative analytical abilitiesTrack record of achieving business results through creative problem solving and careful implementationCompensation, Perks & BenefitsWe know that talented people are attracted to companies with long term success, an amazing culture and one that provides competitive pay, comprehensive benefits and outstanding career advancement opportunities. If hired we offer:Competitive pay Medical/Dental/Vision Coverage, Life Insurance, 401K, PTO, Holiday Pay and Tuition ReimbursementSubsidized commuter pass/public transportationFree snacks and drinksOnsite gym and volleyball courtWHO IS THE HELPCARD?Founded in 1983 as Dent-A-Med, Inc. dba The HELPCard, an affiliate of Progressive Leasing, we provide financing and billing options for merchants and consumers with The HELPcard. The HELPcard is a line of credit primarily serving prime and near-prime consumers by providing flexible and affordable payment options for various goods and services including: medical procedures, furniture, retail, and more!The HELPCard does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where The HELPCard does business. OverviewAre you ready to join an organization where you can be a relentless force for a world of longer, healthier lives?Envision all Americans enjoying ideal cardiovascular health free of heart disease and stroke. At the American Heart Association and American Stroke Association, we get to work toward that goal every single day. Is it easy? No. Is it worthwhile? you bet!This is satisfying work that makes a real difference in people's lives. You can achieve professional growth with personal fulfillment. You will connect with people and make a lifesaving impact. You will partner with individuals, schools, lawmakers, healthcare providers and others to ensure everyone has access to healthier lifestyle choices and proper healthcare.ResponsibilitiesThe American Heart Association (AHA) has an excellent opportunity for a Statistical Analyst in our National Center office located in Dallas, Texas (remotehome based is acceptable)This role plays an integral part in supporting the daily functions of the Centers for Health Metrics and Evaluation. Responsibilities include performing statistical modeling and analysis of multi-level data sets in order to predict or report outcomes of AHA programs and research. Additional responsibilities include organization, analysis, and reporting of data collected from various sources, including AHA program data and national health surveillance data as well as applying various visualization and business intelligence tools to provide understanding and communicate data to support organizational decision making.Essential Job DutiesConducts data analysis with quantitative and qualitative data. Analyzes data using a variety of statistical methods such as, logistic and linear regression; GEE or random effects models for longitudinal or multilevel analysis, latent class group-based analyses, and analysis of missing data. Develops summary reports that include interpretation of findings.Assists in the management of studies conducted internally, such as those to evaluate AHA's programs and media campaigns. Assists in the management of studies conducted in collaboration with external partners and government collaborators, such as projects to develop external campaigns.Prepares statistical reports for ongoing scientific investigations and presentations, prepares program evaluation reports to inform recommendations for quality improvement; develop factsheets and brief reports to substantiate facts for all AHA activities.Develops and manages data dictionaries and documentation of data reporting standards. Oversees quality control of data collection and database management.Develops logical data models, documentation, and specifications for information systems, and decision support systems (e.g. My Life Check recommendations engine.Coordinates with program implementers to develop and optimize systems for data collection across the entire program lifecycle (planning, implementation, and evaluation.Develops interactivedynamic dashboards with tools like Tableau and R.Want to help get your resume to the top? Take a look at the experience we require:QualificationsMaster's Degree in Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Public Health (MS, MPH, MPP, MSPH) or a related field of study.Minimum of three (3) years of POST Degree experience in statistical analysis and modeling which includes hypothesis.Proficiency in statistical programming (SAS, STATA or similar.Proficiency in building, implementing and supporting Tableau data visualizations.Proficient with database management and analytic tools and languages supporting data analysis and reporting - R, Python, SQL, and Excel.Effective skills in project management, preferably in health program evaluation.Ability to work collaboratively and independently.Proficiency in database development, management, and quality control methods.Excellent written communication skills with a focus on interpretation of statistical output appropriate for a variety of audiences.Here are some of the preferred skills we are looking for:Candidate has an interest in tobacco control, media campaigns, cardiovascular or brain health promotions.Effective writing skills for different audiences (scientific, media, lay, etc.Experience with analysis of data focused on cardiovascular disease epidemiology or similarrelated chronic disease.Experience in Business Intelligence tools like Anteryx, Qlikview, Tableau and other data science certifications.So, are you ready to work for the largest voluntary health organization dedicated to fighting heart disease, stroke and other cardiovascular diseases?Click on New Resume (or Existing Resume if you have previously applied to AHA positions) to submit your online application. Only those deemed most qualified will be contacted to interview.At American Heart Association | American Stroke Association, diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity applies to both our workforce and the communities we serve as it relates to heart health and stroke prevention.to see other opportunities.Be sure to follow us on Twitter #TheAHALifeEOE Protected VeteransPersons with DisabilitiesLocation US-TX-DallasPosted Date 1 day ago (******** 1:28 PM)Requisition ID 2019-5525Job Family Group Science and ResearchJob Category Science & ResearchAdditional Locations US-AnywhereUS-AnywhereLocation: Salt Lake City,UTPandoLogic. Keywords: Statistical Analyst, Location: Salt Lake City, UT - 84105

You will use your understanding of data and modeling to make a difference.Our problems are open-ended and don't always have clear paths and solutions. Job_Title: Data Analyst- Staff/Sr at Primary Children's Hospital
Description: Job ID: 241186Greater Salt Lake areaDetailsAbout UsBeing a part of Intermountain Healthcare means joining a world-class team of over 37,500 employees and caregivers while embarking on a career filled with opportunities, strength, innovation, and fulfillment. Our mission is: Helping people live the healthiest lives possible.Our patients deserve the best in healthcare, and we deliver.To find out more about us, head to our career site here.Job DescriptionThis position is part of a team of data analysts at Primary Children’s Hospital. The Data Analyst collaborates with nurses, physicians and administrators to produce analytical solutions that support process improvement, operations, strategy, and increased patient safety.This role centers around the ability to use data from a myriad of vended and internally developed data platforms to help caregivers garner insights. This role will require the ability to understand how clinical and business work processes generate data and its contextual meaning. This role will work in collaboration with business partners to rapidly translate and present data that can be consumed by caregivers to help make clinical and business decisions. This role is enhanced by the ability to develop and leverage logical models, statistical knowledge, communication skills, and willingness to drive opportunities to improve data quality and structures in source systems.Essential Job DutiesThis position is responsible for providing analytical support at a system-wide level for pediatrics. May interact with stakeholders across the system. Typically, this position performs analysis on routine or moderately complex projects under general supervision.Core Essentials 1. Creates reports that answer multiple related questions as well as reports with linked content, drilldown and nested parameters. The report is formatted in such a way that leads the user through the report in a well-organized, easy to understand fashion. 2. Writes ad hoc SQL, including basic selects, joins, use of Where clause and simple functions (e.g., Trunc, Sum, Min, Max, Avg, Concat, etc.). 3. Understanding of Primary / Foreign Keys, Table / Field Aliases, and Partitions / Indexes. 4. Assists in the identification of data quality (accuracy, completeness, etc.) issues. Assists with the process of database design for assigned projects. As appropriate, trains other individuals and teams in the routine use of data collection, analysis, and reporting and interpretation tools for measuring performance. Posting Specifics Benefits Eligible: Yes Shift Details: Full time day position; M-F Department: Pediatric Analytics, Primary Children's Hospital At this time we are unable to sponsor individuals that require a visa.  Minimum Requirements Master's degree,or Bachelor's degree with two years of analytics experience. Education must be obtained through an accredited institution. Degree will be verified. Demonstrated proficiency and a working knowledge of SQL (structured query language), quality improvement principles, and a fundamental knowledge of database design principles. Demonstrated experience in the developing, analyzing, interpreting, and managing of a variety of moderately complex data sets. Demonstrated capabilities in planning, participating, and managing moderately complex analytics projects. Demonstrated experience using word processing, spreadsheet, database, internet and e-mail, and scheduling applications. Demonstrated experience in a role requiring effective verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills. Physical Requirements Interact with others requiring the employee to verbally communicate information. Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands. See and read computer monitors and documents Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment. Preferred Requirements Degree in an analytics related field such as statistics, mathematics, information systems, computer science, finance, business management, or economics. If degree is not in an analytics related field, four years of analytics experience demonstrating proficiency performing the job essentials at this job level. Basic understanding of statistical concepts and tools. Basic understanding of some programing languages. Applied understanding of data visualization design best practices. Basic experience with SQL query tuning. Experience in healthcare/clinical data. Please NoteAll positions subject to close without notice. Intermountain Healthcare prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, veteran status, disability and/or genetic information.

As a Analytics Manager focused on Marketing Data at Progressive Leasing, you will lead discovery of customer, market, campaign insights, and development of strategic recommendations that shape marketing investment choices through complex analytics. You will work closely with Progressive’s marketing and data science teams to improve the lease-to-own customer experience, drive new customer acquisition, and maximize customer lifetime value via repeat leases. You will have an opportunity to work with a rich data set and leading data technologies including AI and machine learning. You will blend analytics, data mining, modeling, and reporting to drive fundamental shifts in the way we do business.You will develop a profound understanding of the subprime customer, offline and online marketing campaign performance, and various methods of customer acquisition and customer relationship marketing. This understanding will inform our marketing roadmap and drive to a measurable, constantly improving return on marketing spend. Most importantly, you will be part of a team that serves as the backbone of one of Utah’s fastest growing companies, in an exciting, emerging industry.What You’ll DoDevelop deep analytical insights around the lease-to-own customer experience marketing spendMake data driven recommendations to the marketing organization on how to improve the customer experience and where to invest marketing dollarsPresent to key retail partners to help influence marketing spend in-store, out-of-store, and in targeted and mass mediaBe a highly motivated, result-oriented self-starter who can deliver results with minimal guidanceDefine, build, analyze, monitor, and report Key Results and KPIs that inform marketing strategyAnalyze and report on customer behavior, sentiment, and outcomes to non-technical business partnersDesign and implement a model for measuring a tracking customer lifetime valueDevelop test and control market analysis capability and train internal teams on how to leverage this capability to test marketing spend at a market/store levelLead marketing attribution modeling and assist with A/B testingAnalyze and report on campaign performance outcomes to non-technical business partnersCollect, process, clean, transform, and validate data from a variety of sources so that it can be used for analysis by the team and the businessBuild strategic relationships and manage communication and alignment across multiple partner teams including: Marketing, Product Management, Design, Development, Sales, and OperationsUnderstand the Progressive Leasing business, product strategy, data, and toolsSupport the marketing team with customer research, industry research, reporting/analytics, and general coordination of projects to improve customer and marketing understanding and reporting capabilityMinimum Experience & QualificationsData driven mindset with 5+ years’ work experience doing quantitative analysis or customer research and/or degree in either a CS, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or another quantitative discipline 5+ years’ experience applying advanced statistical modeling techniques to solve complex problemsCreate telling stories from diverse analytic and behavioral inputsGenerate questions and analysis that drive the business forwardLead marketing attribution modeling/ROI measurementSet up and execute Aaron’s, Inc (NYSE: AAN), is the largest and longest-tenured virtual lease-to-own provider in the United States. The company’s mission is to provide simple and affordable purchase options for credit-challenged consumers. Over the last 19+ years, Progressive Leasing’s fair and transparent NO CREDIT NEEDED lease-to-own option has helped millions of customers and their families, even if they have less-than-perfect credit or an inability to pay for their purchase upfront. Progressive has also helped more than 27,000 retail stores drive increased revenue and improve customer satisfaction. About AncestryWhen you join Ancestry, you join our family tree. Backed by history, science, and technology, were creating a new world of connection, innovation, and understanding. Whether its reuniting long-lost relatives through DNA or unearthing new family stories from historical records, Ancestry empowers life-changing experiences. With over 20 billion digitized historical records, 100 million family trees, and 15+ million DNA kits sold, Ancestry is bringing the power of personal discovery to people around the world.Ancestry is looking for a highly motivated Software Engineer, Intern to join our Search UI team. The Search UI team creates and maintains a dynamic user interface that helps users search across billions of pieces of data in their quest to find details about their ancestral past. You will be developing solutions to simplify the discovery process and help users preserve the information they find. As a Software Engineer, on the Search UI team you will participate in architectural discussions on how the software should function, write innovative code to create new features or improve existing features, create unit tests, fix defects, and release software to the live site.What You'll DoParticipate in a scrum team by attending daily stand-up meetingsWrite and submit quality code as part of the regular release cycle to a Git repository using a pull request process so that the development team can review each others codeParticipate as a reviewer on pull requests made by other development team membersWrite test plans and unit tests to properly test newly written codeWho You AreMust be currently enrolled in a university and graduating after Summer 2020 Knowledge of client-side application development using JavaScript language features, frameworks and tooling (Node.js)Knowledge of object oriented programmingUnderstanding of debugging techniquesUnderstanding of unit testingUse of Git as a source repositoryIt takes customer obsession to pioneer and focus on what matters most, to tackle challenges, break through boundaries to create change, to stay on the cutting edge, and pioneer relentlessly. Job_Title: Enterprise Reference Data - Software Engineer (DIO - RefData) - Enterprise Reference Data
Description: Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. We are recruiting highly motivated individuals for software development roles on the Enterprise Reference Data Engineering Team, based in New York/SLC/London/Warsaw/Bengaluru/Tokyo. Effectively leveraging financial market data to drive business is the key for successful financial services that firm provides to its customers, and working with massive volumes of data quickly is a differentiator. It gives firm the opportunity to respond more quickly to changes, gain deeper insights and forecast capabilities. The challenges related to use the data to drive innovation and customer experience are even greater. Our team builds platforms and technology solutions to model, source, and distribute the data including clients, accounts, financial products and prices to all of firm systems. We are an accelerator and enabler for business, making them more effective at managing and optimizing consumption of reference data, abstracting client, market and regulatory changes through innovative solutions. Our team is made of software developers and technical product owners with deep technical skills and an affinity for creating solutions with the potential for enterprise-wide impact.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS You will be part of the technology function for Enterprise Reference Data, focusing on building data sourcing, controls and distribution architecture that enables the business to operate efficiently with the data.You should be able to quickly build visualizations on top of MongoDB / Sybase / DB2 / Elastic Search data to meet business needs, as well as be the thought leader to influence functional heads on new and innovate ways to visualize data that will help drive business value.You will help design data architecture to enhance existing pipelines as well as build feeds for new data sources.You will work closely with business partners and technology leaders to evaluate new tools that can further enhance the business’ ability to analyze data.You will participate in data architecture decisions and partner with technology teams to implement data products in production systems.This is a wide open opportunity for a motivated individual to use their skills to drive change in a high-visibility, challenging environment.Skills And Experience We Are Looking ForBachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines2+ years of software industry experience with strong analytical and problem solving skillsHands on experience in one of the mainstream programming language (Java, C++, etc.) using object-oriented design techniques and best practicesExperience of test-driven development, hands on experience with testing frameworks such as JUnit.Good understanding and experience in using data structures and algorithmsBasic understanding in working with SQL/NoSQLGood communication and interpersonal skillsPreferred QualificationsBasic understanding on any big data platform and data analysis methodologiesAt least 1 year experience dealing with data (structured or unstructured)Experience in working with SQL/NoSQL data stores (e.g. MongoDB)Good understanding of distributed and scalable system designWorking with client to transform requirements into software solutionsExperience working in a start-up business or a new business line within a larger organization is preferredWeb services development: RESTful APIs; Swagger; Jersey; GlassfishHands-on experience working with Linux and basic scripting (Bash)About Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.Division Engineering

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We unite Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting!), 18 timezones, and 30 different languages into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.The Elastic Security Data Engineering team designs, builds, and runs data processing pipelines that synthesize security data from a broad set of sources and deliver innovative detection capabilities that power our security products. We are looking for a Data Engineer to craft stream data processing and machine learning systems powering security products that dynamically adapt to changing threats. You will collaborate with the broader Elastic Security team, a diverse set of security researchers, data scientists, and engineers who lend domain expertise to work with you to solve creative security problems and deliver fantastic user experiences.What You Will Be Doing Work as part of the Security Protections team at Elastic with other data engineers, data scientists, and security researchers Improve and expand our security data pipeline across all aspects of software telemetry, data ingest, storage, real-time and batch analytics, machine learning, and data-powered web services Write code in a collaborative environment for new data pipelines and web services Operate and improve cloud-hosted big data systems that manage and analyze malware samples and security activity events Collaborate with security research engineers and data scientists to measure and improve security protections and ML models Collaborate with Elastic Stack software engineers to build multifaceted cloud-based services that deliver a continuously improving user experience Advocate for data-powered services and experiences across the Elastic product portfolio What You Bring Along 7+ years experience programming in Python, OCaml, Go, or equivalent experience in a similar language and ability to learn these languages quickly 5+ years experience building, deploying and operating production-quality distributed data storage and processing systems in an environment of continuous integration and delivery Demonstrated experience designing and building public-cloud hosted infrastructure with AWS, GCP, Docker, and/or Terraform Proficient peer leader with experience partnering with other senior technical and business leaders to lead and mentor junior engineers Collaborative attitude with a strong disposition to learn new skills and emerging technologies Self-motivated and able to thrive in a distributed, fast-paced, and autonomous environment Passionate about protecting the world’s data from attack Desired Experience Or Interests Data streaming / database tech, e.g. SQL, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Spark Distributed systems / messaging tech, e.g. Kafka, NATS, AWS Lambda Functional programming, e.g. OCaml, Haskell Training, measuring, and improving ML models Endpoint and/or network information security Additional InformationWe're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Remote work-from-home option Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Equity Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads) Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Job_Title: Analytic Consultant 4 - Compliance Independent Risk Management
Description: Job DescriptionImportant Note  During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume prior to submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application.At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. The team focuses on several key risk types, including conduct, credit, financial crimes, information security, interest rate, liquidity, market, model, operational, regulatory compliance, reputation, strategic, and technology risk. The group provides leadership, enhances communications, assists with problem identification and solutions, and shares best practices. In addition, the group provides an enterprise-wide view of risk, assists management and our Board of Directors in identifying and monitoring risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and takes appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.This Analytic Consultant 4 is a key position within the Wells Fargo Compliance Independent Risk Management Home Lending analytics team. The Consultant will develop processes, analyses, and reporting to support compliance regulations implemented under the Dodd-Frank Act.Responsibilities Include Communicate project results and recommendations to senior leadership to support our strategic direction in the regulatory environment. Think outside the box to lead the development of new analytical techniques. Analyze transactional data, that is being captured in Regulatory Data Repository (RDR) compliance database, for project work Spearhead the development of analytical strategies for developing insights from time series data captured within this data repository. Utilize traditional statistical regression techniques.Project work may require the use of leading edge big data techniques for analyzing unstructured contextual data in Home Mortgage's loan application process.Please Note  Based on the volume of applications received, this job posting may be removed prior to the indicated close date. If you do not apply prior to the closing of this posting, we encourage you to apply for other opportunities with Wells Fargo.Required Qualifications6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modelingDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills5+ years of SAS programming experienceKnowledge and understanding of databases and data mining techniquesOutstanding problem solving and analytical skills with ability to turn findings into strategic imperativesAbility to work effectively, as well as independently, in a team environmentKnowledge and understanding of analytical methods used in statistical analysis, modeling, and reportingTeradata experience5+ years of SQL experienceSolid critical thinking skillsAbility to positively influence, motivate, and direct diverse teamsDemonstration and presentation facilitation skillsMetadata management and data integrity skillsAbility to develop partnerships and collaborate with other business and functional areasOther Desired Qualifications Able to analyze complex situations, and create and implement solutions to best protect the company from Legal, Regulatory, and Compliance risk Strong organizational and time management skills with the At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We unite Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting!), 18 timezones, and 30 different languages into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.The Elastic Security Data Engineering team designs, builds, and runs data processing pipelines that synthesize security data from a broad set of sources and deliver innovative detection capabilities that power our security products. We are looking for a Data Engineer to craft stream data processing and machine learning systems powering security products that dynamically adapt to changing threats. You will collaborate with the broader Elastic Security team, a diverse set of security researchers, data scientists, and engineers who lend domain expertise to work with you to solve creative security problems and deliver fantastic user experiences.What You Will Be Doing Work as part of the Security Protections team at Elastic with other data engineers, data scientists, and security researchers Improve and expand our security data pipeline across all aspects of software telemetry, data ingest, storage, real-time and batch analytics, machine learning, and data-powered web services Write code in a collaborative environment for new data pipelines and web services Operate and improve cloud-hosted big data systems that lead and analyze malware samples and security activity events Collaborate with security research engineers and data scientists to measure and improve security protections and ML models Collaborate with Elastic Stack software engineers to build multifaceted cloud-based services that deliver a continuously improving user experience Advocate for data-powered services and experiences across the Elastic product portfolio What You Bring Along 2+ years experience programming in Python, OCaml, Go, or equivalent experience in a similar language and ability to learn these languages quickly 2+ years experience building, deploying and operating production-quality distributed systems in an environment of continuous integration and delivery Proficient managing cloud hosted infrastructure with AWS, GCP, Docker, Terraform, or the ability to learn these tools quickly Collaborative attitude with a strong disposition to learn new skills and emerging technologies Self-motivated and able to thrive in a distributed, fast-paced, and autonomous environment Passionate about protecting the world’s data from attack Desired Experience Or Interests Data streaming / database tech, e.g. SQL, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Spark Distributed systems / messaging tech, e.g. Kafka, NATS, AWS Lambda Functional programming, e.g. OCaml, Haskell Training, measuring, and improving ML models Endpoint and/or network information security Additional InformationWe're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Remote work-from-home option Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Equity Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads) Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

If you are an active Vivint employee, please apply through Workday by searching "Find Jobs".Job DescriptionWhy you’ll be excited to work at Vivint InternetWe are on a bold mission to offer a new model to how we provide home internet and connect the things you care about in your home built around our industry-leading millimeter wave technology and our deep focus on customer experience. We are a growth-stage, Series-B company with investors that include Blackstone and Peter Thiel, that has developed a new mesh wireless technology that enables us to quickly enter new markets and offer internet speeds up to 1Gbps with fiber grade capacity across large suburban areas. We know that most people aren’t happy with their home internet service today but haven’t really had many choices for broadband either. We aim to change that, quickly.What excites us is an opportunity to disrupt a trillion-dollar industry with a cutting-edge technology and a market leading customer experience. We have over 10,000 customers today in two metro markets and are looking to launch several new markets this year using our next generation technologies that will provide a very differentiated customer experience.As a growth-stage company aligned with the Vivint family, we combine a depth of capabilities and resources of our parent company with the ambition, culture and agility of a Series B startup.
