Job_Title: Data Governance and Quality Analyst, Intern
Description: About AncestryWhen you join Ancestry, you join our family tree. Backed by history, science, and technology, were creating a new world of connection, innovation, and understanding. Whether its reuniting long-lost relatives through DNA or unearthing new family stories from historical records, Ancestry empowers life-changing experiences. With over 20 billion digitized historical records, 100 million family trees, and 15+ million DNA kits sold, Ancestry is bringing the power of personal discovery to people around the world.Ancestry is looking for a highly motivated Data Governance and Quality Analyst, Intern to join our Data Governance and Quality team. The Data Governance and Quality team ensures quality data is used correctly as it flows through the enterprise. As a Data Governance and Quality Analyst, Intern on the Data Governance and Quality team you will increase visible Data Knowledge of existing engagement data and identify data quality issues. This will be done by performing detailed data profiling and analysis using our data quality tools, SQL (redshift), and visualization (tableau). Once an understanding of the data and quality issues are found work with the development and product teams to correct and document data issues/definitions which will be inserted into the internal Data Catalog. This will increase usability and confidence in the data.What You'll DoWork with various Product and Development to understand the assigned visit/engagement events data and site functionally that is used to create them.Using SQL (Redshift) or possibly other languages (python, ect) along with our data quality tools profile and analyze assigned tables to identify missing data, data anomalies, and incorrect data. Document these issues and then work with Product and Development Teams to correct were possible.Create Tableau report(s) to visually display missing and incorrect data that can be easily understood and will be used going forward to identify and alert for new issues.Present Data Quality findings to Product, Development, and Analyst Teams.Following policy/standards and working with Product and Development Teams document table, field, and data quality issues for the tables assigned. Inserting this data into the internal Data Catalog for Data Users to have access.Who You AreMust be currently enrolled in a university and graduating after Summer 2020 Basic SQL and visualization skills.Ability to do data analysis on large data sets to find anomalies and large changes in dataA passion for data quality and data governance.Nice to have previous experience working with data quality tools.It takes customer obsession to pioneer and focus on what matters most, to tackle challenges, break through boundaries to create change, to stay on the cutting edge, and pioneer relentlessly. We are looking for the next generation of talent to drive the business, grow our people, and put the customer before all else.Our culture empowers journeys of personal discovery, giving you the freedom to participate in impactful projects and explore the intersections of our businesses: technology, data science, DNA science, product, design, marketing, legal, and more. Were looking for innovative minds, diverse ideas, and for students interested in connecting personal discoveries and technology. Our interns enjoy mentorship and experience challenging work while receiving fantastic pay, fully-paid temporary housing, and having a fun captivating experiencewe have it all. Oh, and did we mention the possibility of full-time employment once you graduate?IND2Additional InformationAncestry is an Equal Opportunity Employer that makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, military or veteran status, citizenship, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. In addition, Ancestry will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.All job offers are contingent on a background check screen that complies with applicable law. For San Francisco office candidates, pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Ancestry will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Ancestry is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ancestry via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ancestry. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Ancestry as a result of the referral or through other means

Job ID: 242762Greater Salt Lake areaDetailsAbout UsBeing a part of Intermountain Healthcare means joining a world-class team of over 37,500 employees and caregivers while embarking on a career filled with opportunities, strength, innovation, and fulfillment. Our mission is: Helping people live the healthiest lives possible.Our patients deserve the best in healthcare, and we deliver.To find out more about us, head to our career site here.Job DescriptionThe Data Analytics Assistant Vice President defines and implements analytics strategy for Analytics function in alignment with system-wide strategies defined by the Executive Leadership Team for one or more of the major areas of focus for Intermountain Analytics (Clinical, Business, Healthcare Delivery, or Analytics Services). The Analytics executive has a broad portfolio and is responsible for leading analytics teams for a defined area of focus. This position oversees prioritization, budgeting, and execution of analytics initiatives. This leader defines the agenda for the area of focus and the Analytics Governance group. The AVP works collaboratively with senior leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups and expand to the organization. This leader is accountable for value creation of analytics within the portfolio. This key leader has a deep understanding of area of focus or related field. The AVP defines key analytics strategies in alignment with system priorities for each of the functional areas in their portfolio. As an analytics leader, this position is accountable for driving a culture of safety, accountability and engagement by ensuring work focuses on patient safety, creating a positive work environment, celebrating team's successes, developing new leaders and leading by example.Position PurposeThe AVP Clinical Analytics defines and implements analytics strategy for Clinical Analytics function for Intermountain Healthcare in alignment with system-wide strategies defined by the Executive Leadership Team. The Clinical Analytics executive will have a broad portfolio and be responsible for leading analytics teams for the following areas: Research, Patient Experience, Clinical Programs, Clinical Services, Research, and Care Management. These areas range from Pharmacy to Precision Health, Cardiovascular to Muscular Skeletal areas and much more. This position will oversee prioritization, budgeting, and execution of analytics initiatives. Role will also lead Clinical analytics integration into caregiver workflows in order to drive higher quality outcomes, care better for our patients, and fulfill our mission of Helping People Live the Healthiest Lives possible. Assures practices are evidenced based and consistent with regulatory guidelines. This leader will define the agenda for the Clinical Continuum Analytics Governance group and work collaboratively with senior leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups and expand to the organization. This leader will be accountable for value creation of analytics in their portfolio.ScopeThis key leader needs to have a deep understanding of analytics in a variety of Clinical areas, including publicly reported measures, systems such as Vizient, and a depth of understanding of key clinical problems and how to use analytics to solve for them. They will define key analytics strategies in alignment with system priorities for each of the functional areas in their portfolio. This position will report to Intermountain Healthcare’s Chief Analytics Officer. They will be responsible to drive adoption, define the product portfolio strategy in partnership with the Director of Product Management, and ensure data platform strategies are in place to support growth and needs for the future. They will manage relationships with key senior leaders at Intermountain, including our Chief Physician executive, VP of Office of Patient Experience, SVP of Clinical Programs and Services, VP of Clinical Services, and several more. This role will have oversight of several data and information management leaders and technical professionals including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and BI Professionals, research informaticists, and more.Essential Job Duties 1. Works with Chief Analytics Officer (CAO) and other key leaders to define a vision and strategy establishing the major area of focus within analytics as a competitive advantage for Intermountain Healthcare. 2. Ensures that Analytics resources are being deployed to support Intermountain leaders and projects of greatest strategic value to the organization. 3. Deploys data and financial analysis to support our key strategic initiatives. 4. Develops financial models to assess the profitability of proposed business initiatives. 5. Maintains a thorough understanding of the competitive landscape, including industry trends, strengths, weaknesses, etc., to aid in identifying business opportunities. 6. Creates ad-hoc analyses to improve efficiency and drive organizational strategy. 7. Designs and creates management dashboards with key KPIs to measure and track success. 8. Monitors feedback and success metrics and provides recommendations on future courses of action. 9. Establishes a high-performance, high-engagement culture which celebrates and encourages diversity. 10. Reports the value and ROI of Business Analytics initiatives. 11. Identifies emerging practices and technologies such as machine learning, AI, NLP, to increase the value of analytic output. 12. Promotes data-driven decision making and a data savvy culture throughout the organization. 13. Leads key managers and directors in functional areas to deliver on service promise, key SLA?s, and ensures a high NPS for customers served. 14. Plans and manages the daily operations within the parameters of departmental operating and capital budgets. 15. Directs the work of employees for area of accountability, including staffing, goal setting, coaching and mentoring, employee recognition and training, and performance management to include addressing performance concerns through corrective action. 16. Manages customer, stakeholder, and vendor relationships and expectations. Focuses on solutions and strategies that create win / win situations both inside and outside of the organization. 17. Regularly communicates with staff through huddles, team meetings, individual one on one meetings, rounding and skip level interviews as appropriate, and manages resource allocation to projects to ensure timely delivery within budget and according to requirements. Posting Specifics Wage: commensurate with experience Benefits Eligible: Yes Shift Details: Full Time Department: Enterprise Analytics Minimum Requirements Master's degree in business administration, computer science, information management or Data-related field. Education must be obtained through an accredited institution. Degree will be verified.or Advanced Clinical degree (e.g., MD, DO, PharmD, MSN) with advanced training in analytics principles and processes, such as medical informatics. Clinical incumbents whose specialty require licensure (e.g. Pharmacists, Registered Nurses, Respiratory Therapists) must hold current state licensure. Ten years of related experience, such as analytics business management, legal, financial or information or IT management, recently at or near the executive level and related to one of the Analytics areas of focus listed above. Five years of progressive leadership experience in leading cross-functional teams and enterprise-wide programs, operating and influencing effectively across the organization and within complex contexts. Five years of experience in information-intensive industries or digitally advanced enterprises requiring a strong business enterprise knowledge. Experience in integrating complex cross-corporate processes and data models or designing strategic metrics and scorecards. Experience using word processing, spreadsheet, database, internet, and e-mail and scheduling applications. Experience in a role requiring effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.  Physical Requirements Interact with others requiring the employee to communicate information. Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands. See and read computer monitors and documents. Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment.  Preferred Qualifications Experience directly managing analytics teams in one of these areas: Clinical, Business, Healthcare Delivery, or Analytics Services. Operational or Clinical Experience in one of the areas of focus listed above. Experience with Product Development and Agile Development methodologies. Experience with Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence methodologies. Experience with applied advanced analytics to drive workflow enhancement. Master's degree in information management or Data-related field or equivalent Clinical Education.  Please NoteAll positions subject to close without notice. Intermountain Healthcare prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, veteran status, disability and/or genetic information.

If you are a Sr. Data Scientist with 3+ years of R or Python experience, please read on!As a member of the Data Science team, you will play a pivotal role in building out and supporting our new API division through the development of data matching, customer profiles and business profiles. Our team is comprised of Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Business Intelligence Analysts that use our vast and growing data to support and enhance our data and ML models that power our products and decision making. You will use your understanding of data and modeling to make a difference.Our problems are open-ended and don't always have clear paths and solutions. We understand the workflow from a high level, and that context helps us build the right solutions. This is where your unique skills and interests come into play. We are looking for someone who is driven, with a strong intellectual curiosity of understanding challenges and problems, works well cross functionally, and can provide actionable insights and solutions. We look for people who take pride in their work, execute on it, and deliver phenomenal results.What's In It for You- Competitive compensation and bonus structure- Flexible time off- 9 paid holidays- Generous medical, dental, and vision coverage- Flexible spending accounts (FSA)- Short term disability insurance/AD&D/voluntary life- Pre-tax commuter/parking benefit- Wellness program- Tuition reimbursement- Vanguard 401k plan with the best fund options and the Roth/after-tax optionWhat You Will Be Doing- Develop and implement algorithms for cleaning, integrating, and evaluating large datasets from multiple disparate sources- Learn and understand a broad range of our data resources and know when, how, and which to use and which not to use- Collaborate with cross-functional teams from Data Engineering, Engineering, and Product to understand current processes and improve our data- Wrangling and modeling data from multiple data sources including Snowflake, AWS, and SaaS tools- Identifying and understanding source data systems and become an expert of data architecture, sources and flows- Provide mentorship and technical guidance to the Data Science TeamWhat You Need for this PositionMust have skills: - Masters Degree with an emphasis in Statistics, Data Science, or a related field- 2+ years of people management- 3+ years experience using R and/or Python (R preferred)- 3+ years experience with Postgres, MySQL, or T-SQL (Postgres preferred)- At least 3-5 years of experience working in an Analytics / Data Science environment- Experience working with databases and SQL in a business environment- Strong experience working with large and complex datasets- Team-oriented, self-motivated, success-driven, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude- Strong intellectual curiosity and demonstrated ability to understand and question the data- Deep analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to turn data into insights and solutions- Strong ability to interact, communicate, present and influence within multiple levels of the organization- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills- Ability to be adaptable and flexible in responding to deadlines and workflow fluctuationsNice to have skills: - Prior SaaS business experience- Experience with Domo, Tableau, or other relevant data visualization tool- Demonstrated ability to deploy ML models that yield measurable results- Experience with Cloud Storage and Compute: AWS (S3, EC2, and EMR) and Snowflake- Experience with modeling and manipulating data using Apache SparkSo, if you are a Sr. Data Scientist with 3+ years of R or Python experience, please apply today!

Shape Security is seeking a driven, analytical and highly professional individual who is looking to take on new challenges as an analyst in our Threat Intelligence team.This role has an engaging mix of data analytics and customer/business engagement. It involves big data analysis and presentations to executive audiences, as well as production of marketing collateral, hosting webinars, co-authoring industry papers and assisting the Sales team by presenting to prospective and POC customers.If you have a passion for deriving actionable insights from complex big data sets, love to work with intricate statistical analysis, and want to be a subject matter expert (SME) in web and mobile security, then we’d love to talk with you.Analyze large volumes of web and mobile traffic of Global 2000 organizations both on a regular and ad-hoc basis, and produce intelligence reports/presentations for their senior management. Develop recommendations on improving the web and mobile security of clients and their customers, and work cross-functionally within Shape to implement these recommendations. Work cross-functionally to guide the future of our analytics product. Become a subject matter expert through exposure to Shape’s proprietary data and internal teams. Assist marketing with the production of blog articles, hosting of webinars and provision of data for marketing campaigns and research papers. Speak at industry and internal conferences to share results of analysis and research. 5+ years analytical experience working with large-scale datasets. Experience with cybersecurity/web security highly preferred but not required. Strong analytical skills including the ability to manipulate, model and interpret large quantities of structured data. Excellent communication and presentation skills, including experience presenting analytical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. Proficiency in SQL and in at least one major programming language (e.g. Python). Proficiency in packages/tools/frameworks for data analytics and visualization (e.g. Jupyter notebooks, Pandas, Kibana, d3.js) highly preferred but not required. Strong interpersonal skills, personable, and persistent. Self-motivated, able to work well both independently and as part of an agile team. Demonstrated enthusiasm and capacity to learn new technologies quickly. Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, or Operations Research required.Pandologic. Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. We are recruiting highly motivated individuals for software development roles on the Enterprise Reference Data Engineering Team, based in New York/SLC/London/Warsaw/Bengaluru/Tokyo.Effectively leveraging financial market data to drive business is the key for successful financial services firm provide to its customers and working with massive volumes of data quickly is a differentiator. It gives firm the opportunity to respond more quickly to changes, gain deeper insights and forecast capabilities. The challenges related to use the data to drive innovation and customer experience are even greater.Our team builds platforms and technology solutions to model, source, and distribute the data including clients, accounts, financial products and prices to all of firm systems. We are an accelerator and enabler for business, making them more effective at managing and optimizing consumption of reference data, abstracting client, market and regulatory changes through innovative solutions.Our team is made of software developers and technical product owners with deep technical skills and an affinity for creating solutions with the potential for enterprise-wide impact.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  You will be part of the technology function for Enterprise Reference Data, focusing on building data sourcing, controls and distribution architecture that enables the business to operate efficiently with the data You should be able to quickly build visualizations on top of MongoDB / Sybase / DB2 / Elastic Search data to meet business needs, as well as be the thought leader to influence functional heads on new and innovate ways to visualize data that will help drive business value You will help design data architecture to enhance existing pipelines as well as build feeds for new data sources You will participate in data architecture decisions and partner with technology teams to implement data products in production systems. You will work closely with business partners and technology leaders to evaluate new BI tools that can further enhance the business’ ability to analyze data You should be able to commercialize data products and influence leadership on the value of these products This is a wide open opportunity for a motivated individual to use their skills to drive change in a high-visibility, challenging environmentSkills And Experience We Are Looking For Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines 7+ years of software industry experience with strong analytical and problem solving skills Hands on experience in one of the mainstream programming language (Java, C++, etc.) using object-oriented design techniques and best practices Basic understanding of distributed and scalable system design Experience in working with SQL/NoSQL data stores (e.g. Sybase/MongoDB) Experience of test-driven development, hands on experience with testing frameworks such as JUnit. Womply’s mission is to help small businesses thrive in a digital world. Our AI-powered data platform enhances our comprehensive small business management software, which includes the world’s only pre-populated CRM plus small business intelligence, reputation management, marketing automation, and integrated payments. Every day, we serve more than 150,000 small businesses across 400+ verticals, in every corner of America.As the VP of Sales, you will be a key team member of our leadership team, responsible for building and scaling the sales team, defining the sales strategy as we evolve our business model to be a large scale B2B SaaS business. The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of B2B sales with proven results in driving rapid growth at a SaaS business.What You Get To Do Build and lead a sales organization assuming responsibility for yearly, quarterly and monthly sales projections and revenue goals within the sales organization  Leadership: Coach, develop and attract world class sales talent. Building a culture where sales representatives / leaders thrive and are connected to the company mission.  Measuring and evaluating performance of sales team against clearly defined benchmarks. You love numbers and understands the important of efficiency, cohort analysis to turn insights into action.  Develop new channels to market and shape the company go to market strategy  Take a “hands-on” approach and assist the sales team in closing deals  Motivate and maintain a high morale performance-driven cultureAbout You A minimum of 10 years sales leadership experience with success in B2B SaaS environments  Experience leading high growth sales teams   Extensive knowledge of consultative selling to SMB buyers.   Demonstrate a customer-centric sales approach focused on customer needs  Demonstrate an ability to take complex problems, decompose them into simple processes and quickly implement them  Ability to create scalable processes and optimize them  Strategic thinker that leads by example and has the ability to dive into the details and execute  Results oriented individual, able to drive priorities and own outcomes  Excellent listening, negotiation, presentation, written and verbal communication skill Make an impact at Womply!We’re a fanatically values-based company with $50 million raised to accelerate our growth. If you want to make a big impact, let’s talk. We’re hiring in the Bay Area and Lehi, Utah for engineering, DevOps, design, data science, sales, marketing, business development, account management, and more.

If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.General Position SummaryWe are looking for a passionate and motivated engineering manager to lead one of our engineering team implementing Mobile applications that directly affect our students. This is a strategic area for WGU as it enables our vision of personalizing student experience at scale. We are actively building and expanding student journeys, improving staff and faculty experience and making our marketing campaigns and associated investments more efficient by aggressively investing in this area. This is an excellent opportunity for a technology leader with strong business acumen to collaborate with IT and business leaders to unlock the potential that our platform has to offer.The Software Engineering Manager will provide technical leadership, vision, direction, and mentoring for the software engineering team. This individual will manage a team of personnel who design, develop, and support Mobile applications to meet business requirements. The Software Engineering Manager will help deliver product and feature roadmaps and provide overall leadership and day to day management for a team of software engineering professionals. Additionally, they will provide resource planning and project scheduling using Agile/Scrum software development methodologies.Essential Functions And ResponsibilitiesLead a team of Mobile Native Software Engineers developing applications for iOS and Android.Provide technical leadership to the team including system and application level architectural oversight.Maintain high standards for software quality by establishing and following good practices and build a strong engineering culture of operational excellenceCollaborate with business stakeholders, product owners, architects and x-functional teams to plan, design, develop and deploy applications and services on time, within budget and scopeActively drive the development lifecycle from requirements analysis, feasibility estimates, design, code, demos, documentation, testing, implementation, and support.Responsible for design reviews, code reviews, and technical documentation.Support integrated applications with an understanding of system integration, test planning, scripting, monitoring and troubleshootingSupport a change management process to manage software releases, application patching and changes to production configurations.Lead the resolution of incidents and performance issues including root cause analysis (correction of errors aka COE’s)Manage multiple tasks and responsibilities in high-pressure environments; excelling at pinpointing and resolving problems in early project stages to avoid cost/time expenses.Exercise good judgment on Build vs. Buy by carefully assessing the business needs and the available internal or external solutions.Hire, retain, mentor, coach and develop technical talent on the team and help drive employee engagement.Set team goals, manage individual performance and mentor team members.REQUIRED SKILLSStrong people and management skills to interact with staff, colleagues, leadership, cross-functional teams and third parties.Commitment to quality through the ability to translate complex technical requirements into functional software using best practices. Expert in Agile methods including SCRUM, Design-Driven Development and Test-Driven Development.Designing and developing enterprise grade software in fast-paced distributed environments (highly scalable, reliable, available)Scalability, Availability, Load and Performance considerations and relevant best practicesStrong inclination towards improving solutions and/or surrounding processesExcellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work equally well in self-managed and team-based Agile/Scrum projects.Deep technical knowledge of Java based web applications using web services (REST/SOAP/SOA/XML/HTML). Experience with Continuous deploy and integration toolsOther Technical Experience That Would be a Plus:Swift, Kotlin, Native Script, Hybrid mobile appsJSF, J2EE, Java EE, jQuery, JavaScript.SQL, Oracle or other database interface experience, large data sets.Jira, IDM / OSSO.Student Information Systems.Document Management systems.Application Integration with legacy systemsPreferred Competencies Up to date knowledge of latest releases in SalesforceCloud based applications and infrastructure experience – AWS, machine learning, AIDocker and Kubernetes experienceREQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND/OR EDUCATION8+ years of hands-on development experience3 years of direct management experience requiredAt least 3 year of experience as a Mobile DeveloperKnowledge of object-oriented design and implementationBachelor's in computer science degree (or related discipline) required (master's preferred)As an equal opportunity employer, WGU recognizes that our strength lies in our people. We are committed to diversity.

Why QualtricsQualtrics is the technology platform that organizations use to collect, analyze, and act on experience data, also called X-data™. The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action, used by teams, departments, and entire organizations to manage the four core experiences of business—customer, product, employee and brand—on one platform. Over 10,000 enterprises worldwide, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100 and 99 of the top 100 U.S. business schools, rely on Qualtrics to consistently build products that people love, create more loyal customers, develop a phenomenal employee culture, and build iconic brands. Qualtrics was recently acquired by SAP, and together we will accelerate XM globally and power the experience economy. Join us on this adventure and define the future of Experience Management from technical perspective! If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment - apply now!The ChallengeAs a Principal Engineer for Qualtrics, you will be responsible for owning and delivering complex programs, spearheading investments, and defining the future technical vision. You will contribute substantially to initiatives such as the development of innovative new products, services, and features for our XM Platform.Expectations for Success  Serve as a technical lead on our most demanding, multi-functional projects.   Ensure the quality of component architecture and system designs.   Influence and drive the architecture of major technology areas within the company.   Contribute intellectual property through patent generation.   Functionally decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions.   Fully understand system interdependencies and limitations.   Demonstrate experienced knowledge in performance, scalability, enterprise system architecture, and exhibit and teach engineering standard methodologies.   Effectively research and benchmark Qualtrics’ technology against other best-in-class technologies and participate in technology adoption decisions.   Assist in the career development of others, actively mentoring individuals on advanced technical issues and helping managers guide the career growth of their team members.   Exert technical influence over multiple teams, growing their productivity and effectiveness by sharing your deep knowledge and experience.  Qualifications & Requirements  (7+)  Minimum of a Bachelor's of Science degree in Computer Science or related field   12+ years of relevant, broad engineering experience   Consistent track record of leading the delivery of large-scale, high-quality SaaS systems   Deep hands-on technical expertise in at least one major technical area: large scale Unix systems engineering, building complex distributed systems, building monitoring or management tools for large-scale environments.   Experience leading complex projects, with significant bottom-line impact   Experience leading development of process and standard processes   Experience with Agile Management (SCRUM, RUP, XP), Data Modeling, API design, Containerization, Networking, UNIX, and database or other storage and compute related projects   Experience mentoring/training an engineering community on complex technical issues   Experience working in a complex, service oriented software development.   2+ years of hands-on experience as a Principal-level software engineer.   A Day in the LifeYou will work with individual teams to ensure that all systems can scale to meet the ever-increasing demands of our rapidly growing business. You will identify and pursue opportunities to integrate technical solutions across all Qualtrics teams. You will also be expected to dedicatedly identify common problem spaces across teams and ensure we build best-in-class solutions to meet our customers’ needs without impeding the agility of individual business verticals. You will help drive the direction and development of a premier technology organization and be at the center of all key system level decisions.You will lead and engage in design reviews, architectural discussions, requirements definitions and other technical activities as a leader within Qualtrics. You’ll have the opportunity to work on our most complex problems. You will also give to the health of our engineering culture. You are a pragmatic visionary who can translate business needs into workable technology solutions. Your expertise is deep and broad; you’re hands on, capable of producing both detailed technical work and high-level architectural designs.What Differentiates Us From Other Companies  Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours    Qualtrics Experience Program - $1,500 for an experience of your choosing (eligible after a year)    We take pride in our offices design aiming at fostering creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space.    30 paid days off - 15 PTO + 5 Personal Days + 10 Holiday Closures (additional after a year)    On top of standard benefits package (medical employees and their families, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office    We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees  To learn more about what we value read about it directly from our employees Qualtrics Life stories

Job ID: 242763Greater Salt Lake areaDetailsAbout UsBeing a part of Intermountain Healthcare means joining a world-class team of over 37,500 employees and caregivers while embarking on a career filled with opportunities, strength, innovation, and fulfillment. Our mission is: Helping people live the healthiest lives possible.Our patients deserve the best in healthcare, and we deliver.To find out more about us, head to our career site here.Job DescriptionThe Data Analytics Assistant Vice President defines and implements analytics strategy for Analytics function in alignment with system-wide strategies defined by the Executive Leadership Team for one or more of the major areas of focus for Intermountain Analytics (Clinical, Business, Healthcare Delivery, or Analytics Services). The Analytics executive has a broad portfolio and is responsible for leading analytics teams for a defined area of focus. This position oversees prioritization, budgeting, and execution of analytics initiatives. This leader defines the agenda for the area of focus and the Analytics Governance group. The AVP works collaboratively with senior leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups and expand to the organization. This leader is accountable for value creation of analytics within the portfolio. This key leader has a deep understanding of area of focus or related field. The AVP defines key analytics strategies in alignment with system priorities for each of the functional areas in their portfolio. As an analytics leader, this position is accountable for driving a culture of safety, accountability and engagement by ensuring work focuses on patient safety, creating a positive work environment, celebrating team's successes, developing new leaders and leading by example.PurposeThe AVP over Business Analytics defines and implements analytics strategy for Business Analytics function in alignment with system-wide strategies defined by the Executive Leadership Team. The Business Analytics executive will have a broad portfolio and be responsible for leading analytics teams for the following areas: Marketing & Consumer Experience, Decision Support, Supply Chain, HR, Community Health, Strategy Office, Compliance, Risk Management, and more. This position will oversee prioritization, budgeting, and execution of analytics initiatives. This leader will define the agenda for the Shared Services Analytics Governance group and work collaboratively with senior leaders to define next generation analytic tools and solutions for those groups and expand to the organization. This leader will be accountable for value creation of analytics in their portfolio.ScopeThis key leader needs to have a deep understanding of analytics in Marketing, Finance, Supply Chain, HR, Strategy Office, and more. They will define key analytics strategies in alignment with system priorities for each of the functional areas in their portfolio. This position will report to Intermountain Healthcare’s Chief Analytics Officer (CAO). They will be responsible to drive adoption, define the product portfolio strategy in partnership with the Director of Product Management, and ensure data platform strategies are in place to support growth and needs for the future. They will manage relationships with key senior leaders at Intermountain, including Finance VP’s and CFO’s, Supply Chain VP, HR Senior Leadership, SVP of Community Health and more. This role will have oversight of several data and information management leaders and technical professionals including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and BI Professionals.Essential Job Duties 1. Works with Chief Analytics Officer (CAO) and other key leaders to define a vision and strategy establishing the major area of focus within analytics as a competitive advantage for Intermountain Healthcare. 2. Ensures that Analytics resources are being deployed to support Intermountain leaders and projects of greatest strategic value to the organization. 3. Deploys data and financial analysis to support our key strategic initiatives. 4. Develops financial models to assess the profitability of proposed business initiatives. 5. Maintains a thorough understanding of the competitive landscape, including industry trends, strengths, weaknesses, etc., to aid in identifying business opportunities. 6. Creates ad-hoc analyses to improve efficiency and drive organizational strategy. 7. Designs and creates management dashboards with key KPIs to measure and track success. 8. Monitors feedback and success metrics and provides recommendations on future courses of action. 9. Establishes a high-performance, high-engagement culture which celebrates and encourages diversity. 10. Reports the value and ROI of Business Analytics initiatives. 11. Identifies emerging practices and technologies such as machine learning, AI, NLP, to increase the value of analytic output. 12. Promotes data-driven decision making and a data savvy culture throughout the organization. 13. Leads key managers and directors in functional areas to deliver on service promise, key SLA?s, and ensures a high NPS for customers served. 14. Plans and manages the daily operations within the parameters of departmental operating and capital budgets. 15. Directs the work of employees for area of accountability, including staffing, goal setting, coaching and mentoring, employee recognition and training, and performance management to include addressing performance concerns through corrective action. 16. Manages customer, stakeholder, and vendor relationships and expectations. Focuses on solutions and strategies that create win / win situations both inside and outside of the organization. 17. Regularly communicates with staff through huddles, team meetings, individual one on one meetings, rounding and skip level interviews as appropriate, and manages resource allocation to projects to ensure timely delivery within budget and according to requirements. Posting Specifics Wage: commensurate with experience Benefits Eligible: Yes Shift Details: Full Time Department: Enterprise Analytics Minimum Requirements Master's degree in business administration, computer science, information management or Data-related field. Education must be obtained through an accredited institution. Degree will be verified.or Advanced Clinical degree (e.g., MD, DO, PharmD, MSN) with advanced training in analytics principles and processes, such as medical informatics. Clinical incumbents whose specialty require licensure (e.g. Pharmacists, Registered Nurses, Respiratory Therapists) must hold current state licensure. Ten years of related experience, such as analytics business management, legal, financial or information or IT management, recently at or near the executive level and related to one of the Analytics areas of focus listed above. Five years of progressive leadership experience in leading cross-functional teams and enterprise-wide programs, operating and influencing effectively across the organization and within complex contexts. Five years of experience in information-intensive industries or digitally advanced enterprises requiring a strong business enterprise knowledge. Experience in integrating complex cross-corporate processes and data models or designing strategic metrics and scorecards. Experience using word processing, spreadsheet, database, internet, and e-mail and scheduling applications. Experience in a role requiring effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.  Physical Requirements Interact with others requiring the employee to communicate information. Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands. See and read computer monitors and documents. Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment.  Preferred Qualifications Experience directly managing analytics teams in one of these areas: Clinical, Business, Healthcare Delivery, or Analytics Services. Operational or Clinical Experience in one of the areas of focus listed above. Experience with Product Development and Agile Development methodologies. Experience with Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence methodologies. Experience with applied advanced analytics to drive workflow enhancement. Master's degree in information management or Data-related field or equivalent Clinical Education.  Please NoteAll positions subject to close without notice. Intermountain Healthcare prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, veteran status, disability and/or genetic information.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join The HELPcard family! As a Senior Data Analyst, you will make business recommendations with data through complex analysis, mining, and visualization. You will learn to understand the nuances of our business and ensure that we capture and act on data to drive business impact.This position is more than data reporting. It will require a strong analytical and business mindset. You will leverage technical skills and creative thinking to design simple and effective dashboards to answer business questions. You will regularly work with executives and must be able to function under high stress situations. Most importantly, you’ll allow us to get unique and valuable insights that go beyond the obvious and help us achieve extraordinary results.What You'll DoIdentify opportunities for business improvement through analysis of underlying dataPresent and deliver valuable insights to operations stakeholdersCreate interactive data visualizations that allow the business leaders to react quickly to performance and market trends and make data-driven decisionsBuild and run models to determine optimal resource allocationAnalyze transaction patterns to prevent fraudExtract usable information from unstructured data using advanced data mining techniquesExtract usable information from structured data warehouse using Microsoft SQL ServerMinimum Experience & QualificationsBachelor’s degree in a technical field required (Math, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.); Master’s degree in a related field preferred5+ years’ experience in an analytics/data science roleExperience with data mining tools such as those found in R, SAS, or PythonAdvanced knowledge and experience with querying languages (SQL, etc.)Experience with Business Intelligence tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) Knowledge of report and dashboard design best practices Strong quantitative analytical abilitiesTrack record of achieving business results through creative problem solving and careful implementationCompensation, Perks & BenefitsWe know that talented people are attracted to companies with long term success, an amazing culture and one that provides competitive pay, comprehensive benefits and outstanding career advancement opportunities. If hired we offer:Competitive pay Medical/Dental/Vision Coverage, Life Insurance, 401K, PTO, Holiday Pay and Tuition ReimbursementSubsidized commuter pass/public transportationFree snacks and drinksOnsite gym and volleyball courtWHO IS THE HELPCARD?Founded in 1983 as Dent-A-Med, Inc. dba The HELPCard, an affiliate of Progressive Leasing, we provide financing and billing options for merchants and consumers with The HELPcard. The HELPcard is a line of credit primarily serving prime and near-prime consumers by providing flexible and affordable payment options for various goods and services including: medical procedures, furniture, retail, and more!The HELPCard does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where The HELPCard does business. About AncestryWhen you join Ancestry, you join our family tree. Backed by history, science, and technology, were creating a new world of connection, innovation, and understanding. Whether its reuniting long-lost relatives through DNA or unearthing new family stories from historical records, Ancestry empowers life-changing experiences. With over 20 billion digitized historical records, 100 million family trees, and 15+ million DNA kits sold, Ancestry is bringing the power of personal discovery to people around the world.Ancestry is looking for a Software developer Intern to help us build a new and exciting customer data platform that would handle millions of events flowing through it per day which, in turn, enables key business stakeholders to not only do analytics on it but also be proactive in making the customer experience better. This platform would be a major leap forward in making our organizational decisions become more data driven, and, out of the many applications that this platform would enable, personalization would be one that would help create a much more individualized customer experience.What You'll DoYou will collaborate with the Architect, Dev Manager and Engineers through the entire software development lifecycle to solve challenging and interesting problem.Work together with product and development teams to define software specificationsWrite clean, well designed, testable, efficient codeAutomate your code/deploy pipelineWho You AreMust be currently enrolled in a university and graduating after Summer 2020 2 or more years of relevant course work or equivalent industry experience.Strong communication and teamwork skillsPassion for learningJavaGood communication skills (verbal/written)It takes customer obsession to pioneer and focus on what matters most, to tackle challenges, break through boundaries to create change, to stay on the cutting edge, and pioneer relentlessly. We are looking for the next generation of talent to drive the business, grow our people, and put the customer before all else.Our culture empowers journeys of personal discovery, giving you the freedom to participate in impactful projects and explore the intersections of our businesses: technology, data science, DNA science, product, design, marketing, legal, and more. Were looking for innovative minds, diverse ideas, and for students interested in connecting personal discoveries and technology. Our interns enjoy mentorship and experience challenging work while receiving fantastic pay, fully-paid temporary housing, and having a fun captivating experiencewe have it all. Oh, and did we mention the possibility of full-time employment once you graduate?IND2Additional InformationAncestry is an Equal Opportunity Employer that makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, military or veteran status, citizenship, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. OverviewAre you ready to join an organization where you can be a relentless force for a world of longer, healthier lives?Envision all Americans enjoying ideal cardiovascular health free of heart disease and stroke. At the American Heart Association and American Stroke Association, we get to work toward that goal every single day. Is it easy? No. Is it worthwhile? you bet!This is satisfying work that makes a real difference in people's lives. You can achieve professional growth with personal fulfillment. You will connect with people and make a lifesaving impact. You will partner with individuals, schools, lawmakers, healthcare providers and others to ensure everyone has access to healthier lifestyle choices and proper healthcare.ResponsibilitiesThe American Heart Association (AHA) has an excellent opportunity for a Statistical Analyst in our National Center office located in Dallas, Texas (remotehome based is acceptable)This role plays an integral part in supporting the daily functions of the Centers for Health Metrics and Evaluation. Responsibilities include performing statistical modeling and analysis of multi-level data sets in order to predict or report outcomes of AHA programs and research. Additional responsibilities include organization, analysis, and reporting of data collected from various sources, including AHA program data and national health surveillance data as well as applying various visualization and business intelligence tools to provide understanding and communicate data to support organizational decision making.Essential Job DutiesConducts data analysis with quantitative and qualitative data. Analyzes data using a variety of statistical methods such as, logistic and linear regression; GEE or random effects models for longitudinal or multilevel analysis, latent class group-based analyses, and analysis of missing data. Develops summary reports that include interpretation of findings.Assists in the management of studies conducted internally, such as those to evaluate AHA's programs and media campaigns. Assists in the management of studies conducted in collaboration with external partners and government collaborators, such as projects to develop external campaigns.Prepares statistical reports for ongoing scientific investigations and presentations, prepares program evaluation reports to inform recommendations for quality improvement; develop factsheets and brief reports to substantiate facts for all AHA activities.Develops and manages data dictionaries and documentation of data reporting standards. Oversees quality control of data collection and database management.Develops logical data models, documentation, and specifications for information systems, and decision support systems (e.g. My Life Check recommendations engine.Coordinates with program implementers to develop and optimize systems for data collection across the entire program lifecycle (planning, implementation, and evaluation.Develops interactivedynamic dashboards with tools like Tableau and R.Want to help get your resume to the top? Take a look at the experience we require:QualificationsMaster's Degree in Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Public Health (MS, MPH, MPP, MSPH) or a related field of study.Minimum of three (3) years of POST Degree experience in statistical analysis and modeling which includes hypothesis.Proficiency in statistical programming (SAS, STATA or similar.Proficiency in building, implementing and supporting Tableau data visualizations.Proficient with database management and analytic tools and languages supporting data analysis and reporting - R, Python, SQL, and Excel.Effective skills in project management, preferably in health program evaluation.Ability to work collaboratively and independently.Proficiency in database development, management, and quality control methods.Excellent written communication skills with a focus on interpretation of statistical output appropriate for a variety of audiences.Here are some of the preferred skills we are looking for:Candidate has an interest in tobacco control, media campaigns, cardiovascular or brain health promotions.Effective writing skills for different audiences (scientific, media, lay, etc.Experience with analysis of data focused on cardiovascular disease epidemiology or similarrelated chronic disease.Experience in Business Intelligence tools like Anteryx, Qlikview, Tableau and other data science certifications.So, are you ready to work for the largest voluntary health organization dedicated to fighting heart disease, stroke and other cardiovascular diseases?Click on New Resume (or Existing Resume if you have previously applied to AHA positions) to submit your online application. Only those deemed most qualified will be contacted to interview.At American Heart Association | American Stroke Association, diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity applies to both our workforce and the communities we serve as it relates to heart health and stroke prevention.to see other opportunities.Be sure to follow us on Twitter #TheAHALifeEOE Protected VeteransPersons with DisabilitiesLocation US-TX-DallasPosted Date 1 day ago (******** 1:28 PM)Requisition ID 2019-5525Job Family Group Science and ResearchJob Category Science & ResearchAdditional Locations US-AnywhereUS-AnywhereLocation: Salt Lake City,UTPandoLogic. Keywords: Statistical Analyst, Location: Salt Lake City, UT - 84105

Job_Title: CIMD Operations - IMD Ops Management & Shared Services – Business Intelligence Analyst/Associate – Salt Lake City
Description: OPERATIONSOperations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the firm to provide banking, securities, and asset management services to clients around the world. In addition, Operations provides essential risk management and controls to preserve and enhance the firm's assets and its reputation. For every new product launched and every trade executed, it is Operations that develops and manages the processes and controls that enable business flow.YOUR IMPACTAre you looking to apply your quantitative skills while deepening your understanding of how businesses improve with data analytics? The IMD Change Management and Business Intelligence team is seeking a data science professional who will design and implement analytics that will drive continuous improvement and find new business opportunities within the Investment Management and Operations Division.OUR IMPACTThe IMD Operations – Change Management and Business Intelligence team contributes to leading Investment Management  programs by delivering business intelligence and analytics initiatives. This role will combine accountability and responsibility for automated solutions and business analytics, by exploiting artificial intelligence, process automation and data visualization tools, to generate business value.As a data science professional, efforts will include enabling artificial intelligence to solve business problems. The Associate will work closely with business representatives to make predictions and recommendations in line with IMD target operating model and ensure algorithms adapt to new data and experiences to improve efficacy over time and consequently improve business outcomes.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Analyze big data and undertake exploratory data analysis while observing best practices for experimentation / analysis  Synthesize analysis results to inform business outcomes  Develop indicators of performance and risk metrics  Extend / modify analysis based on observations / knowledge of data and limitations, implications of results  Drive the collection of new data and refinement of existing data sources (working closely with central finance)  Identify and escalate systems and strategy performance issues or trends  Contribute to global organization-wide initiatives  Track and report progress on projects, adhering to solution delivery lifecycle  Seek information / guidance / opportunities from inside and outside organization / industry to generate a point of view  Create visualization of analyses which facilitate decision-making Basic QualificationsSKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE’RE LOOKING FOR The candidate should possess a minimum of 1-5 years overall experience in (1) Data analytics, (2) Data visualization, (3) Project management, (4) Communication and stakeholder management, and (5) Data governance Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics / other relevant experience in consumer / financial / social / media tech companies in a role with a focus on data Passionate about data analysis and how this contributes to the business  Must understand advanced analytics and statistics, have good software design skills and “get it” when it comes to day-to-day realities of the business  Knowledge of data-related emerging trends and issues (including financial regulation)  Fast learner who can identify and design processes with economics, service, risk, and cost benefits  Ability to work independently to apply tools and techniques for productionalizing workflow  Experience in using business intelligence platforms (such as Alteryx, Tableau, Qlik)  Effective communicator of new / complex information  Self-motivated team player who is able to define structure and prioritize work, but who has the flexibility and capability to change priorities when circumstances dictate  Confidence to challenge and be innovative  Ability to develop cooperative and constructive working relationships with strong culture awareness Preferred Qualifications Financial Services and / or Asset Management experience  Experience with implementing data-driven improvement frameworks such as Six Sigma, Total Quality Management, or Statistical Process Control  Alternative business intelligence tools (such as Elastic, R, SQL, NoSQL, Zoomdata)  Basic knowledge of computer and/or database programming fundamentals (Object Oriented Programming, algorithms, etc.)  Skilled in SharePoint and PowerPoint About Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. You will use your understanding of data and modeling to make a difference.Our problems are open-ended and don't always have clear paths and solutions. We understand the workflow from a high level, and that context helps us build the right solutions. This is where your unique skills and interests come into play. We are looking for someone who is driven, with a strong intellectual curiosity of understanding challenges and problems, works well cross functionally, and can provide actionable insights and solutions. Job_Title: Data Analyst- Staff/Sr at Primary Children's Hospital
Description: Job ID: 241186Greater Salt Lake areaDetailsAbout UsBeing a part of Intermountain Healthcare means joining a world-class team of over 37,500 employees and caregivers while embarking on a career filled with opportunities, strength, innovation, and fulfillment. Our mission is: Helping people live the healthiest lives possible.Our patients deserve the best in healthcare, and we deliver.To find out more about us, head to our career site here.Job DescriptionThis position is part of a team of data analysts at Primary Children’s Hospital. The Data Analyst collaborates with nurses, physicians and administrators to produce analytical solutions that support process improvement, operations, strategy, and increased patient safety.This role centers around the ability to use data from a myriad of vended and internally developed data platforms to help caregivers garner insights. This role will require the ability to understand how clinical and business work processes generate data and its contextual meaning. This role will work in collaboration with business partners to rapidly translate and present data that can be consumed by caregivers to help make clinical and business decisions. This role is enhanced by the ability to develop and leverage logical models, statistical knowledge, communication skills, and willingness to drive opportunities to improve data quality and structures in source systems.Essential Job DutiesThis position is responsible for providing analytical support at a system-wide level for pediatrics. May interact with stakeholders across the system. Typically, this position performs analysis on routine or moderately complex projects under general supervision.Core Essentials 1. Creates reports that answer multiple related questions as well as reports with linked content, drilldown and nested parameters. The report is formatted in such a way that leads the user through the report in a well-organized, easy to understand fashion. 2. Writes ad hoc SQL, including basic selects, joins, use of Where clause and simple functions (e.g., Trunc, Sum, Min, Max, Avg, Concat, etc.). 3. Understanding of Primary / Foreign Keys, Table / Field Aliases, and Partitions / Indexes. 4. Assists in the identification of data quality (accuracy, completeness, etc.) issues. Assists with the process of database design for assigned projects. As appropriate, trains other individuals and teams in the routine use of data collection, analysis, and reporting and interpretation tools for measuring performance. Posting Specifics Benefits Eligible: Yes Shift Details: Full time day position; M-F Department: Pediatric Analytics, Primary Children's Hospital At this time we are unable to sponsor individuals that require a visa.  Minimum Requirements Master's degree,or Bachelor's degree with two years of analytics experience. Education must be obtained through an accredited institution. Degree will be verified. Demonstrated proficiency and a working knowledge of SQL (structured query language), quality improvement principles, and a fundamental knowledge of database design principles. Demonstrated experience in the developing, analyzing, interpreting, and managing of a variety of moderately complex data sets. Demonstrated capabilities in planning, participating, and managing moderately complex analytics projects. Demonstrated experience using word processing, spreadsheet, database, internet and e-mail, and scheduling applications. Demonstrated experience in a role requiring effective verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills. Physical Requirements Interact with others requiring the employee to verbally communicate information. Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands. See and read computer monitors and documents Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment. Preferred Requirements Degree in an analytics related field such as statistics, mathematics, information systems, computer science, finance, business management, or economics. If degree is not in an analytics related field, four years of analytics experience demonstrating proficiency performing the job essentials at this job level. Basic understanding of statistical concepts and tools. Basic understanding of some programing languages. Applied understanding of data visualization design best practices. Basic experience with SQL query tuning. Experience in healthcare/clinical data. Please NoteAll positions subject to close without notice. Intermountain Healthcare prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, veteran status, disability and/or genetic information.

Job_Title: Strats Deposit Modeler - Corporate Treasury Engineering - Finance Engineering
Description: The Corporate Treasury Strats team is looking for world class quantitative programmers to work closely with Corporate Treasury partners to employ quantitative analytics to drive optimizations of firm liquidity, cash and collateral management, funds transfer pricing and trade execution strategies. This is an integrated group which both explores new ideas for optimizing the funding management of the firm and also executes trading strategies, all in one team. Corporate Treasury lies at the heart of Goldman Sachs, ensuring that businesses have the appropriate level of funding to conduct their activities, while also optimizing the firm’s funding costs and managing liquidity risks. As part of the Corporate Treasury Engineering team you will be exposed to securities division and banking initiatives, to new business activities, and to critical strategic programs Goldman Sachs pursues to maintain its leadership among global financial institutions. Corporate Treasury Strats use their engineering and/or scientific background to implement quantitative analytics and management solutions in software. Corporate Treasury Engineering products guide funding souring decisions, allocation of financial resources, quantification of funding costs, and strategies to minimize costs and hedge risks. Successful strats are highly analytical, driven to own commercial outcomes, and communicate with precision and clarity.Corporate Treasury Strats welcomes applicants with Master’s or a PhD in financial engineering/financial math; quantitative sciences, e.g. physics, statistics, applied math or other quantitative discipline; or relevant professional experience. Strong analytical skills, mathematical fluency, and programming abilities are required.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Use machine learning techniques and statistical modeling to develop pricing analytics and liquidity models for retail deposits including overnight deposits and term deposits Use experience in building linear and non-linear models to develop analytics to drive the growth of the deposit platform Develop software and analytics to further Corporate Treasury’s firmwide mandates: liquidity risk and interest rate risk management and trade execution, cash & collateral management, funding optimization Optimize the firm’s liability stack by developing balance sheet analytics and hedging strategies Work with treasury, desk strategists, and technology departments to implement processes to optimally leverage financial resources to achieve commercial priorities Perform quantitative analysis and facilitate business understanding of technical resultsSkills And Experience We Are Looking For Solid background in computer programming, Python, C++, Java, Matlab or equivalent language, preferably in large scale financial or technical computations Strong software design experience. Experience with statistical modeling (generalized linear models) and machine learning. Experience with deposit modeling is a plus Excellent communication skills, including experience speaking to technical and business audiences and working globally Can apply entrepreneurial approach and passion to problem solving and product development Familiarity with financial markets, financial assets, and asset pricing is a plusAbout Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.Division Engineering
