Job_Title: Enterprise Reference Data - Software Engineer (DIO - RefData) - Enterprise Reference Data
Description: Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. We are recruiting highly motivated individuals for software development roles on the Enterprise Reference Data Engineering Team, based in New York/SLC/London/Warsaw/Bengaluru/Tokyo. Effectively leveraging financial market data to drive business is the key for successful financial services that firm provides to its customers, and working with massive volumes of data quickly is a differentiator. It gives firm the opportunity to respond more quickly to changes, gain deeper insights and forecast capabilities. The challenges related to use the data to drive innovation and customer experience are even greater. Our team builds platforms and technology solutions to model, source, and distribute the data including clients, accounts, financial products and prices to all of firm systems. We are an accelerator and enabler for business, making them more effective at managing and optimizing consumption of reference data, abstracting client, market and regulatory changes through innovative solutions. Our team is made of software developers and technical product owners with deep technical skills and an affinity for creating solutions with the potential for enterprise-wide impact.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS You will be part of the technology function for Enterprise Reference Data, focusing on building data sourcing, controls and distribution architecture that enables the business to operate efficiently with the data.You should be able to quickly build visualizations on top of MongoDB / Sybase / DB2 / Elastic Search data to meet business needs, as well as be the thought leader to influence functional heads on new and innovate ways to visualize data that will help drive business value.You will help design data architecture to enhance existing pipelines as well as build feeds for new data sources.You will work closely with business partners and technology leaders to evaluate new tools that can further enhance the business’ ability to analyze data.You will participate in data architecture decisions and partner with technology teams to implement data products in production systems.This is a wide open opportunity for a motivated individual to use their skills to drive change in a high-visibility, challenging environment.Skills And Experience We Are Looking ForBachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines2+ years of software industry experience with strong analytical and problem solving skillsHands on experience in one of the mainstream programming language (Java, C++, etc.) using object-oriented design techniques and best practicesExperience of test-driven development, hands on experience with testing frameworks such as JUnit.Good understanding and experience in using data structures and algorithmsBasic understanding in working with SQL/NoSQLGood communication and interpersonal skillsPreferred QualificationsBasic understanding on any big data platform and data analysis methodologiesAt least 1 year experience dealing with data (structured or unstructured)Experience in working with SQL/NoSQL data stores (e.g. MongoDB)Good understanding of distributed and scalable system designWorking with client to transform requirements into software solutionsExperience working in a start-up business or a new business line within a larger organization is preferredWeb services development: RESTful APIs; Swagger; Jersey; GlassfishHands-on experience working with Linux and basic scripting (Bash)About Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.Division Engineering

Job_Title: Strats Deposit Modeler - Corporate Treasury Engineering - Finance Engineering
Description: The Corporate Treasury Strats team is looking for world class quantitative programmers to work closely with Corporate Treasury partners to employ quantitative analytics to drive optimizations of firm liquidity, cash and collateral management, funds transfer pricing and trade execution strategies. This is an integrated group which both explores new ideas for optimizing the funding management of the firm and also executes trading strategies, all in one team. Corporate Treasury lies at the heart of Goldman Sachs, ensuring that businesses have the appropriate level of funding to conduct their activities, while also optimizing the firm’s funding costs and managing liquidity risks. As part of the Corporate Treasury Engineering team you will be exposed to securities division and banking initiatives, to new business activities, and to critical strategic programs Goldman Sachs pursues to maintain its leadership among global financial institutions. Corporate Treasury Strats use their engineering and/or scientific background to implement quantitative analytics and management solutions in software. Corporate Treasury Engineering products guide funding souring decisions, allocation of financial resources, quantification of funding costs, and strategies to minimize costs and hedge risks. Successful strats are highly analytical, driven to own commercial outcomes, and communicate with precision and clarity.Corporate Treasury Strats welcomes applicants with Master’s or a PhD in financial engineering/financial math; quantitative sciences, e.g. physics, statistics, applied math or other quantitative discipline; or relevant professional experience. Strong analytical skills, mathematical fluency, and programming abilities are required.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Use machine learning techniques and statistical modeling to develop pricing analytics and liquidity models for retail deposits including overnight deposits and term deposits Use experience in building linear and non-linear models to develop analytics to drive the growth of the deposit platform Develop software and analytics to further Corporate Treasury’s firmwide mandates: liquidity risk and interest rate risk management and trade execution, cash & collateral management, funding optimization Optimize the firm’s liability stack by developing balance sheet analytics and hedging strategies Work with treasury, desk strategists, and technology departments to implement processes to optimally leverage financial resources to achieve commercial priorities Perform quantitative analysis and facilitate business understanding of technical resultsSkills And Experience We Are Looking For Minimum 5 years of experience in a quantitative finance role Solid background in computer programming, Python, C++, Java, Matlab or equivalent language, preferably in large scale financial or technical computations Solid background in computer programming, Python, C++, Java, Matlab or equivalent language, preferably in large scale financial or technical computations Familiarity with financial markets and assets, with a preference for experience with asset pricing and metrics used to govern financial institutions. Excellent communication skills, including experience speaking to technical and business audiences and working globally Can apply entrepreneurial approach and passion to problem solving and product development Good knowledge of SQL and databases is a plusAbout Goldman SachsPreferred QualificationsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.Division Engineering

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We unite Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting!), 18 timezones, and 30 different languages into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.The Elastic Security Data Engineering team designs, builds, and runs data processing pipelines that synthesize security data from a broad set of sources and deliver innovative detection capabilities that power our security products. We are looking for a Data Engineer to craft stream data processing and machine learning systems powering security products that dynamically adapt to changing threats. You will collaborate with the broader Elastic Security team, a diverse set of security researchers, data scientists, and engineers who lend domain expertise to work with you to solve creative security problems and deliver fantastic user experiences.What You Will Be Doing Work as part of the Security Protections team at Elastic with other data engineers, data scientists, and security researchers Improve and expand our security data pipeline across all aspects of software telemetry, data ingest, storage, real-time and batch analytics, machine learning, and data-powered web services Write code in a collaborative environment for new data pipelines and web services Operate and improve cloud-hosted big data systems that manage and analyze malware samples and security activity events Collaborate with security research engineers and data scientists to measure and improve security protections and ML models Collaborate with Elastic Stack software engineers to build multifaceted cloud-based services that deliver a continuously improving user experience Advocate for data-powered services and experiences across the Elastic product portfolio What You Bring Along 7+ years experience programming in Python, OCaml, Go, or equivalent experience in a similar language and ability to learn these languages quickly 5+ years experience building, deploying and operating production-quality distributed data storage and processing systems in an environment of continuous integration and delivery Demonstrated experience designing and building public-cloud hosted infrastructure with AWS, GCP, Docker, and/or Terraform Proficient peer leader with experience partnering with other senior technical and business leaders to lead and mentor junior engineers Collaborative attitude with a strong disposition to learn new skills and emerging technologies Self-motivated and able to thrive in a distributed, fast-paced, and autonomous environment Passionate about protecting the world’s data from attack Desired Experience Or Interests Data streaming / database tech, e.g. SQL, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Spark Distributed systems / messaging tech, e.g. Kafka, NATS, AWS Lambda Functional programming, e.g. OCaml, Haskell Training, measuring, and improving ML models Endpoint and/or network information security Additional InformationWe're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Job_Title: Analytic Consultant 4 - Compliance Independent Risk Management
Description: Job DescriptionImportant Note  During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume prior to submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application.At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. The team focuses on several key risk types, including conduct, credit, financial crimes, information security, interest rate, liquidity, market, model, operational, regulatory compliance, reputation, strategic, and technology risk. The group provides leadership, enhances communications, assists with problem identification and solutions, and shares best practices. In addition, the group provides an enterprise-wide view of risk, assists management and our Board of Directors in identifying and monitoring risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and takes appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.This Analytic Consultant 4 is a key position within the Wells Fargo Compliance Independent Risk Management Home Lending analytics team. The Consultant will develop processes, analyses, and reporting to support compliance regulations implemented under the Dodd-Frank Act.Responsibilities Include Communicate project results and recommendations to senior leadership to support our strategic direction in the regulatory environment. Think outside the box to lead the development of new analytical techniques. Analyze transactional data, that is being captured in Regulatory Data Repository (RDR) compliance database, for project work Spearhead the development of analytical strategies for developing insights from time series data captured within this data repository. Utilize traditional statistical regression techniques.Project work may require the use of leading edge big data techniques for analyzing unstructured contextual data in Home Mortgage's loan application process.Please Note  Based on the volume of applications received, this job posting may be removed prior to the indicated close date. If you do not apply prior to the closing of this posting, we encourage you to apply for other opportunities with Wells Fargo.Required Qualifications6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modelingDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills5+ years of SAS programming experienceKnowledge and understanding of databases and data mining techniquesOutstanding problem solving and analytical skills with ability to turn findings into strategic imperativesAbility to work effectively, as well as independently, in a team environmentKnowledge and understanding of analytical methods used in statistical analysis, modeling, and reportingTeradata experience5+ years of SQL experienceSolid critical thinking skillsAbility to positively influence, motivate, and direct diverse teamsDemonstration and presentation facilitation skillsMetadata management and data integrity skillsAbility to develop partnerships and collaborate with other business and functional areasOther Desired Qualifications Able to analyze complex situations, and create and implement solutions to best protect the company from Legal, Regulatory, and Compliance risk Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to manage multiple responsibilities and tasks simultaneously Proven ability to collaborate with others, initiate action plans, manage change, make high impact decisions, and complete challenging assignments Demonstrated experience in data projects 3+ years of experience in an advanced analytics function such as statistical regressions, correlations, variance analysis, trending, anomalies, etc. 3+ years of knowledge of Real Estate Lending business processes and regulations like TRID, HMDA, QM-ATR, and Appraisal Delivery Knowledge in data warehouse and all aspects of project life cycleStreet AddressIA-West Des Moines 7001 Westown Pkwy - West Des Moines, IADisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.Reference Number 5517952-14

If you are an active Vivint employee, please apply through Workday by searching "Find Jobs".Job DescriptionWhy you’ll be excited to work at Vivint InternetWe are on a bold mission to offer a new model to how we provide home internet and connect the things you care about in your home built around our industry-leading millimeter wave technology and our deep focus on customer experience. We are a growth-stage, Series-B company with investors that include Blackstone and Peter Thiel, that has developed a new mesh wireless technology that enables us to quickly enter new markets and offer internet speeds up to 1Gbps with fiber grade capacity across large suburban areas. We know that most people aren’t happy with their home internet service today but haven’t really had many choices for broadband either. We aim to change that, quickly.What excites us is an opportunity to disrupt a trillion-dollar industry with a cutting-edge technology and a market leading customer experience. We have over 10,000 customers today in two metro markets and are looking to launch several new markets this year using our next generation technologies that will provide a very differentiated customer experience.As a growth-stage company aligned with the Vivint family, we combine a depth of capabilities and resources of our parent company with the ambition, culture and agility of a Series B startup. Our multinational team, comprised of veterans of Clearwire, Google, Sprint and Rise, is dual headquartered in two of the hottest tech centers in Santa Clara, CA and Lehi, UT.RoleAs the Sr. Business Data Analyst, you will lead the development of Vivint Internet’s Data Analytics Program and play a key role in cultivating the company’s data culture. By quickly establishing relationships across the business, you will serve as the primary point-of-contact for the company’s analytics needs. You will develop and mature the organization’s data architecture while developing and maintaining an effective and efficient data process that ranges from data mining and visualization, to drawing key business and operational insights. This role will be both tactical and strategic. In addition to the core data analytics capability you will bring to the business, as the business scales and data needs increase, you will be responsible for developing and driving mid and long term data strategy working alongside the Strategy Team and functional leads.What Excites You About This RoleCreate the foundations of a data-driven business within a rapidly growing companyTake the lead in driving data analytics initiatives working with leaders across the organizationHelp define business metrics including Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and associated measurement methodologiesApply analytics techniques (core statistical-modeling, data visualization, data mining) to extract actionable insights through analysis of large-scale, high-dimensional dataDevelop and utilize knowledge of various CRM systems and integrate them with internal systems to build comprehensive customer profiles, clusters, and value groupsServe as the bridge between the business and the analytics team to understand the business requirements and guide the teams to arrive at strategic, data-driven decisionsTo have an opportunity to grow your role and leadership impact further and faster as part of a rapidly scaling new businessThe opportunity to collaborate and have impact across multiple areas of an innovative companyYou enjoy organizing and managing complex projects that span multiple organizational functions and have non-linear dependenciesHaving a positive impact on peers and associates that you help to coordinate and deliver withWorking in a high-growth environment focused on customer satisfactionThe opportunity to define, design, and optimize data analytics processesWhat Excites Us About YouBA/BS degree in Engineering, Operations, or relevant quantitative fieldMinimum of 3 years solid, relevant data analytics work experienceStrong intellectual curiosity combined with a knack for recognizing correlations, trends, and statistical irregularitiesContinual process improvement is a core tenet of how you approach workYour experience in tech/telecommunications and/or high growth platform creationData Analytics Program and ProcessesExperience with creating strong business data architectures and frameworksExperience managing data though the traditional Data-to-Business Intelligence lifecycleExperience with SQL and relational databasesExperience with leading data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc)Experience with behavioral analysis, in particular, cohort and consumer analyticsSolid understanding of business, marketing, and financial conceptsFamiliarity with statistical data analysis tools (SAS, Python, R, etc)Familiarity with A/B and multivariate testingFamiliarity with Revenue attribution modelingLeadership in a High-Performance EnvironmentMentoring team members and colleagues in a variety of data analytics topicsEnsure that best practices are following and perform quality checks on analyses performed by teamsLead collaboration with different teams to aid a rigorous approach to analysesBuild business case analysis to support new initiatives and activitiesWe Take Care Of Our OwnFree catered lunch, snacks and SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST $155,000-$175,000 SALT LAKE CITY, UT Join one of the strongest teams in the AI space and work alongside a team of accomplished Data Scientists in their mission to revolutionize entertainment! One of our clients is looking to bring on a Senior Data Scientist with a proven track record of working with AI and Deep Learning to mentor their growing Data Science division. We’re interested in people who are bold, who are unafraid to innovate and take risks as they work to solve complex challenges. THE COMPANY A leader in their industry, this company is revolutionizing the relationship between advertisers and consumers. Create a quantitative impact on the entertainment space with this cutting-edge Deep Learning opportunity! Unlike many, this company truly understands the power and value of Data Science for their business. This team receives great support from executives, making sure at all times that they receive the resources they need to succeed. THE ROLE As a Senior Data Scientist, you will work on cutting-edge problems across the platform including: Working with large data sets, both structured and unstructured. Employ Deep Learning techniques Reviewing code and helping build a roadmap for more junior members of the team. Mentoring a team for technical growth. Applying Python-based machine learning and analysis techniques to a variety of complex problems dealing with user engagement. Taking ownership of projects and contributing to all aspects of product lifecycle. SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE The successful Senior Machine Learning Engineer will have the following skills and experience: Advanced education in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or a related field. Commercial experience in end to end model generation. Strong experience working in deep learning in a commercial environment. Track record of motivating and leading a team of Data Scientists. Proven experience working with advanced neural networks. Tools: Python, SQL, and Deep Learning platforms such as Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch THE BENEFITS The successful Senior Machine Learning Engineer will receive a salary of $155,000-$175,000/yr, dependent upon experience. Additional benefits include: Healthcare, vision, and dental 401k matching

About AncestryWhen you join Ancestry, you join our family tree. Backed by history, science, and technology, were creating a new world of connection, innovation, and understanding. Whether its reuniting long-lost relatives through DNA or unearthing new family stories from historical records, Ancestry empowers life-changing experiences. With over 20 billion digitized historical records, 100 million family trees, and 15+ million DNA kits sold, Ancestry is bringing the power of personal discovery to people around the world.Ancestry is looking for a Software developer Intern to help us build a new and exciting customer data platform that would handle millions of events flowing through it per day which, in turn, enables key business stakeholders to not only do analytics on it but also be proactive in making the customer experience better. This platform would be a major leap forward in making our organizational decisions become more data driven, and, out of the many applications that this platform would enable, personalization would be one that would help create a much more individualized customer experience.What You'll DoYou will collaborate with the Architect, Dev Manager and Engineers through the entire software development lifecycle to solve challenging and interesting problem.Work together with product and development teams to define software specificationsWrite clean, well designed, testable, efficient codeAutomate your code/deploy pipelineWho You AreMust be currently enrolled in a university and graduating after Summer 2020 2 or more years of relevant course work or equivalent industry experience.Strong communication and teamwork skillsPassion for learningJavaGood communication skills (verbal/written)It takes customer obsession to pioneer and focus on what matters most, to tackle challenges, break through boundaries to create change, to stay on the cutting edge, and pioneer relentlessly. We are looking for the next generation of talent to drive the business, grow our people, and put the customer before all else.Our culture empowers journeys of personal discovery, giving you the freedom to participate in impactful projects and explore the intersections of our businesses: technology, data science, DNA science, product, design, marketing, legal, and more. Were looking for innovative minds, diverse ideas, and for students interested in connecting personal discoveries and technology. Our interns enjoy mentorship and experience challenging work while receiving fantastic pay, fully-paid temporary housing, and having a fun captivating experiencewe have it all. Oh, and did we mention the possibility of full-time employment once you graduate?IND2Additional InformationAncestry is an Equal Opportunity Employer that makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, military or veteran status, citizenship, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. In addition, Ancestry will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.All job offers are contingent on a background check screen that complies with applicable law. For San Francisco office candidates, pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, Ancestry will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Ancestry is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Ancestry via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Ancestry. OverviewAre you ready to join an organization where you can be a relentless force for a world of longer, healthier lives?Envision all Americans enjoying ideal cardiovascular health free of heart disease and stroke. At the American Heart Association and American Stroke Association, we get to work toward that goal every single day. Is it easy? No. Is it worthwhile? you bet!This is satisfying work that makes a real difference in people's lives. You can achieve professional growth with personal fulfillment. You will connect with people and make a lifesaving impact. You will partner with individuals, schools, lawmakers, healthcare providers and others to ensure everyone has access to healthier lifestyle choices and proper healthcare.ResponsibilitiesThe American Heart Association (AHA) has an excellent opportunity for a Statistical Analyst in our National Center office located in Dallas, Texas (remotehome based is acceptable)This role plays an integral part in supporting the daily functions of the Centers for Health Metrics and Evaluation. Responsibilities include performing statistical modeling and analysis of multi-level data sets in order to predict or report outcomes of AHA programs and research. Additional responsibilities include organization, analysis, and reporting of data collected from various sources, including AHA program data and national health surveillance data as well as applying various visualization and business intelligence tools to provide understanding and communicate data to support organizational decision making.Essential Job DutiesConducts data analysis with quantitative and qualitative data. Analyzes data using a variety of statistical methods such as, logistic and linear regression; GEE or random effects models for longitudinal or multilevel analysis, latent class group-based analyses, and analysis of missing data. Develops summary reports that include interpretation of findings.Assists in the management of studies conducted internally, such as those to evaluate AHA's programs and media campaigns. Assists in the management of studies conducted in collaboration with external partners and government collaborators, such as projects to develop external campaigns.Prepares statistical reports for ongoing scientific investigations and presentations, prepares program evaluation reports to inform recommendations for quality improvement; develop factsheets and brief reports to substantiate facts for all AHA activities.Develops and manages data dictionaries and documentation of data reporting standards. Oversees quality control of data collection and database management.Develops logical data models, documentation, and specifications for information systems, and decision support systems (e.g. My Life Check recommendations engine.Coordinates with program implementers to develop and optimize systems for data collection across the entire program lifecycle (planning, implementation, and evaluation.Develops interactivedynamic dashboards with tools like Tableau and R.Want to help get your resume to the top? Take a look at the experience we require:QualificationsMaster's Degree in Biostatistics, Epidemiology, Public Health (MS, MPH, MPP, MSPH) or a related field of study.Minimum of three (3) years of POST Degree experience in statistical analysis and modeling which includes hypothesis.Proficiency in statistical programming (SAS, STATA or similar.Proficiency in building, implementing and supporting Tableau data visualizations.Proficient with database management and analytic tools and languages supporting data analysis and reporting - R, Python, SQL, and Excel.Effective skills in project management, preferably in health program evaluation.Ability to work collaboratively and independently.Proficiency in database development, management, and quality control methods.Excellent written communication skills with a focus on interpretation of statistical output appropriate for a variety of audiences.Here are some of the preferred skills we are looking for:Candidate has an interest in tobacco control, media campaigns, cardiovascular or brain health promotions.Effective writing skills for different audiences (scientific, media, lay, etc.Experience with analysis of data focused on cardiovascular disease epidemiology or similarrelated chronic disease.Experience in Business Intelligence tools like Anteryx, Qlikview, Tableau and other data science certifications.So, are you ready to work for the largest voluntary health organization dedicated to fighting heart disease, stroke and other cardiovascular diseases?Click on New Resume (or Existing Resume if you have previously applied to AHA positions) to submit your online application. Only those deemed most qualified will be contacted to interview.At American Heart Association | American Stroke Association, diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity applies to both our workforce and the communities we serve as it relates to heart health and stroke prevention.to see other opportunities.Be sure to follow us on Twitter #TheAHALifeEOE Protected VeteransPersons with DisabilitiesLocation US-TX-DallasPosted Date 1 day ago (******** 1:28 PM)Requisition ID 2019-5525Job Family Group Science and ResearchJob Category Science & ResearchAdditional Locations US-AnywhereUS-AnywhereLocation: Salt Lake City,UTPandoLogic. Keywords: Statistical Analyst, Location: Salt Lake City, UT - 84105

Job_Title: CIMD Operations - IMD Ops Management & Shared Services – Business Intelligence Analyst/Associate – Salt Lake City
Description: OPERATIONSOperations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the firm to provide banking, securities, and asset management services to clients around the world. In addition, Operations provides essential risk management and controls to preserve and enhance the firm's assets and its reputation. For every new product launched and every trade executed, it is Operations that develops and manages the processes and controls that enable business flow.YOUR IMPACTAre you looking to apply your quantitative skills while deepening your understanding of how businesses improve with data analytics? The IMD Change Management and Business Intelligence team is seeking a data science professional who will design and implement analytics that will drive continuous improvement and find new business opportunities within the Investment Management and Operations Division.OUR IMPACTThe IMD Operations – Change Management and Business Intelligence team contributes to leading Investment Management  programs by delivering business intelligence and analytics initiatives. This role will combine accountability and responsibility for automated solutions and business analytics, by exploiting artificial intelligence, process automation and data visualization tools, to generate business value.As a data science professional, efforts will include enabling artificial intelligence to solve business problems. The Associate will work closely with business representatives to make predictions and recommendations in line with IMD target operating model and ensure algorithms adapt to new data and experiences to improve efficacy over time and consequently improve business outcomes.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Analyze big data and undertake exploratory data analysis while observing best practices for experimentation / analysis  Synthesize analysis results to inform business outcomes  Develop indicators of performance and risk metrics  Extend / modify analysis based on observations / knowledge of data and limitations, implications of results  Drive the collection of new data and refinement of existing data sources (working closely with central finance)  Identify and escalate systems and strategy performance issues or trends  Contribute to global organization-wide initiatives  Track and report progress on projects, adhering to solution delivery lifecycle  Seek information / guidance / opportunities from inside and outside organization / industry to generate a point of view  Create visualization of analyses which facilitate decision-making Basic QualificationsSKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE’RE LOOKING FOR The candidate should possess a minimum of 1-5 years overall experience in (1) Data analytics, (2) Data visualization, (3) Project management, (4) Communication and stakeholder management, and (5) Data governance Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics / other relevant experience in consumer / financial / social / media tech companies in a role with a focus on data Passionate about data analysis and how this contributes to the business  Must understand advanced analytics and statistics, have good software design skills and “get it” when it comes to day-to-day realities of the business  Knowledge of data-related emerging trends and issues (including financial regulation)  Fast learner who can identify and design processes with economics, service, risk, and cost benefits  Ability to work independently to apply tools and techniques for productionalizing workflow  Experience in using business intelligence platforms (such as Alteryx, Tableau, Qlik)  Effective communicator of new / complex information  Self-motivated team player who is able to define structure and prioritize work, but who has the flexibility and capability to change priorities when circumstances dictate  Confidence to challenge and be innovative  Ability to develop cooperative and constructive working relationships with strong culture awareness Preferred Qualifications Financial Services and / or Asset Management experience  Experience with implementing data-driven improvement frameworks such as Six Sigma, Total Quality Management, or Statistical Process Control  Alternative business intelligence tools (such as Elastic, R, SQL, NoSQL, Zoomdata)  Basic knowledge of computer and/or database programming fundamentals (Object Oriented Programming, algorithms, etc.)  Skilled in SharePoint and PowerPoint About Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, and individuals. We are looking for an experienced Customer Success Representative to join Womply. This entry level position starts at $15.50 an hour, plus team spiffs and compensation from retaining customers. The CS Rep will be part of a team serving our small business owners with all their needs. This role involves excellent attention to detail, as well as the ability to problem solve and move quickly. Our ideal candidate is a team-oriented individual who is driven to assure that professionalism and quality is provided to our merchants in every interaction.You Will Be Responsible For Knowledge of and familiarity with computers, Microsoft Office applications, Google applications, and the internet.  World class customer service and interpersonal skills through calls, live chats and emails  Ability to de-escalate upset customers  Ability to successfully retain and/or up-sell customers requesting to cancel  Ability to use discretion and problem analysis  Ability to read and interpret documents and scripts  One year customer service experience preferred, but not required  High School Diploma or equivalent.  Highly dependable with regular and punctual attendance  Great communication skills, both written and verbal  Comfortable being on the phoneNice To Have Organizational skills  Positivity  Come build something amazing at WomplyWomply’s mission is to help small businesses thrive in a digital world. Founded in 2011, Womply is the leading provider of data and software to local businesses and the top software partner to the payments industry. Our AI-powered data platform powers our CRM and marketing software, which serves more than 450,000 small businesses in every corner of America. Job_Title: Software Development Manager - Text iQ Extensions
Description: About QualtricsQualtrics is the technology platform that organizations use to collect, manage, and act on experience data, also called X-data™. The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action, used by teams, departments, and entire organizations to manage the four core experiences of business—customer, product, employee and brand—on one platform. Over 9,000 enterprises worldwide, including more than 75 percent of the Fortune 100 and 99 of the top 100 U.S. business schools, rely on Qualtrics to consistently build products that people love, create more loyal customers, develop a phenomenal employee culture, and build iconic brands. Qualtrics was recently acquired by SAP, and together we will accelerate XM and power the experience economy. Join us on this adventure that can open many doors! If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and growth, recognizes your unique contribution, fills you with purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment - apply now!About The RoleWe are looking for a software engineering manager excited to embed the insights and actions uncovered by Qualtrics Text iQ unstructured data analysis throughout the Experience Management platform. Our goal is to personalize the Qualtrics experience using ML and AI features showcasing Qualtrics data as a core value proposition and competitive advantage.As the leader of this team you will hire, develop, mentor, and coach software engineers as they create new features in text and unstructured data analysis, and extend the reach of Text iQ products and services to the entire XM platform. You will balance meaningful long-term R&D investments with short-term product deliverables, and partner with product management and company leadership to ensure alignment against strategic and tactical goals.As a software engineering leader at Qualtrics, you should love building simple solutions to solve hard customer problems. Crafting systems in an agile environment to withstand hyper growth and owning quality from end to end is a rewarding challenge and one of the reasons Qualtrics is such an exciting place to work!Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or advanced degree in Computer Science or related   5+ years of relevant experience, 3+ years of management or leadership experience hiring and developing teams of engineers, Building a team culture of collaboration, pragmatic execution, and continuous learning.   Strong algorithms, data structures, and coding background, including experience with:   Data analytics / data pipelines   Web infrastructure and distributed systems   Integrating services owned by multiple teams or 3rd party providers   Hands-on experience with machine learning, natural language processing, deep learning, or other AI systems is a plus    Consistent record of project planning and execution, developing and owning the engineering roadmap for the product, and working with stakeholders to build quarterly plans   A history of cross-functional success, collaborating with peer teams, PM, QE, UX, Devops, etc with a sense of urgency to deliver value to your customers

Description: If you are a Sr. Data Scientist with 3+ years of R or Python experience, please read on!As a member of the Data Science team, you will play a pivotal role in building out and supporting our new API division through the development of data matching, customer profiles and business profiles. Our team is comprised of Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and Business Intelligence Analysts that use our vast and growing data to support and enhance our data and ML models that power our products and decision making. You will use your understanding of data and modeling to make a difference.Our problems are open-ended and don't always have clear paths and solutions. We understand the workflow from a high level, and that context helps us build the right solutions. This is where your unique skills and interests come into play. We are looking for someone who is driven, with a strong intellectual curiosity of understanding challenges and problems, works well cross functionally, and can provide actionable insights and solutions. We look for people who take pride in their work, execute on it, and deliver phenomenal results.What You Will Be Doing Develop and implement algorithms for cleaning, integrating, and evaluating large Job_Title: Data Analyst- Staff/Sr at Primary Children's Hospital
Description: Job ID: 241186Greater Salt Lake areaDetailsAbout UsBeing a part of Intermountain Healthcare means joining a world-class team of over 37,500 employees and caregivers while embarking on a career filled with opportunities, strength, innovation, and fulfillment. Our mission is: Helping people live the healthiest lives possible.Our patients deserve the best in healthcare, and we deliver.To find out more about us, head to our career site here.Job DescriptionThis position is part of a team of data analysts at Primary Children’s Hospital. The Data Analyst collaborates with nurses, physicians and administrators to produce analytical solutions that support process improvement, operations, strategy, and increased patient safety.This role centers around the ability to use data from a myriad of vended and internally developed data platforms to help caregivers garner insights. This role will require the ability to understand how clinical and business work processes generate data and its contextual meaning. This role will work in collaboration with business partners to rapidly translate and present data that can be consumed by caregivers to help make clinical and business decisions. This role is enhanced by the ability to develop and leverage logical models, statistical knowledge, communication skills, and willingness to drive opportunities to improve data quality and structures in source systems.Essential Job DutiesThis position is responsible for providing analytical support at a system-wide level for pediatrics. May interact with stakeholders across the system. Typically, this position performs analysis on routine or moderately complex projects under general supervision.Core Essentials 1. Creates reports that answer multiple related questions as well as reports with linked content, drilldown and nested parameters. The report is formatted in such a way that leads the user through the report in a well-organized, easy to understand fashion. 2. Writes ad hoc SQL, including basic selects, joins, use of Where clause and simple functions (e.g., Trunc, Sum, Min, Max, Avg, Concat, etc.). 3. Understanding of Primary / Foreign Keys, Table / Field Aliases, and Partitions / Indexes. 4. Assists in the identification of data quality (accuracy, completeness, etc.) issues. Assists with the process of database design for assigned projects. As appropriate, trains other individuals and teams in the routine use of data collection, analysis, and reporting and interpretation tools for measuring performance. Posting Specifics Benefits Eligible: Yes Shift Details: Full time day position; M-F Department: Pediatric Analytics, Primary Children's Hospital At this time we are unable to sponsor individuals that require a visa.  Minimum Requirements Master's degree,or Bachelor's degree with two years of analytics experience. Education must be obtained through an accredited institution. Degree will be verified. Demonstrated proficiency and a working knowledge of SQL (structured query language), quality improvement principles, and a fundamental knowledge of database design principles. Demonstrated experience in the developing, analyzing, interpreting, and managing of a variety of moderately complex data sets. Demonstrated capabilities in planning, participating, and managing moderately complex analytics projects. Demonstrated experience using word processing, spreadsheet, database, internet and e-mail, and scheduling applications. Demonstrated experience in a role requiring effective verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills. Physical Requirements Interact with others requiring the employee to verbally communicate information. Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands. See and read computer monitors and documents Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment. Preferred Requirements Degree in an analytics related field such as statistics, mathematics, information systems, computer science, finance, business management, or economics. If degree is not in an analytics related field, four years of analytics experience demonstrating proficiency performing the job essentials at this job level. Basic understanding of statistical concepts and tools. Basic understanding of some programing languages. Applied understanding of data visualization design best practices. Basic experience with SQL query tuning. Experience in healthcare/clinical data. Please NoteAll positions subject to close without notice. Intermountain Healthcare prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, veteran status, disability and/or genetic information.

About AncestryWhen you join Ancestry, you join our family tree. Backed by history, science, and technology, were creating a new world of connection, innovation, and understanding. Whether its reuniting long-lost relatives through DNA or unearthing new family stories from historical records, Ancestry empowers life-changing experiences. With over 20 billion digitized historical records, 100 million family trees, and 15+ million DNA kits sold, Ancestry is bringing the power of personal discovery to people around the world.If you are passionate about DNA and Big Data this will be an incredible experience for you. You will work in a professional environment (but in shorts and sandals) and have ample opportunity to network with other teams and other professionals within your discipline. The Software Engineering intern will work with and be mentored by senior software developers.What You'll DoWork in Java 8/11 and related technologiesWork with code that queries trillions of records from AWS AuroraExperience an Agile style development processDirect experience with Spring, REST, AWS, RDBMS, NoSQL and other cool techDevelop test data sets for performance and scalability testing for a platform with hundreds of billions of records.Create administrative reporting tools and graphsWork with other departments to improve test data setsFind and suggest improvements to production codeImprove code quality through unit and integration testing while learning Java development best practicesWho You AreCurrently pursuing a bachelors or masters level degree in Computer Science or related field (for example: Bioinformatics, EE, Computer Engineering, Math, and Physics). We are looking for the next generation of talent to drive the business, grow our people, and put the customer before all else.Our culture empowers journeys of personal discovery, giving you the freedom to participate in impactful projects and explore the intersections of our businesses: technology, data science, DNA science, product, design, marketing, legal, and more. Job_Title: Strats Deposit Modeler - Corporate Treasury Engineering - Finance Engineering
Description: The Corporate Treasury Strats team is looking for world class quantitative programmers to work closely with Corporate Treasury partners to employ quantitative analytics to drive optimizations of firm liquidity, cash and collateral management, funds transfer pricing and trade execution strategies. This is an integrated group which both explores new ideas for optimizing the funding management of the firm and also executes trading strategies, all in one team. Corporate Treasury lies at the heart of Goldman Sachs, ensuring that businesses have the appropriate level of funding to conduct their activities, while also optimizing the firm’s funding costs and managing liquidity risks. As part of the Corporate Treasury Engineering team you will be exposed to securities division and banking initiatives, to new business activities, and to critical strategic programs Goldman Sachs pursues to maintain its leadership among global financial institutions. Corporate Treasury Strats use their engineering and/or scientific background to implement quantitative analytics and management solutions in software. Corporate Treasury Engineering products guide funding souring decisions, allocation of financial resources, quantification of funding costs, and strategies to minimize costs and hedge risks. Successful strats are highly analytical, driven to own commercial outcomes, and communicate with precision and clarity.Corporate Treasury Strats welcomes applicants with Master’s or a PhD in financial engineering/financial math; quantitative sciences, e.g. physics, statistics, applied math or other quantitative discipline; or relevant professional experience. Strong analytical skills, mathematical fluency, and programming abilities are required.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Use machine learning techniques and statistical modeling to develop pricing analytics and liquidity models for retail deposits including overnight deposits and term deposits Use experience in building linear and non-linear models to develop analytics to drive the growth of the deposit platform Develop software and analytics to further Corporate Treasury’s firmwide mandates: liquidity risk and interest rate risk management and trade execution, cash & collateral management, funding optimization Optimize the firm’s liability stack by developing balance sheet analytics and hedging strategies Work with treasury, desk strategists, and technology departments to implement processes to optimally leverage financial resources to achieve commercial priorities Perform quantitative analysis and facilitate business understanding of technical resultsSkills And Experience We Are Looking For Solid background in computer programming, Python, C++, Java, Matlab or equivalent language, preferably in large scale financial or technical computations Strong software design experience. Experience with statistical modeling (generalized linear models) and machine learning. Experience with deposit modeling is a plus Excellent communication skills, including experience speaking to technical and business audiences and working globally Can apply entrepreneurial approach and passion to problem solving and product development Familiarity with financial markets, financial assets, and asset pricing is a plusAbout Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. Womply has a new API business and we need someone to head up marketing for it. In this role, you’ll be responsible for raising awareness, generating demand, and communicate value for Womply’ APIs to the software developer audience. It’s a great opportunity to build a new marketing function inside a growing company.You’ll need to be resourceful, entrepreneurial, and intrinsically motivated. You’ll have plenty of support but you’ll also be the sole designated developer marketer. So, you’ll need to be a generalist with some strong core skills, specifically product marketing, content marketing, and demand gen. You should also know how APIs work and have experience generating interest and demand for APIs among software developers.What You Get To Do Build our developer marketing strategy from the ground up, with input and support from stakeholders  Figure out how to generate demand for Womply APIs through organic and paid methods  Lead product marketing for Womply APIs  Create content and sales enablement materials targeted at software developersAll About You At least 5-7 years of experience in marketing, with significant hands-on experience in product marketing and sales enablement  Direct experience marketing APIs to developers  Willingness to be a “full-stack” marketer, leading strategy and execution alike  A self-starter’s work ethic and entrepreneurial mindset  A collaborative and low-ego styleMake an impact at Womply!Womply’s mission is to help small businesses thrive in a digital world. Founded in 2011, Womply is the leading provider of data and software to local businesses and the top software partner to the payments industry. Our AI-powered data platform powers our CRM and marketing software, which serves more than 450,000 small businesses in every corner of America. In addition, Womply’s data platform helps innovative developers create more powerful software for businesses and consumers alike.We’re a fanatically values-based company with $50 million raised to accelerate our growth. If you want to make a big impact, let’s talk. We’re hiring in the Bay Area and Lehi, Utah for product, engineering, DevOps, design, data science, sales, marketing, business development, account management, and more.

Job_Title: Principal Software Engineer, Machine Learning Architect
Company: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
Description: PurposesThe mission of this position @ FamilySearch is to help Church members fulfill their divinely appointed responsibility to discover their families through family history methods, submit their names to the temple for saving ordinances, and to help bring souls unto CHRIST.Responsibilities include architecting the systems used for the search cluster and hinting/matching engine of familysearch.org, as well as technical leadership of the techniques used in machine learning. Highly proficient in the Java programming language and ecosystem, big data toolsets such as Kafka, Hadoop, and Spark, as well as knowledge of statistical techniques and the data science used to train a classifier. Extensive knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Excellent communication skills, and the ability to influence engineering teams, as well as influence at the highest levels of the organization. Previous experience working in a production team environment following an agile software development model.The Engineer works in a leadership role on tasks and assignments from a Director or Managing Director or tasks that they create. This position employs experience as an extremely seasoned professional, uses comprehensive knowledge of industry practices, Church policies and good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for designing, defining, developing, testing, purchasing, implementing, and analyzing of technical products and systems of diverse scope. This role recommends system purchases for projects up to ten millions of dollars of value. This position performs engineering design evaluations and applies comprehensive analytical skills to recommend performance enhancements. The Senior Principal Software Engineer establishes strategic and tactical technological direction and then provides expertise in the solution to key issues affecting the delivery of the product. The Senior Principal Software Engineer also helps in setting overall technical direction for a team of 100 to 500 engineers.Responsibilities30% - Providing consulting services to teams in the areas of advanced technology and architectures30% Establishing technology strategies, writing and reviewing new architectures, engineered solutions, and test results.20% Keeping abreast of industry best practices and emerging trends and technologies.10% Providing technical leadership for multiple teams in the design and development of technological advanced issues and/or difficult problems.10% Participating in group meetings, group planning sessions, setting group goals, and all other group activities.QualificationsEducation: A Masters or Ph.D degree in Data science, artificial intelligence, or related field is strongly preferred, or otherwise 10+ years of experience in these relevant technologies is required. Skills: Must have clear evidence of external industry validation of ability and enterprise-grade vision. Must have experience completing two or more major cycles in architecting entire systems and successfully implemented through two or more development cycles. Must be able to lead cross-functional and interdepartmental product or project teams, define work processes, and lead a team of highly educated and skilled engineers and managers. Must keep abreast of trends and directions in technology, understanding their relevance to the Church. Must be self-educated in emerging technologies. Must be able to make architectural choices based on solid principles and practical experience without unsubstantiated bias. Must be able to set technical architectural direction without supervision. Must be able to operate a computer. Must be able to interact effectively with customers and present solutions. Must be able to lead customers through decision-making processes. Must be able to communicate needs and expectations to management, and provide sound advice.Worthiness QualificationMust be a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and currently temple worthy.Posting Notice/More Info.Please Note: All positions are subject to close without notice.Find out more about the many benefits of Church Employment at http://careers.lds.org .

Job_Title: Senior Institutional Research Analyst (Marketing Analytics and Strategy)
Description: If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.About WGU Institutional ResearchThe Institutional Research (IR) department at WGU serves as the heart of research, data analytics, and data-driven decision making at Western Governors University. Our motto is Free the Data. The IR department at WGU is a group of talented data scientists, data engineers, analysts, and researchers who are passionate about helping students reach their highest potential through education. At WGU, the IR team has deep expertise in analytical methods, machine learning, learning analytics, and big data. We are fun loving technical folks with a passion for data science and education.The IR department prides itself in being a collaborative, non-competitive group that is encouraged to innovate and use the data science technologies that are best for each project. Current tool sets of the group include Databricks, Oracle SQL Server, Cognos, Tableau, Python, R, and SAS. The internal career path for this role leads towards roles such as a Senior Data Scientist or IT Manager.About The Marketing Analytics And Strategy TeamThe Marketing Analytics, Reporting, and Strategic Support team (MARKRS) in WGU’s Institutional Research (IR) department is a truly unique and vertically-integrated group of talented people that primarily support Marketing and associated stakeholders in augmenting their decisions with data and insights. Half of the functional team sits in the Marketing department, and the IR team works with them in an Agile collaboration to consult with business owners, guide analytical question development, perform quantitative and qualitative data analysis, architect reporting solutions, and present persuasive insights. We enthusiastically explore ways to efficiently and effectively enhance the entire student journey all the way from prospect to alumni. We leverage quantitative analysis, qualitative datasets, and external research methods to enrich our understanding of the lives that WGU can help.About The Senior Institutional Research Analyst PositionAre you the data whisperer? Do you enjoy finding and answering complex questions that can make a mark? Do you believe data is beautiful? Can you help others see that beauty?Are you able to work on your own but help out a fellow team member when needed? Do you enjoy working with a diverse set of talents? Can you tell or enjoy a good dad joke?WGU’s Department of Institutional Research (IR) is looking for a marketing-savvy analyst to provide analytics support across a wide range of opportunities. The analyst will work with high-profile stakeholders and projects to identify analytical opportunities in response to major business questions. We work a lot in Tableau for compiling and presenting data from our marketing systems: CRM (Salesforce), web analytics (Adobe Analytics), and various marketing sources (i.e. audience management and automation). We are responsible for data architecture and governance of marketing data sets, so being comfortable with SQL and database queries is a must. At the same time, we also interface with highly creative and less analytical stakeholders in marketing, so we pride ourselves on learning and speaking Marketing-ese. Based on the projects you help to define, you might be expected to develop time-series forecasts for lead-generation KPIs, machine learning models for attribution or sentiment analysis, statistical significance testing on different marketing treatments, and many other potentially exciting and powerful analyses. This role will be given wide latitude to approach problem-solving in creative ways and will also be expected to provide thought leadership and mentorship for other team members Working Conditions  This full-time position would work in-office at our Salt lake City (Utah) headquarters, with a traditional working schedule (Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm MDT)  Basic Qua  lifications  Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, applied mathematics discipline, business, or other related degrees  3+ years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence  Professional experience in SQL programming (Oracle PSQL, Postgres, MSQL)  Professional experience in data visualization (Tableau, PowerBI , Cognos) Preferred Qualifications Experience with Lead Generation Marketing  Experience with time series forecasting and predictive modeling  Experience collecting and/or using qualitative data (ex. surveys, focus groups, interviews)  Experience in data validation and testing to analyze, debug and fix issues  Experience understanding, manipulating and querying large data sets with complex file structures  Experience using a data warehouse  Experience explaining complex data and research issues in a professional manner with technical and non-technical colleagues  Experience using Databricks  Experience in R, Python,.Scala #D&IAs an equal opportunity employer, WGU recognizes that our strength lies in our people. We are committed to diversity.

About AncestryWhen you join Ancestry, you join our family tree. Backed by history, science, and technology, were creating a new world of connection, innovation, and understanding. Whether its reuniting long-lost relatives through DNA or unearthing new family stories from historical records, Ancestry empowers life-changing experiences. With over 20 billion digitized historical records, 100 million family trees, and 15+ million DNA kits sold, Ancestry is bringing the power of personal discovery to people around the world.Ancestry is looking for a highly motivated Software Engineer, Intern to join our Search UI team. The Search UI team creates and maintains a dynamic user interface that helps users search across billions of pieces of data in their quest to find details about their ancestral past. You will be developing solutions to simplify the discovery process and help users preserve the information they find. As a Software Engineer, on the Search UI team you will participate in architectural discussions on how the software should function, write innovative code to create new features or improve existing features, create unit tests, fix defects, and release software to the live site.What You'll DoParticipate in a scrum team by attending daily stand-up meetingsWrite and submit quality code as part of the regular release cycle to a Git repository using a pull request process so that the development team can review each others codeParticipate as a reviewer on pull requests made by other development team membersWrite test plans and unit tests to properly test newly written codeWho You AreMust be currently enrolled in a university and graduating after Summer 2020 Knowledge of client-side application development using JavaScript language features, frameworks and tooling (Node.js)Knowledge of object oriented programmingUnderstanding of debugging techniquesUnderstanding of unit testingUse of Git as a source repositoryIt takes customer obsession to pioneer and focus on what matters most, to tackle challenges, break through boundaries to create change, to stay on the cutting edge, and pioneer relentlessly. We are looking for the next generation of talent to drive the business, grow our people, and put the customer before all else.Our culture empowers journeys of personal discovery, giving you the freedom to participate in impactful projects and explore the intersections of our businesses: technology, data science, DNA science, product, design, marketing, legal, and more. Were looking for innovative minds, diverse ideas, and for students interested in connecting personal discoveries and technology. Our interns enjoy mentorship and experience challenging work while receiving fantastic pay, fully-paid temporary housing, and having a fun captivating experiencewe have it all. Oh, and did we mention the possibility of full-time employment once you graduate?IND2Additional InformationAncestry is an Equal Opportunity Employer that makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, military or veteran status, citizenship, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Medical/Dental/Vision401k, Paid Time Off and Tuition ReimbursementFull Service Gym, Game and Lounge Area, Basketball CourtFree Healthy Snacks and RefreshmentsSubsidized Public TransitFun and Relaxed Work EnvironmentWHO IS PROGRESSIVE LEASING?Prog Leasing, LLC, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Aaron’s, Inc (NYSE: AAN), is the largest and longest-tenured virtual lease-to-own provider in the United States. If you’re passionate about building a better future for individuals, communities, and our country—and you’re committed to working hard to play your part in building that future—consider WGU as the next step in your career.Driven by a mission to expand access to higher education through online, competency-based degree programs, WGU is also committed to being a great place to work for a diverse workforce of student-focused professionals. The university has pioneered a new way to learn in the 21st century, one that has received praise from academic, industry, government, and media leaders. Whatever your role, working for WGU gives you a part to play in helping students graduate, creating a better tomorrow for themselves and their families.Position SummaryThe Standards and Practice Lead: Assessment Strategy & Governance (S&P Assessment Strategy) plays a pivotal role in establishing the policy, technology and governance strategy for WGU’s competency-based assessment practice across all colleges and programs. This individual will collaborate with stakeholders across the university to ensure the assessment program meets the goals of the university and that assessment best practices have been followed. The Assessment Strategy and Governance Lead is a cross-departmental spokesperson for the Program Development department’s assessment practices. The person in this role leads the Design and Development Internal Assessment Council, which maintains oversight and governance over WGU’s assessment practices. This specialist is also the convener of WGU’s college assessment specialists. This individual will review concerns, troubleshoot problems, and maintain relationships with evaluation and teaching faculty to maximize the value of reports and dashboards to inform teaching and learning. This individual will also work with student experience colleagues to continuously improve the student assessment experience while ensuring that the WGU assessment program is respected internally and externally for its quality and integrity. This specialist stays current with nationally recognized assessment practices and research and creates and delivers training across colleges and departments. This individual is a primary liaison and advocate for the user experience to WGU’s technology teams for establishing standards and requirements for assessment technology needs and platforms.This position sits on-site in our Salt Lake City, UT, Phoenix, AZ, or Austin, TX location.Essential Functions And Responsibilities E nsure a consistent strategy for assessments is deployed across all colleges  Determine strategic initiatives that support projected growth and direct the implementation of new products, technologies, and systems that support effective and innovative practices ollaborate with the technology and design and development teams to translate assessment needs into technology requirements and defined specifications to ensure the creation and adoption of flexible, valid, reliable, data-driven assessment tools  Create and provide regular training, consultation, and guidance to team members and partners on assessment models, assessment policy and strategy , technology and tools, and data-driven, evidence-based practices in assessment  Collaborate with Program Development , data & learning science and the psychometrics team on validity studies, scoring methods, rubric development, and other assessment tools, models, and issues  Collaborate with executive leadership and cross-functional teams to decide on innovations and improvements to the existing student assessment experience and processes, based on data, key performance indicators, current practice, and emerging trends  Proactively establish and maintain collaborative relationships with leaders across the university to promote the improvement and advancement of WGU’s assessment strategy  Monitor assessment portfolio health across the assessment lifecycle  Communicate solutions to stakeholders in a manner that simplifies complexity and generates excitement  Produce timely, consistent, and accurate reports for stakeholders and executives  Knowledge  , Skill  and  Abilities governance  Practical understanding of teaching and learning, educational trends and research  Demonstrated skill in providing technical training in person, remotely, and asynchronously as well as persuasively explaining complex assessment policy and best practices to a lay audience  Ability to lead through influence in a highly matrixed organization  Ability to build relationships and
