Job_Title: Enterprise Reference Data - Software Engineer (DIO - RefData) - Enterprise Reference Data
Description: Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. We are recruiting highly motivated individuals for software development roles on the Enterprise Reference Data Engineering Team, based in New York/SLC/London/Warsaw/Bengaluru/Tokyo. Effectively leveraging financial market data to drive business is the key for successful financial services that firm provides to its customers, and working with massive volumes of data quickly is a differentiator. It gives firm the opportunity to respond more quickly to changes, gain deeper insights and forecast capabilities. The challenges related to use the data to drive innovation and customer experience are even greater. Our team builds platforms and technology solutions to model, source, and distribute the data including clients, accounts, financial products and prices to all of firm systems. We are an accelerator and enabler for business, making them more effective at managing and optimizing consumption of reference data, abstracting client, market and regulatory changes through innovative solutions. Our team is made of software developers and technical product owners with deep technical skills and an affinity for creating solutions with the potential for enterprise-wide impact.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS You will be part of the technology function for Enterprise Reference Data, focusing on building data sourcing, controls and distribution architecture that enables the business to operate efficiently with the data.You should be able to quickly build visualizations on top of MongoDB / Sybase / DB2 / Elastic Search data to meet business needs, as well as be the thought leader to influence functional heads on new and innovate ways to visualize data that will help drive business value.You will help design data architecture to enhance existing pipelines as well as build feeds for new data sources.You will work closely with business partners and technology leaders to evaluate new tools that can further enhance the business’ ability to analyze data.You will participate in data architecture decisions and partner with technology teams to implement data products in production systems.This is a wide open opportunity for a motivated individual to use their skills to drive change in a high-visibility, challenging environment.Skills And Experience We Are Looking ForBachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines2+ years of software industry experience with strong analytical and problem solving skillsHands on experience in one of the mainstream programming language (Java, C++, etc.) using object-oriented design techniques and best practicesExperience of test-driven development, hands on experience with testing frameworks such as JUnit.Good understanding and experience in using data structures and algorithmsBasic understanding in working with SQL/NoSQLGood communication and interpersonal skillsPreferred QualificationsBasic understanding on any big data platform and data analysis methodologiesAt least 1 year experience dealing with data (structured or unstructured)Experience in working with SQL/NoSQL data stores (e.g. MongoDB)Good understanding of distributed and scalable system designWorking with client to transform requirements into software solutionsExperience working in a start-up business or a new business line within a larger organization is preferredWeb services development: RESTful APIs; Swagger; Jersey; GlassfishHands-on experience working with Linux and basic scripting (Bash)About Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.Division Engineering

Job_Title: Risk, Risk Engineering - Analytics & Reporting, Associate, Salt Lake City
Description: Risk, Risk Engineering - Analytics &  Reporting Associate  RISK The Risk Division aims to effectively identify, monitor, evaluate, and manage the firm’s financial and operational risks — including reputational risk — in support of the firm’s strategic plan.Our Risk division develops comprehensive processes to monitor, assess, and manage the risk of expected and unexpected events that may have an adverse impact on the firm. Risk teams play a critical function for the firm, driving how the firm takes and manages risk. Risk professionals execute critical day-to-day risk management activities, lead projects and contribute to the ongoing advancement of a robust risk management program. Effective coordination with executive management, business units, control departments and technology is critical for success.We are at the forefront of the most recent engineering solutions, including cloud computing and big data, to better manage compute costs for the firm given increasing demands related to asset pricing and scenario generation.Whether assessing the creditworthiness of the firm’s counterparties, monitoring market risks associated with trading activities, or offering analytical and regulatory compliance support, our work contributes directly to the firm’s success. The division is ideal for collaborative individuals who have strong ethics and attention to detail.Department OverviewRisk Engineering (RE) is a central part of the Goldman Sachs risk management framework, with a responsibility to provide robust metrics, data-driven insights, and effective technologies for risk measurement and management. RE is staffed globally with offices including Dallas, New Jersey, New York, Salt Lake City, London, Warsaw, Bengaluru and Tokyo. As a member of the RE team, you will interface with a variety of divisions around the firm. The interaction with numerous departments, and the ensuing diverse projects, create a challenging, varied and multi-dimensional work environment.The team is also responsible for aspects of the firm’s risk reporting to the firm’s senior management as well as risk-related regulatory requirements including financial statement disclosure, risk-based capital requirements (Basel III) and Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR). The group employs the complete capabilities of Risk Engineering to maximize significance, quality, efficiency, speed, and reliability while ensuring clear accountability and attribution of the analytics produced. As a member of the Analytics and Reporting Team within RE, you will play a key role in providing understanding of and insight into existing and emerging risks to the Firm, highlighting important and topical risk features, facilitating and informing risk management decisions, as well as certifying risk information for use in management, regulatory, and financial reporting.Responsibilities RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Analyse the risks inherent in the products GS transacts, including lending, trading and derivative products  Assist in quantifying risk and capital calculations for a large, diverse and complex risk portfolio. This involves designing, implementing and executing programmatic tools that query large data sets  Understand and interpret the metrics generated by models in order to perform risk analysis  Design and maintaining a set of controls that ensure the completeness and accuracy of quantitative measures  Report and present on exposures and capital at a risk party, product and portfolio level  Perform anomaly detections in large data sets, investigating the cause and recommending corrective actions  Interact with various other groups such as risk modelers, technology, trading desks and risk committees to explain the results of calculations and inform risk management decisions Qualifications Strong academic background, preferably in quantitative fields such as finance, economics, computer science, applied mathematics, engineering or statistics, though not required  Strong interest and familiarity with finance, financial markets and economic developments  Strong interest in working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment  Experience or keen interest to develop expertise in derivative products, and risk and capital calculation methodologies  Proficient in Excel. Programming skills preferred  Strong communication, interpersonal skills and ability to build relationships remotely with people from different departments and levels of seniority  Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple assignments concurrently About Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Job_Title: Strats Deposit Modeler - Corporate Treasury Engineering - Finance Engineering
Description: The Corporate Treasury Strats team is looking for world class quantitative programmers to work closely with Corporate Treasury partners to employ quantitative analytics to drive optimizations of firm liquidity, cash and collateral management, funds transfer pricing and trade execution strategies. This is an integrated group which both explores new ideas for optimizing the funding management of the firm and also executes trading strategies, all in one team. Corporate Treasury lies at the heart of Goldman Sachs, ensuring that businesses have the appropriate level of funding to conduct their activities, while also optimizing the firm’s funding costs and managing liquidity risks. As part of the Corporate Treasury Engineering team you will be exposed to securities division and banking initiatives, to new business activities, and to critical strategic programs Goldman Sachs pursues to maintain its leadership among global financial institutions. Corporate Treasury Strats use their engineering and/or scientific background to implement quantitative analytics and management solutions in software. Corporate Treasury Engineering products guide funding souring decisions, allocation of financial resources, quantification of funding costs, and strategies to minimize costs and hedge risks. Successful strats are highly analytical, driven to own commercial outcomes, and communicate with precision and clarity.Corporate Treasury Strats welcomes applicants with Master’s or a PhD in financial engineering/financial math; quantitative sciences, e.g. physics, statistics, applied math or other quantitative discipline; or relevant professional experience. Strong analytical skills, mathematical fluency, and programming abilities are required.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Use machine learning techniques and statistical modeling to develop pricing analytics and liquidity models for retail deposits including overnight deposits and term deposits Use experience in building linear and non-linear models to develop analytics to drive the growth of the deposit platform Develop software and analytics to further Corporate Treasury’s firmwide mandates: liquidity risk and interest rate risk management and trade execution, cash & collateral management, funding optimization Optimize the firm’s liability stack by developing balance sheet analytics and hedging strategies Work with treasury, desk strategists, and technology departments to implement processes to optimally leverage financial resources to achieve commercial priorities Perform quantitative analysis and facilitate business understanding of technical resultsSkills And Experience We Are Looking For Minimum 5 years of experience in a quantitative finance role Solid background in computer programming, Python, C++, Java, Matlab or equivalent language, preferably in large scale financial or technical computations Solid background in computer programming, Python, C++, Java, Matlab or equivalent language, preferably in large scale financial or technical computations Familiarity with financial markets and assets, with a preference for experience with asset pricing and metrics used to govern financial institutions. Excellent communication skills, including experience speaking to technical and business audiences and working globally Can apply entrepreneurial approach and passion to problem solving and product development Good knowledge of SQL and databases is a plusAbout Goldman SachsPreferred QualificationsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. Job_Title: Enterprise Reference Data - Software Engineer (DIO - RefData) - Enterprise Reference Data
Description: Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. We are recruiting highly motivated individuals for software development roles on the Enterprise Reference Data Engineering Team, based in New York/SLC/London/Warsaw/Bengaluru/Tokyo. Effectively leveraging financial market data to drive business is the key for successful financial services that firm provides to its customers, and working with massive volumes of data quickly is a differentiator. It gives firm the opportunity to respond more quickly to changes, gain deeper insights and forecast capabilities. The challenges related to use the data to drive innovation and customer experience are even greater. Our team builds platforms and technology solutions to model, source, and distribute the data including clients, accounts, financial products and prices to all of firm systems. We are an accelerator and enabler for business, making them more effective at managing and optimizing consumption of reference data, abstracting client, market and regulatory changes through innovative solutions. Our team is made of software developers and technical product owners with deep technical skills and an affinity for creating solutions with the potential for enterprise-wide impact.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS You will be part of the technology function for Enterprise Reference Data, focusing on building data sourcing, controls and distribution architecture that enables the business to operate efficiently with the data.You should be able to quickly build visualizations on top of MongoDB / Sybase / DB2 / Elastic Search data to meet business needs, as well as be the thought leader to influence functional heads on new and innovate ways to visualize data that will help drive business value.You will help design data architecture to enhance existing pipelines as well as build feeds for new data sources.You will work closely with business partners and technology leaders to evaluate new tools that can further enhance the business’ ability to analyze data.You will participate in data architecture decisions and partner with technology teams to implement data products in production systems.This is a wide open opportunity for a motivated individual to use their skills to drive change in a high-visibility, challenging environment.Skills And Experience We Are Looking ForBachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines2+ years of software industry experience with strong analytical and problem solving skillsHands on experience in one of the mainstream programming language (Java, C++, etc.) using object-oriented design techniques and best practicesExperience of test-driven development, hands on experience with testing frameworks such as JUnit.Good understanding and experience in using data structures and algorithmsBasic understanding in working with SQL/NoSQLGood communication and interpersonal skillsPreferred QualificationsBasic understanding on any big data platform and data analysis methodologiesAt least 1 year experience dealing with data (structured or unstructured)Experience in working with SQL/NoSQL data stores (e.g. MongoDB)Good understanding of distributed and scalable system designWorking with client to transform requirements into software solutionsExperience working in a start-up business or a new business line within a larger organization is preferredWeb services development: RESTful APIs; Swagger; Jersey; GlassfishHands-on experience working with Linux and basic scripting (Bash)About Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment BioFire Diagnostics, LLC. is looking for a Business Intelligent (BI) Analyst to join our growing team! The BI Analyst contributes to design, development, maintenance, and support of complex business intelligence applications and solutions, including development of verification tests to ensure data functionality and integrity and utilization of data mining and data storage techniques to assist resources throughout the organization in the visualization and interpretation of data. Analyst will be capable of understanding complex ERP, CRM and additional systems data infrastructure and how it relates to operations system data to provide value to organization through data query generation, analysis, modeling, and communication.Analyst is responsible to identify data analysis and reporting needs within organization in effort to provide data support, data analysis, and/or reporting solutions in response. Includes development of standard or custom reports, queries, or dashboards that access and consolidate information from a variety of data sources, and provides ongoing support for data users.Analyst will work on several projects simultaneously, utilizing several data sources to complete projects. Analyst will frequently interact with executive level management to present BI data that will impact high level decisions affecting business. Analyst must have the ability to work as part of a team. Effective time management, analytical thinking skills, organization skills, and the ability to communicate effectively is important in role.Principal Job Duties And ResponsibilitiesPerform all work in compliance with company policy and within the guidelines of BioFire’s Quality System.Understand BioFire’s technical and scientific mission.Understand technical and functional components of BioFire DiagnosticsContribute to development of BI infrastructure including design, build, management, maintenance, and optimization of a data warehouseProvide BI analytics to business unit Managers, Directors, and Executive Management Group (EMG) that are actionable and impact business decisions.Participate in collaboration efforts with global BI development teams (e.g. bioMerieux France, Cognizant development team in India).Participate in supplier sourcing and negotiation requirements as needed.Constructs forecasts, recommendations and strategic/ tactical plans based on business and market data.Write documentation for analysis methods, specifications and reports. Documents typically describe models, data analysis and algorithms. The content of the documentation should be adjusted to match audience.Must be familiar with a variety BI concepts, practices, and procedures.Provide BI software utility training to internal subject matter experts.Collaborate with internal data analyst/science teams to provide accurate analytics to business.Prioritize and complete data requests in a timely mannerComplete projects on time with minimal supervision.Continually update technical knowledge and skills.Other duties as assigned.Minimum QualificationsTraining & Education: BS degree in Computer Science, IS, IT or related field required. Professional BI certifications preferred.ExperienceMinimum 5 years of relevant experience requiredExperience developing BI solutions with SAP Hana (SCP), MS Azure, and/or Amazon AWS preferredSkillsUnderstands complex BI / data integration and implementation project requirements, including data modeling, data warehouse development and BI architecture and design.Understands ERP and CRM systems data infrastructure and how it relates to transformation requirements (data warehouse) for analysis.Expert level in Excel. Expert level in SQL (MS SQL/TSQL, MySQL, and/or Amazon Redshift SQL)Experience in BI Software (Power BI, SAP BusinessObjects, DOMO, Tableau, etc.)Experience in one of the following programming/analytical languages: R, Python, C#, Java, JavaScript, and D3.JS.Experience working with data from SAP, Salesforce, OSI PI System, and Jira a plus.Experience in data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes.Understands data visualization best practices.Adobe Illustrator experience is a plus but not required.Orientation for detail work product, with emphasis or accuracy and completeness.Proficient in MS Office Suite and flow charts software.Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectivelyMust demonstrate ability to complete objectives without high levels of supervision.

We are seeking a dedicated and hardworking Software Engineer with best-in-class technical, design and development skills to join our Analytics Intelligent Services team.The challengeJoin an agile software development team to build new microservice solutions within the Adobe Analytics platform. You will architect, develop and release new services to power Adobe's Experience Cloud, working to deliver solutions at scale in a big data cloud platform. As a Software Engineer on the team, you will participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle including the architecture, design, development, and maintenance of industry leading products.This role will sit directly with the team in Lehi, Utah aligned to the Digital Marketing Business Unit of Adobe. You should have a real passion for backend server-side development as we are looking for a strong backend-focused Engineer with at least 3 years academic or industry programming experience. Do you want to work on a high-throughput low latency platform unlike any other in the industry? At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We unite Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting!), 18 timezones, and 30 different languages into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.The Elastic Security Data Engineering team designs, builds, and runs data processing pipelines that synthesize security data from a broad set of sources and deliver innovative detection capabilities that power our security products. We are looking for a Data Engineer to craft stream data processing and machine learning systems powering security products that dynamically adapt to changing threats. You will collaborate with the broader Elastic Security team, a diverse set of security researchers, data scientists, and engineers who lend domain expertise to work with you to solve creative security problems and deliver fantastic user experiences.What You Will Be Doing Work as part of the Security Protections team at Elastic with other data engineers, data scientists, and security researchers Improve and expand our security data pipeline across all aspects of software telemetry, data ingest, storage, real-time and batch analytics, machine learning, and data-powered web services Write code in a collaborative environment for new data pipelines and web services Operate and improve cloud-hosted big data systems that manage and analyze malware samples and security activity events Collaborate with security research engineers and data scientists to measure and improve security protections and ML models Collaborate with Elastic Stack software engineers to build multifaceted cloud-based services that deliver a continuously improving user experience Advocate for data-powered services and experiences across the Elastic product portfolio What You Bring Along 7+ years experience programming in Python, OCaml, Go, or equivalent experience in a similar language and ability to learn these languages quickly 5+ years experience building, deploying and operating production-quality distributed data storage and processing systems in an environment of continuous integration and delivery Demonstrated experience designing and building public-cloud hosted infrastructure with AWS, GCP, Docker, and/or Terraform Proficient peer leader with experience partnering with other senior technical and business leaders to lead and mentor junior engineers Collaborative attitude with a strong disposition to learn new skills and emerging technologies Self-motivated and able to thrive in a distributed, fast-paced, and autonomous environment Passionate about protecting the world’s data from attack Desired Experience Or Interests Data streaming / database tech, e.g. SQL, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Spark Distributed systems / messaging tech, e.g. Kafka, NATS, AWS Lambda Functional programming, e.g. OCaml, Haskell Training, measuring, and improving ML models Endpoint and/or network information security Additional InformationWe're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Remote work-from-home option Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary Equity Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads) Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Job_Title: Analytic Consultant 4 - Compliance Independent Risk Management
Description: Job DescriptionImportant Note  During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume prior to submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application.At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. The team focuses on several key risk types, including conduct, credit, financial crimes, information security, interest rate, liquidity, market, model, operational, regulatory compliance, reputation, strategic, and technology risk. The group provides leadership, enhances communications, assists with problem identification and solutions, and shares best practices. In addition, the group provides an enterprise-wide view of risk, assists management and our Board of Directors in identifying and monitoring risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and takes appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.This Analytic Consultant 4 is a key position within the Wells Fargo Compliance Independent Risk Management Home Lending analytics team. The Consultant will develop processes, analyses, and reporting to support compliance regulations implemented under the Dodd-Frank Act.Responsibilities Include Communicate project results and recommendations to senior leadership to support our strategic direction in the regulatory environment. Think outside the box to lead the development of new analytical techniques. Analyze transactional data, that is being captured in Regulatory Data Repository (RDR) compliance database, for project work Spearhead the development of analytical strategies for developing insights from time series data captured within this data repository. Utilize traditional statistical regression techniques.Project work may require the use of leading edge big data techniques for analyzing unstructured contextual data in Home Mortgage's loan application process.Please Note  Based on the volume of applications received, this job posting may be removed prior to the indicated close date. If you do not apply prior to the closing of this posting, we encourage you to apply for other opportunities with Wells Fargo.Required Qualifications6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following reporting, analytics, or modelingDesired QualificationsExtensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysisStrong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracyExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills5+ years of SAS programming experienceKnowledge and understanding of databases and data mining techniquesOutstanding problem solving and analytical skills with ability to turn findings into strategic imperativesAbility to work effectively, as well as independently, in a team environmentKnowledge and understanding of analytical methods used in statistical analysis, modeling, and reportingTeradata experience5+ years of SQL experienceSolid critical thinking skillsAbility to positively influence, motivate, and direct diverse teamsDemonstration and presentation facilitation skillsMetadata management and data integrity skillsAbility to develop partnerships and collaborate with other business and functional areasOther Desired Qualifications Able to analyze complex situations, and create and implement solutions to best protect the company from Legal, Regulatory, and Compliance risk Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to manage multiple responsibilities and tasks simultaneously Proven ability to collaborate with others, initiate action plans, manage change, make high impact decisions, and complete challenging assignments Demonstrated experience in data projects 3+ years of experience in an advanced analytics function such as statistical regressions, correlations, variance analysis, trending, anomalies, etc. 3+ years of knowledge of Real Estate Lending business processes and regulations like TRID, HMDA, QM-ATR, and Appraisal Delivery Knowledge in data warehouse and all aspects of project life cycleStreet AddressIA-West Des Moines 7001 Westown Pkwy - West Des Moines, IADisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.Reference Number 5517952-14

If you are an active Vivint employee, please apply through Workday by searching "Find Jobs".Job DescriptionWhy you’ll be excited to work at Vivint InternetWe are on a bold mission to offer a new model to how we provide home internet and connect the things you care about in your home built around our industry-leading millimeter wave technology and our deep focus on customer experience. We are a growth-stage, Series-B company with investors that include Blackstone and Peter Thiel, that has developed a new mesh wireless technology that enables us to quickly enter new markets and offer internet speeds up to 1Gbps with fiber grade capacity across large suburban areas. We know that most people aren’t happy with their home internet service today but haven’t really had many choices for broadband either. We aim to change that, quickly.What excites us is an opportunity to disrupt a trillion-dollar industry with a cutting-edge technology and a market leading customer experience. We have over 10,000 customers today in two metro markets and are looking to launch several new markets this year using our next generation technologies that will provide a very differentiated customer experience.As a growth-stage company aligned with the Vivint family, we combine a depth of capabilities and resources of our parent company with the ambition, culture and agility of a Series B startup. Our multinational team, comprised of veterans of Clearwire, Google, Sprint and Rise, is dual headquartered in two of the hottest tech centers in Santa Clara, CA and Lehi, UT.RoleAs the Sr. Business Data Analyst, you will lead the development of Vivint Internet’s Data Analytics Program and play a key role in cultivating the company’s data culture. By quickly establishing relationships across the business, you will serve as the primary point-of-contact for the company’s analytics needs. You will develop and mature the organization’s data architecture while developing and maintaining an effective and efficient data process that ranges from data mining and visualization, to drawing key business and operational insights. This role will be both tactical and strategic. In addition to the core data analytics capability you will bring to the business, as the business scales and data needs increase, you will be responsible for developing and driving mid and long term data strategy working alongside the Strategy Team and functional leads.What Excites You About This RoleCreate the foundations of a data-driven business within a rapidly growing companyTake the lead in driving data analytics initiatives working with leaders across the organizationHelp define business metrics including Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and associated measurement methodologiesApply analytics techniques (core statistical-modeling, data visualization, data mining) to extract actionable insights through analysis of large-scale, high-dimensional dataDevelop and utilize knowledge of understand the business requirements and guide the teams to arrive at strategic, data-driven decisionsTo have an opportunity to grow your role and leadership impact further and faster as part of a rapidly scaling new businessThe opportunity to collaborate and have impact across multiple areas of an innovative companyYou enjoy organizing and managing complex projects that span multiple organizational functions and have non-linear dependenciesHaving a positive impact on peers and associates that you help to coordinate and deliver withWorking in a high-growth environment focused on What you will do:Collaborate with fellow engineers, scientists and designers to take an idea from concept to prototype to released product.Eliminating defects in our code and refactoring it to reduce its length, complexity and time required to test or add functionality.Pitch in wherever it has the greatest impact. We’re more interested in rapid innovation, iteration, collaboration and problem solving than establishing rigid job definitions. Our products need to be fast, easy to use and yield quality results. Technical areas of need include:Intuitive user interface developmentEmbedded instrument controlHigh throughput data processing and managementAlgorithm development, machine vision and machine learningContinuously learn, try new things and expand your capabilities.Who You Are:Programmed in C# (1-3 years). Exposure to one or more of the following languages: JavaScript (React Hooks), Rust, C++, C, F#, Elm, Typescript, Reason.Possesses an insatiable curiosity and love for learning technology and science with a willingness to learn new computer languages, libraries and frameworks as well as different programming paradigms (e.g. object-oriented and functional)You have a sense of urgency and prefer rapid iterations of experiments and tests to endless debating.Bachelor or master’s degree in computer science, computer engineering or equivalent years of software development experience with a degree in engineering or science.Comfortable with Agile development practices.Familiar with our core development and issue tracking tools (i.e. Git, JIRA).A team player with a sense of humor. We take our work seriously but not ourselves too seriously. We learn from each other and laugh at our mistakes.

User Experience Analyst   ASEA is looking for a talented and enthusiastic User Experience Analyst to join our team. ASEA, a global leader in cellular health, is dedicated to providing a sustainable lifestyle by delivering high-quality health products through a direct-selling distribution model. ASEA offers first-to-market products that affect health at the genetic level. We're regularly included on Utah's Best Places to Work and have a tight knit team that work hard and play hard. Perks include working in a brand new, very cool, office space (complete with ping pong table and soda fountain) coupled with great opportunities for personal and professional growth.   SUMMARY:   We are looking for a data analyst to analyze online customer behavior data for websites, mobile apps, and marketing automation. You will run experiments help us make informed product decisions by exploring user motivation and behaviors. As a member of our Marketing Technology team, you will work cross-functionally with internal teams including Sales, Product, Engineering, and Operations. If you are passionate about improving the user experience, creating process and structure, and are ready to work on a team of individuals that share the same vision, then we want you on our team.   RESPONSIBILITIES: Research Design and conduct discovery research into complex problems and potential features in our UX/UI experience and our technology products to glean insights to help prioritize projects and implement effective solutions Studying behavior from multiple points of view by segment, by site, by campaign, and by user action. Perform A/B testing and make recommendations for optimization on sites and mobile apps Planning, recruiting participants for, and moderating concept research and/or usability testing for mobile and desktop devices. Initiating and managing cross-functional collaboration throughout research activities. Analysis Define KPIs, identify trends, and derive relevant metrics, targets and insights for online and mobile media. Collaborate with the corporate business intelligence team and engineering team to identify tracking requirements for web and mobile platforms. Analyzing research findings, translating them into valuable insights, and present them to the team and key stakeholders. Perform analytical deep dives as needed Reporting Build reports, dashboards, and data visualizations and share them with stakeholders. Report on digital traffic and behavior using Google Analytics, Mouseflow, and other data gathering tools. Formulating and documenting UX research best practices and communicating those with the rest of the organization. Be a technical problem solver, playing a strategic role and feeding back insights to the UX/UI and development teams.   QUALIFICATIONS: 5+ years UX and analytical work experience Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline. Previous experience in UX/UI research, analysis, and reporting Experience in web analytics utilizing Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics Experience with data visualization tools You're passionate about data and user experience. You are comfortable with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques and are driven to find meaningful patterns and trends in the data. You are insatiably intellectually curious, you have a structured approach to problem solving that you are continuously refining. You have excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail and ability to effectively manage projects supporting multiple internal partners. Collaborative and open minded. You have experience and an interest in partnering with diverse team members, who are coming to the table with different opinions and perspectives and ideas. You are open to creative data-driven approaches to solving problems.   If you'd like to be part of a great team, are ready to take on a challenge and make a difference within our company, apply today. We offer a competitive wage and excellent benefits package including 401(k), medical, dental, vision, life, disability, supplemental insurance, paid time off, and free company products.

One of our clients is looking to bring on a Senior Data Scientist with a proven track record of working with AI and Deep Learning to mentor their growing Data Science division. Create a quantitative impact on the entertainment space with this cutting-edge Deep Learning opportunity! This team receives great support from executives, making sure at all times that they receive the resources they need to succeed. THE ROLE As a Senior Data Scientist, you will work on cutting-edge problems across the platform including: Working with large data sets, both structured and unstructured. Employ Deep Learning techniques Reviewing code and helping build a roadmap for more junior members of the team. Mentoring a team for technical growth. Applying Python-based machine learning and analysis techniques to a variety of complex problems dealing with user engagement. Taking ownership of projects and contributing to all aspects of product lifecycle. SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE The successful Senior Machine Learning Engineer will have the following skills and experience: Advanced education in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or a related field. Commercial experience in end to end model generation. Strong experience working in deep learning in a commercial environment. Track record of motivating and leading a team of Data Scientists. Proven experience working with advanced neural networks. Tools: Python, SQL, and Deep Learning platforms such as Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch THE BENEFITS The successful Senior Machine Learning Engineer will receive a salary of $155,000-$175,000/yr, dependent upon experience. Additional benefits include: Healthcare, vision, and dental 401k matching

About AncestryWhen you join Ancestry, you join our family tree. Backed by history, science, and technology, were creating a new world of connection, innovation, and understanding. Whether its reuniting long-lost relatives through DNA or unearthing new family stories from historical records, Ancestry empowers life-changing experiences. With over 20 billion digitized historical records, 100 million family trees, and 15+ million DNA kits sold, Ancestry is bringing the power of personal discovery to people around the world.Ancestry is looking for a highly motivated, internet-savvy Back-end/Middleware Software Engineer intern to join our API - Sentinel team. The API team provides mission-critical API access and security to all our back-end data services using the latest Java 8/nodejs technology stacks and AWS computing paradigms. As a Back-end/Middleware Software Engineer on the API team you will join a fast-paced initiative to dramatically accelerate the companys ability to quickly develop front-end user experiences and data discovery and standardization.What You'll DoBe part of the development team delivering real featuresInterface and onboard other development teams onto the Middleware platformLearn to deploy systems using technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes and Amazon Web ServicesEnsure API performance is best-in-classWork to refine software designs and create proof-of-conceptsWho You AreMust be currently enrolled in a university and graduating after Summer 2020 Has a drive to learn new technologies in a fast-paced environmentKnowledgeable of Java 8Understands agile methodologies and practicesIs self-motivated, can work independently and digs for an answerNice to have: experience with Maven, Docker, Kubernetes and AWSIt takes customer obsession to pioneer and focus on what matters most, to tackle challenges, break through boundaries to create change, to stay on the cutting edge, and pioneer relentlessly. We are looking for the next generation of talent to drive the business, grow our people, and put the customer before all else.Our culture empowers journeys of personal discovery, giving you the freedom to participate in impactful projects and explore the intersections of our businesses: technology, data science, DNA science, product, design, marketing, legal, and more. Were looking for innovative minds, diverse ideas, and for students interested in connecting personal discoveries and technology. Our interns enjoy mentorship and experience challenging work while receiving fantastic pay, fully-paid temporary housing, and having a fun captivating experiencewe have it all. In Finance Engineering, you’ll find an exciting confluence of computer science, finance and mathematics being used to solve for what our shareholders would like from us – a high return for the right risk taken.Corporate Treasury Strats team is looking for world class quantitative programmers to work closely with Corporate Treasury partners to employ quantitative analytics to drive optimizations of firm liquidity, cash and collateral management, funds transfer pricing and trade execution strategies. This is an integrated group which both explores new ideas for optimizing the funding management of the firm and also executes trading strategies, all in one team. Corporate Treasury lies at the heart of Goldman Sachs, ensuring that businesses have the appropriate level of funding to conduct their activities, while also optimizing the firm’s funding costs and managing liquidity risks. As part of the Corporate Treasury Engineering team you will be exposed to securities division and banking initiatives, to new business activities, and to critical strategic programs Goldman Sachs pursues to maintain its leadership among global financial institutions.YOUR IMPACTCorporate Treasury Strats use their engineering and/or scientific background to implement quantitative analytics and management solutions in software. Corporate Treasury Engineering products guide funding sourcing decisions, allocation of financial resources, quantification of funding costs, and strategies to minimize costs and hedge risks. Successful strats are highly analytical, driven to own commercial outcomes, and communicate with precision and clarity. Corporate Treasury Strats welcomes applicants with Master’s or a PhD in financial engineering/financial math; quantitative sciences, e.g. physics, statistics, applied math or other quantitative discipline; or relevant professional experience. Strong analytical skills, mathematical fluency, and programming abilities are required.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Develop software and analytics to further Corporate Treasury’s firmwide mandates: liquidity risk and interest rate risk management and trade execution, cash & collateral management, funding optimization Use machine learning techniques and statistical modeling to develop pricing analytics and behavioral models for deposit products Optimize the firm’s liability stack by developing balance sheet analytics and hedging strategies Work with treasury, desk strategists, and technology departments to implement processes to optimally leverage financial resources to achieve commercial priorities Perform quantitative analysis and facilitate business understanding of technical resultsSkills And Experience We Are Looking For Solid background in computer programming, Python, C++, Java, Matlab or equivalent language, preferably in large scale financial or technical computations Expertise in some aspect of quantitative analysis, e.g. statistics, stochastic calculus, scientific computing, econometrics, machine learning algorithms, financial modeling Familiarity with financial markets and assets, with a preference for experience with asset pricing and metrics used to govern financial institutions, e.g. liquidity coverage ratios, balance sheet and capital ratios Excellent communication skills, including experience speaking to technical and business audiences and working globally Can apply entrepreneurial approach and passion to problem solving and product developmentAbout Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. About AncestryWhen you join Ancestry, you join our family tree. Backed by history, science, and technology, were creating a new world of connection, innovation, and understanding. Whether its reuniting long-lost relatives through DNA or unearthing new family stories from historical records, Ancestry empowers life-changing experiences. Our team is responsible for the entire family history subscription product for Ancestry. The experiences we create allow people build family trees, research their ancestors and make amazing discoveries about themselves and their family history. As a UX Design Intern on the Genealogy team, you will work closely with a dedicated design mentor within a warm and friendly design team. Partnering with customers, product managers, user researchers, and software engineers, your work will bring digital experiences to life. Learning how to communicate your concepts and requirements to a cross functional team, you will gain experience working in an agile development environment. Corporate Treasury Engineering team is looking for world class software engineers to work closely with Corporate Treasury business partners and help improve liquidity projections/optimizations, financial resource allocation and management, cash and collateral management and funds transfer pricing and execution strategy.This is a one of a kind front to back integrated group that explores new ideas of optimizing firm liquidity position and also execute on the strategy, all in one team. The team is divided into five pillars each with its specific mandate. Whether you like to spend your energies into thinking about the scalable big data architecture, understanding the inventory and liquidity usage optimization algorithms or working with Traders directly on execution of trades and risk management, we have it all for you.Corporate Treasury lies at the heart of Goldman Sachs, ensuring all the businesses have the appropriate level of funding to conduct their activities, while also optimizing the firm’s liquidity and managing its risk and being part of the engineering team will expose you to everything that’s important and happening the firm. The scale of the liquidity optimization and execution problem keeps us interested every day and we hope to share our enthusiasm and challenge with you.YOUR IMPACTOur Corporate Treasury Engineering team is a world leader in developing quantitative techniques and technological solutions that solve complex and commercial business problems. We partner with our firm’s treasurer and businesses, including new growth areas like Marcus and Corporate Banking, to implement a new strategic real-time liquidity platform. You will be involved in Front-to-back liquidity modelling on an event bus that will provide uniformity in all liquidity data that uses Spark for complex liquidity calculations. Clustered HTAP databases provide a high performance, scalable liquidity store. The platform will support a central execution capability to move assets around the globe to meet business obligations and facilitate significant optimization and automation capabilities.In this role, you will be provided unique insight into the firm’s business activities and asset strategy. You will be responsible for defining, developing software’s to analyze data, built metric calculators, automated tools to help business get insights into data, predict scenarios and perform better decision making to reduce interest expenses for the firm. This front to back model gives software developer’s window into all aspects of CT planning and execution while working on cutting edge industrial technologies.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Translate business and technical requirements into well-engineered business applications based on object oriented design.  Interface with internal clients/end users and other development teams  Participate in the full SDLC for software written with Java, SQL, RESTful web services, JMS messaging and web UIs.  Opportunity to work on No-SQL database, micro-services and AI Technologies Skills And Experience We Are Looking For Bachelor Degree  1-3 years of experience with object orientated programming in Java  1-3 years of experience of relation databases or no-sql databases  Strong analytical skills to perform complex functional and technical analysis  Strong communication skills  Highly enthusiastic, can do attitude. Job_Title: Operations Risk Management – Risk Solutions Team – Associate/Vice President– Salt Lake City
Description: OPERATIONSOperations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the firm to provide banking, securities, and asset management services to clients around the world. In addition, Operations provides essential risk management and controls to preserve and enhance the firm's assets and its reputation. For every new product launched and every trade executed, it is Operations that develops and manages the processes and controls that enable business flow.Operations Risk Management (ORM) is responsible for coordinating the Operations Risk Management framework activities across the Division, with particular focus on cross-divisional risk reporting, remediation and governance. Other key responsibilities include pro-actively improving the risk and control framework across Operations through more objective control assessments, conducting post implementation reviews, and developing risk training programs and risk management tools.Risk Solutions Team’s primary mission is to drive the development and deployment of new risk metrics and analytics while providing thought leadership and expertise in risk measurement, risk tools and risk information visualization. As we access new data sources our challenge is to leverage them effectively and provide actionable metrics and visualizations that will drive change and facilitate more effective risk management. We interact and support our embedded risk managers and seek to provide them with the analytics and tools to maximize their effectiveness.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Develop high impact analytics, visualizations and dashboards to support both senior and line manager risk management  Help project manage ongoing initiatives  Assist in developing high impact presentations Job Summary And ResponsibilitiesSKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE’RE LOOKING FOR Ability to operate independently and effectively drive multiple initiatives within RMI/ORM  Demonstrate excellent process and interpersonal skills  Ability to engage with and influence stakeholders outside their direct control  Ability to combine tactical and strategic thinking  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, written and oral; confident in interaction with senior stakeholders  Strategic thinker with strong business analysis and planning skills. Capable of identifying and interpreting wider-ranging issues  Big picture understanding Core Qualifications Bachelor's degree  Proficiency in Access or other querying language  Experience using data management / data modeling tools (Alteryx, Tableau)  Experience in project management  Experience in Financial Services  Working knowledge of more than one programming language (E.g. R, VBA, Python, Java, C++, C#)  Hands-on experience with data modelling and BI tools (Tableau, Alteryx, MS-BI Stack, SSRS, Qlikview, Elastic Search, PURE modelling etc)  Advanced expertise with Business Intelligence Database Infrastructure and Machine Learning will be an advantage (SQL Server, MongoDB, DB2, Data Lake)  Hands-on with advanced Microsoft Excel functionalities  Exhibit ability to multi-task and prioritize to deliver accurate and timely work in a time pressured environment Additional Expertise Provides creative & innovative solutions  Strong organization skills - ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize accordingly  Exemplary attention to detail and ability to work to tight deadlines under pressure  Demonstrate understanding of Operations processes and procedures and an ability to learn quickly  Knowledge of products and processes related to the financial services industry would be an advantage, as is related experience in a client service or business function and / or management consulting  Demonstrate comprehensive understanding of job-related operational and compliance procedures  Understands and appropriately addresses Goldman Sachs compliance and reputation judgment issues About Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Job_Title: Enterprise Reference Data - Software Engineer (DIO - RefData) - Enterprise Reference Data
Description: Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. We are recruiting highly motivated individuals for software development roles on the Enterprise Reference Data Engineering Team, based in New York/SLC/London/Warsaw/Bengaluru/Tokyo. Effectively leveraging financial market data to drive business is the key for successful financial services that firm provides to its customers, and working with massive volumes of data quickly is a differentiator. It gives firm the opportunity to respond more quickly to changes, gain deeper insights and forecast capabilities. The challenges related to use the data to drive innovation and customer experience are even greater. Our team builds platforms and technology solutions to model, source, and distribute the data including clients, accounts, financial products and prices to all of firm systems. We are an accelerator and enabler for business, making them more effective at managing and optimizing consumption of reference data, abstracting client, market and regulatory changes through innovative solutions. Our team is made of software developers and technical product owners with deep technical skills and an affinity for creating solutions with the potential for enterprise-wide impact.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS You will be part of the technology function for Enterprise Reference Data, focusing on building data sourcing, controls and distribution architecture that enables the business to operate efficiently with the data.You should be able to quickly build visualizations on top of MongoDB / Sybase / DB2 / Elastic Search data to meet business needs, as well as be the thought leader to influence functional heads on new and innovate ways to visualize data that will help drive business value.You will help design data architecture to enhance existing pipelines as well as build feeds for new data sources.You will work closely with business partners and technology leaders to evaluate new tools that can further enhance the business’ ability to analyze data.You will participate in data architecture decisions and partner with technology teams to implement data products in production systems.This is a wide open opportunity for a motivated individual to use their skills to drive change in a high-visibility, challenging environment.Skills And Experience We Are Looking ForBachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines2+ years of software industry experience with strong analytical and problem solving skillsHands on experience in one of the mainstream programming language (Java, C++, etc.) using object-oriented design techniques and best practicesExperience of test-driven development, hands on experience with testing frameworks such as JUnit.Good understanding and experience in using data structures and algorithmsBasic understanding in working with SQL/NoSQLGood communication and interpersonal skillsPreferred QualificationsBasic understanding on any big data platform and data analysis methodologiesAt least 1 year experience dealing with data (structured or unstructured)Experience in working with SQL/NoSQL data stores (e.g. MongoDB)Good understanding of distributed and scalable system designWorking with client to transform requirements into software solutionsExperience working in a start-up business or a new business line within a larger organization is preferredWeb services development: RESTful APIs; Swagger; Jersey; GlassfishHands-on experience working with Linux and basic scripting (Bash)About Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.Division Engineering

Job_Title: Risk, Risk Engineering - Analytics & Reporting, Associate, Salt Lake City
Description: Risk, Risk Engineering - Analytics &  Reporting Associate  RISK The Risk Division aims to effectively identify, monitor, evaluate, and manage the firm’s financial and operational risks — including reputational risk — in support of the firm’s strategic plan.Our Risk division develops comprehensive processes to monitor, assess, and manage the risk of expected and unexpected events that may have an adverse impact on the firm. Risk teams play a critical function for the firm, driving how the firm takes and manages risk. Risk professionals execute critical day-to-day risk management activities, lead projects and contribute to the ongoing advancement of a robust risk management program. Effective coordination with executive management, business units, control departments and technology is critical for success.We are at the forefront of the most recent engineering solutions, including cloud computing and big data, to better manage compute costs for the firm given increasing demands related to asset pricing and scenario generation.Whether assessing the creditworthiness of the firm’s counterparties, monitoring market risks associated with trading activities, or offering analytical and regulatory compliance support, our work contributes directly to the firm’s success. The division is ideal for collaborative individuals who have strong ethics and attention to detail.Department OverviewRisk Engineering (RE) is a central part of the Goldman Sachs risk management framework, with a responsibility to provide robust metrics, data-driven insights, and effective technologies for risk measurement and management. RE is staffed globally with offices including Dallas, New Jersey, New York, Salt Lake City, London, Warsaw, Bengaluru and Tokyo. As a member of the RE team, you will interface with a variety of divisions around the firm. The interaction with numerous departments, and the ensuing diverse projects, create a challenging, varied and multi-dimensional work environment.The team is also responsible for aspects of the firm’s risk reporting to the firm’s senior management as well as risk-related regulatory requirements including financial statement disclosure, risk-based capital requirements (Basel III) and Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR). The group employs the complete capabilities of Risk Engineering to maximize significance, quality, efficiency, speed, and reliability while ensuring clear accountability and attribution of the analytics produced. As a member of the Analytics and Reporting Team within RE, you will play a key role in providing understanding of and insight into existing and emerging risks to the Firm, highlighting important and topical risk features, facilitating and informing risk management decisions, as well as certifying risk information for use in management, regulatory, and financial reporting.Responsibilities RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Analyse the risks inherent in the products GS transacts, including lending, trading and derivative products  Assist in quantifying risk and capital calculations for a large, diverse and complex risk portfolio. This involves designing, implementing and executing programmatic tools that query large data sets  Understand and interpret the metrics generated by models in order to perform risk analysis  Design and maintaining a set of controls that ensure the completeness and accuracy of quantitative measures  Report and present on exposures and capital at a risk party, product and portfolio level  Perform anomaly detections in large data sets, investigating the cause and recommending corrective actions  Interact with various other groups such as risk modelers, technology, trading desks and risk committees to explain the results of calculations and inform risk management decisions Qualifications Strong academic background, preferably in quantitative fields such as finance, economics, computer science, applied mathematics, engineering or statistics, though not required  Strong interest and familiarity with finance, financial markets and economic developments  Strong interest in working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment  Experience or keen interest to develop expertise in derivative products, and risk and capital calculation methodologies  Proficient in Excel. Programming skills preferred  Strong communication, interpersonal skills and ability to build relationships remotely with people from different departments and levels of seniority  Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple assignments concurrently About Goldman SachsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

Job_Title: Strats Deposit Modeler - Corporate Treasury Engineering - Finance Engineering
Description: The Corporate Treasury Strats team is looking for world class quantitative programmers to work closely with Corporate Treasury partners to employ quantitative analytics to drive optimizations of firm liquidity, cash and collateral management, funds transfer pricing and trade execution strategies. This is an integrated group which both explores new ideas for optimizing the funding management of the firm and also executes trading strategies, all in one team. Corporate Treasury lies at the heart of Goldman Sachs, ensuring that businesses have the appropriate level of funding to conduct their activities, while also optimizing the firm’s funding costs and managing liquidity risks. As part of the Corporate Treasury Engineering team you will be exposed to securities division and banking initiatives, to new business activities, and to critical strategic programs Goldman Sachs pursues to maintain its leadership among global financial institutions. Corporate Treasury Strats use their engineering and/or scientific background to implement quantitative analytics and management solutions in software. Corporate Treasury Engineering products guide funding souring decisions, allocation of financial resources, quantification of funding costs, and strategies to minimize costs and hedge risks. Successful strats are highly analytical, driven to own commercial outcomes, and communicate with precision and clarity.Corporate Treasury Strats welcomes applicants with Master’s or a PhD in financial engineering/financial math; quantitative sciences, e.g. physics, statistics, applied math or other quantitative discipline; or relevant professional experience. Strong analytical skills, mathematical fluency, and programming abilities are required.How You Will Fulfill Your Potential RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS  Use machine learning techniques and statistical modeling to develop pricing analytics and liquidity models for retail deposits including overnight deposits and term deposits Use experience in building linear and non-linear models to develop analytics to drive the growth of the deposit platform Develop software and analytics to further Corporate Treasury’s firmwide mandates: liquidity risk and interest rate risk management and trade execution, cash & collateral management, funding optimization Optimize the firm’s liability stack by developing balance sheet analytics and hedging strategies Work with treasury, desk strategists, and technology departments to implement processes to optimally leverage financial resources to achieve commercial priorities Perform quantitative analysis and facilitate business understanding of technical resultsSkills And Experience We Are Looking For Minimum 5 years of experience in a quantitative finance role Solid background in computer programming, Python, C++, Java, Matlab or equivalent language, preferably in large scale financial or technical computations Solid background in computer programming, Python, C++, Java, Matlab or equivalent language, preferably in large scale financial or technical computations Familiarity with financial markets and assets, with a preference for experience with asset pricing and metrics used to govern financial institutions. Excellent communication skills, including experience speaking to technical and business audiences and working globally Can apply entrepreneurial approach and passion to problem solving and product development Good knowledge of SQL and databases is a plusAbout Goldman SachsPreferred QualificationsThe Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.Â© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.Division Engineering
